Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dianna P
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights over St Patricks Day 2012. At the same time there was a teenager convention at the hotel so the lobby was always loud and crowded, even for the size of the lobby it was sometimes tough to navigate your way out the front doors. Our room was a corner room so we had a perfect view of Fairbanks and Ohio streets and the lights at night gave an awesome view. However, the streets are very noisy at night so that woke us up a couple times, but it was worth the view! The hotel elevators are very slow, there are four elevators for 25 floors and you can only get about 8 people in an elevator at a time. We weren't disapointed with this hotel, it was within walking distance to Navy Pier and a long walk to Millenium Park and downtown. We did take the train to/from Midway airport, this cost about $2.25 per person each way which is much cheaper than the $40 each way a taxi would have cost....but beware....the train is not a comfortable way to travel and if you have kids and luggage I would recommend a cab. The train stations are dirty, smell like urine and have scary people lurking about, please dont take your kids down there! But this hotel is about 6 blocks from the Grand St train. The train ride was about 40 minutes to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a perfectly nice place”
Reviews.Author: scott s
Reviews.Content: Did one night here this past weekend, It is a great location, three blocks from michigan avenue, property is very clean, clearly has been renovated. Weird old and kind of gross radiator in bathroom that was on and made it hot, other than that room was nice, clean no issues at all. One suggestion, park across Ohio not in the garage at hotel, it is 31 dollars a day there and 45 or more at hotel and the garage is literally across the street. No pictures, but web site pics are accurate. Cookie is a nice touch at check in, but be careful, it melts.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beds, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: CaribeTraveller
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree at Fairbanks and Ohio is an excellent location for trekking downtown Chicago. State Street and Michigan Avenue are very near with safe areas for walking. Restaurants and taverns abound. The desk staff, concierge, and bellmen were all very helpful. And who can resist those warm cookies. The rooms are on the small side, and the in-house restaurant is only okay. There is very little storage area in the bath, but the shower is wonderful. Overall, a very good choice for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet at night, unlike other nearby hotels”
Reviews.Author: J G
Reviews.Content: The first important thing to know about this hotel is that it is quiet at night. Usually that's something that doesn't need to be mentioned. However, for this part of Chicago, it does matter. Before booking, I read reviews on tripadvisor of most of the other nearby hotels in this price range, and many of them are full of complaints about street noise or nightclub noise. For example, a few blocks from this Doubletree there is a hotel in the same price class that is located directly above a fire station. I found no such complaints about noise at this hotel, so that's why I booked it, and I was glad that I did. This hotel is on a street that is quiet enough at night that I was not bothered at all. Despite being on a low floor (8 out of 23), street noise was not a problem, and there was no noisy nightclub. If you want a location that's in the thick of things, for shopping etc., stay closer to Michigan Ave, but if you want to sleep at night stay a few blocks closer to Lake Michigan, like this hotel. Other things to know: The rooms are big and still nearly new. Mattresses are good. Adjoining rooms with two queens are available -- that worked just right for my family. The front desk workers were eager to help; half of them were trainees when I arrived, but it worked fine. This is generally like other Doubletree hotels, except that the front entrance is a little obscure -- upon arrival we found ourselves walking around trying to find it -- it turns out that the main entrance for pedestrians looks a lot like the drive-through entrance to a parking garage. The poolside is not open in late March, if you want to sit outside on a warm day. The TV has a reasonably large number of channels. For example, it has ESPN and ESPN2 but not ESPNU. There are plenty of places for a family to eat nearby. Once our family stayed on the other side of the river in Chicago, at the fancy Fairmont (which we chose because it was close to museums) but there were hardly any places to eat around there. This is a much better location for a family that needs to find a place to eat. You have to walk several blocks to get to the MTA red-line. If you want a location closer to the red-line station, you'll probably get more street noise at night. It's about one block from a stop for bus number 151, which will take you to Lincoln Park.

Reviews.Title: “The most nasty hotel stuff i ever been”
Reviews.Author: cacorro
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in this doubletree hotel in Chicago, i've been in different doubletree hotels before and people were nice but since i checked in at this hotel in Chicago i have notice about that,front desk agents are not rude.... they are nasty.... The agent checked me in,was trainning a new person,i was not welcoming to the hotel... he just asked me for my ID and c.c. I asked him for internet service.... His answer was...$ 9.95 per day,but he didn't explained to me how that works,he didn't explained to me about the property,about service. I request to get fixed the phone in my room,i'm going to check out today and it didn't get fix. Next day after checked in i went to the front desk to talk to the manager....She came out with not friendly face and said YES... I was explaining to her about was going on with agents and how rude they are,how come the person like that attending guest and she just stopped me and she said that..... WHAT YOU WANT TODAY? That was a question from the MANAGER to a guest who was complaining. The stuff here when you request something or ask for directions..... The answer is.... no,i don't know,i can't.... I'm not sure what's wrong with this people here but they look unhappy,angry and tired. I just posted it because people read reviews should know what they expect on this hotel,i travel every week to a different cities and it is the first time nobody at the hotel care about my complaint or apologize.

Reviews.Title: “A lot, for a little”
Reviews.Author: FLYINGWARRIOR1966
Reviews.Content: Lobby small but neat. Warm cookies upon checkin is a nice to touch. Lobby has a bar, Einstien's Bagel Shop in the lobby too as well Asa restaurant and gift shop. Room had two double beds and a city view from 19 floors up. Large LG afloat screen was nice too. The room even had a window seat. Bathroom was a decent size ..though no exhaust fan. I think it is an older hotel that they revamped and adding an exhaust fan probably is not the easiest thing to do. only complaint/observation was the tables/nightstands were a little dusty ..a housekeeping over site I think. location was amazing a couple blocks and you are on the mag mile. Plenty of shops, restaurants and more. so affordable ..I got 3 nights for a total of $286.00 (from Spirit Airlines package rate). I would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay at the main Hilton when this place is so good!”
Reviews.Author: z6666
Reviews.Content: Ok so maybe there is a bit less gold leaf and the doorman doesn't wear a top hat but apart from that I cannot understand why people would pay twice as much for the main Hilton Check in was quick and friendly. The concierge and bell boys were always around ready to help. The room was spacious, very clean with very comfortable beds and pillows. The mini bar was well stocked and the wifi signal was strong and reliable ( I watched movies on Netflix on it). The restaurant serves an excellent breakfast and wide range of other dishes. I can find nothing to fault this hotel. It is one I would definitely reccomend for business or pleasure given its location and the doubletree brand is one I will use again instead of main Hilton if this is the quality of their hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: recycleclonmel
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in Feb 2012. Very comfortable rooms and the staff very helpful also. Ideal location as it is walking distance from all the big named shops. We would stay again, defiantly.

Reviews.Title: “Above average hotel, housekeeping lacked”
Reviews.Author: JLFog
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the Chicago Marathon, so a very busy time for the hotel. Check-in went smoothly, they even had a room ready for us early, which was nice. Room was adequate sized for a city hotel, and location is great, very convenient. My only complaint is that housekeeping was practically absent during our stay. We came back after the marathon, exhausted, around 3pm and our room hadn't been touched yet, and we left at 6am! All we wanted was our beds made and fresh towels, then we had to hunt down housekeeping just to get them to do this finally after 4pm. But, nonethless I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: michiganredrose
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the weekend, the location was fabulous. The only issue we had was the blankets. The pull-out had a sheet and one of those weird typical hotel blankets. My son called and asked for a blanket and they brought him another one of the weird sticky blankets. The next night he went down to the desk and asked for a comforter, they said they would send one up. The next thing we knew they showed up at the door with 2 more sticky blankets. After we got done laughing we decided that we would give up on that request. The bed was super comfy, the pillows were wonderful. We had absolutely no issue with hot water or water pressure. The employees were very friendly and had no problems giving the kids cookies whenever they asked. Would love to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: hawk72rn
Reviews.Content: stayed twice in the last month. both experiences pleasant. friendly staff, clean and comfortable room, great location. the beds are wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for location ...”
Reviews.Author: colden197
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while attending an event at the Mccormick center. I see someone else mentioned the water pressure in the shower. There was no hot water to be had from the shower. To top that off, on the day of the AFC East playoff game the signal on the TV went haywire and we missed the winning field goal. Instant replay is nice, if that wasn't screwed up too ! Apparently the TV in the bar area is dish and in the rooms its a different signal. Would have gotten dressed and gone back down to the bar if we weren't exhausted from walking and shopping all day. A hot shower would have been nice to boot ! The "maintenance" man showed up and my fiance had to walk him through a temporary fix (after he left and returned 3 times with different mcgyver tools !) Also, better bring everything you need, there was no shower cap, or maybe thats because they knew the shower was non working ! The teeny, tiny bottles of shampoo, cream rinse and body lotion are enough for one use, and they only stocked the room with 2 small bars of soap. Yes, the staff is friendly enough but that doesn't make up for what was missing on our visit.

Reviews.Title: “This Doubletree does not Disappoint”
Reviews.Author: MaryGoody
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a terrific location for shopping the Mag Mile, great restaurants and Navy Pier. From here you can walk to most downtown sights. What really makes this place special however is the STAFF. Although we only go there once or twice a year, they remember us and they are welcoming and very accomodating. The rooms are clean, upscale and quiet. The rates are very good. This time we called directly and got a wonderful rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: crazysox4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located ideally in Chicago for shopping and Navy Pier.The rooms are nice -- we were up on the 26th floor and didn't have to deal too much with noise or anything. Not a ton of water pressure in the shower, but that's minor. The bellboys were great help in getting cabs -- very nice and friendly. Overall, no complaints about our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Pool!”
Reviews.Author: alaskanbl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great! My wife and I stayed there this summer, so the review is a bit out of date. We stayed here three nights in the end of July. The location is fantastic. We were literally steps away from shopping and merely a block or two form the lake. We had a great view from our corner suite. Rooms were nice, nothing special, but still nice. THe mini bar is a bit over priced, but that goes without sayings. One of our favorite parts were the pool. Talk about a view! could see Sears Tower(aka WIllis). Just a wonderful place to stay. I pricelined it and got it for eighty bucks! we did not park here, others we would have been out 45 bucks.

Reviews.Title: “good average hotel in downtown chicago”
Reviews.Author: BAS724
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 nights on business while attending a trade show at mccormick center about 3 miles away. When I arrived around 9am I was very happy to hear that my room was ready after a long flight. I was checked in by Pablo who was very friendly and handed me a nice warm cookie along with my room key. The room is just average. This is an older property which has been renovated. The bathroom is dated but has everything you need for a 2 night stay. Noise was an issue. Free wifi in room was a plus. The walls are thin and the traffic noise is expected being it is located in the city. Not much sleep thats for sure altough the beds are comfortable. Not many restaurant choices close to the hotel so a cab ride is necessary. All in all an average hotel in the heart of downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Good Chicago base - fantastic concierge!”
Reviews.Author: AussieTraveller111
Reviews.Content: This was a great base to see Chcago from. It's close to everything, the room was clean and quiet (considering it's in a big city) and we felt safe. But the highlight was the concierge. He had info sheets on EVERYTHING which included a map, how to get there on public transport and some recommended restaurants in the vicinity. We enjoyed each restaurant we tried on his lists and the maps/directions/suggestions really made our trip. One downside, there are no room safes. So you have to use the safes in the lobby where sometimes the bigger ones are full (ie size required fora 35mm camera). Also parking is expensive in the area but if you are just leaving your car there are some garages with lower dailyrates within a block.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Comfortable Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ThatSemanticsGuy
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight with my daughter on a trip through Chicago, but also lived in Chicago for a number of years so was familiar with the area. First, the good: everyone at the hotel was very helpful and friendly, providing a warm welcome that is especially nice after a long flight. The cookies, handed to you warm, are a nice touch as well. We had several questions of the hotel staff during our stay, and all were answered quickly and accurately. The check-in and check-out were both smooth, as was the process for storing and retrieving our luggage after checking out. We got a room on a high floor with a view north, which includes the Hancock building and the lake. The room itself was nicely appointed, with two comfortable beds and plenty of pillows and towels for the two of us. Everything was clean and well maintained, including the exercise room, which we also used. Even with all the ambient light put out by the city and the street noise outside, the room was both dark and quiet. The location of the hotel is very convenient for visiting Chicago -- Michigan Avenue is close by for shopping, tons of restaurants are located close by, and Millennium Park is also just a short way down Michigan Avenue to the south. The Art Institute and the contemporary art museum are both close by (the latter is fairly close, the former a bit further away, past Millennium Park), and the nightlife available on Rush, as well as some of the fun places up in Old Town, are all a short cab ride away. Public transit is close by as well, with both buses and the subway easily reachable from the hotel. Now, the bad, and this is a very short list: I would have liked free wireless in the rooms. Instead, you have to pay a fairly significant amount for this. Free wireless is available in the lobby, though, so it is available, just not as convenient as one would like. Overall, my daughter and I had a wonderful stay at the hotel and would be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, updated 70's feel, very modern”
Reviews.Author: K_birke2002
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel. We are in our early 20s. The rooms were very clean and well decorate with a modern flat screen tv. The bathroom was a decent size. The location was about 2 blocks from the Magnificent Mile and about 3 blocks from Navy Pier. There were always taxis near by although we walked most everywhere. I was especially surprised that the hotel shampoo and conditioner did not seem to dry out my hair. I did not like that the hotel did not offer any type of continental breakfast but I knew this in advance. There was no vending on the floor, only at the gift shop on the lobby level Also, I have sensitive skin and the bedding made me break out in hives so I was happy that I packed my Benadryl. It was a great weekend stay with a beautiful view.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Affordable, Friendly, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Meg W
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a trip to Chicago with a friend. We stayed at the Double Tree because its updated, affordable and in a great location: 2 blocks from Michigan Avenue! Making a phone reservation was a breeze. Check in was very friendly, Pablo was very helpful and the cookies they give you are always a plus. We were able to check in early, so that was great! After check out, they did store our baggage for us so we could spend more time walking around. Concierge was very quick and friendly. The room was clean and modern. Everything was in nice shape. We had a great view from the 10th floor facing the front door side of the hotel. The beds have great pillows and comforters!!! One negative thing would be the weird sensor bar they have for the snacks. Don't pick them up or I guess you get charged! The walls are a little thin, so if you are a light sleeper you might want earplugs, especially if you are near the elevator. I think we just had a loud group next to us and that's why we woke up once. (The beds are very comfy, so we went right back to sleep!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tourguiderich
Reviews.Content: This hotel has done a reno in the past couple years that really makes the lobby attractive. The rooms are fairly modern as well. The location (2 blocks to Mag Mile) is ideal and the warm baked cookies are a great added touch. Staff was very friendly as well. Had breakfast in the hotel restaurant and it was pretty good as well although the $20 cost was a bit high.

Reviews.Title: “Younger Crowd”
Reviews.Author: K-MACH
Reviews.Content: Location: Plenty of nice restaurants in walking distance, easy access to downtown. I didn't have time, but nice shopping options in the vicinity. The room: Nice and clean. Effective black-out curtains, comfy bed. I got a good rest before my long and busy days. What's not so good? Internet: The basic internet package is e-mails and essentials only, and you pay per device. Double the price for the full package. Guests(?) I wasn't bothered too much, but the guests were younger on average, at least on my floor, which caused occasional bursts of noise in the hall each time they left their party to get ice for their drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for shopping, eating, and enjoying Chicago”
Reviews.Author: glofish5
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Doubletree on our way to celebrating Christmas with family. The location is great. We could walk everywhere we wanted to go. Shopping on Michigan Avenue is fun especially just before Christmas. We traveled light because we went by train so we didnâ€™t buy much but it was fun to look early in the morning before the shopping got crowded. The hotel is lovely with a beautiful lobby. We paid extra for a lake view room. It was a partial view but very nice. We had a good size room and we liked the window seats. Loved the room but the mini-bar seemed passÃ©. (There was a scary sign on it that said sensors controlled the snack and drink contents and we would be changed accordingly.) When you need a break from shopping, stop at Water Tower Place for a quick snack at Wow Bao for the Chinese-style, meat-filled steamed buns. There are tables just up the escalator, one level above. There are many restaurants. We tried a great tapas restaurant very near the hotel called Emilioâ€™s Tapas Sol y Nieve. An extra plus is the very convenient, large Dominickâ€™s grocery store just two blocks from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay for business.”
Reviews.Author: DSchrute
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the Doubletree for an annual conference for my company with about 100 other attendees. Rooms were nice, very comfortable bed and good pillow selection. Bathroom was a bit rough with old brackets still on the wall from something that was removed awhile ago and the ceiling looked a little yellow and was bubbling from moisture. I really can't complain as I got a steal for only $66 per night on the hotels website if I prepaid (which I did). Customer service was spotty as me and several of my colleagues experienced conflicting information refarding everyhing from parking fees to late check out. The meeting facility was good and the in-house food was excellent. All in all a good stay in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: kay-cee-1138
Reviews.Content: I did quite a bit of research for hotels near downtown, and finally settled on the Doubletree mostly for its central location. And it turned out to be just about perfect. A few blocks to the east is Navy Pier; a few blocks south is the river and Loop; a few blocks north is Hancock Center; a couple of blocks to the west is Michigan Ave (aka, Magnificent Mile shopping); and just a block to the south is a small, well-stocked grocery store (Dominick's). Our room was clean and well-appointed, which was enough, considering that we only slept there. Staff seemed nice enough; the complimentary cookies on check-in were much appreciated! Not too much in the way of in-house facilities: no restaurant, and the attached bagel shop was never worth the bother or expense. Does appear to have a concierge desk, but I never used that service. One thing for families: the snack trays in the rooms have pressure sensors; need to keep the kids' hands away from the items to avoid any inadvertant automatic charges for nudged or bumped snacks. Overall, the Doubletree proved to be a very good home base for sights and activities on the north side of town. Room cost was about $109/night (plus another $17/night in taxes).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great spot”
Reviews.Author: kazal22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree from Dec 3rd to 8th. The staff are very helpful and extremely knowledgeable about the area around the hotel and Chicago in general. The magnificent mile shopping is only 5 minutes from the hotel, Navy Pier maybe 10 minutes, Hancock Tower 15 minutes, all of these a must for Chicago visitors. Malls I hadn't seen before,North Gate and The Water Tower (8 years since my last visit) were fantastically decorated for Christmas, although everywhere looked great. For the ladies the shopping is truly amazing, bargains everywhere so take comfy shoes guys. Going up the Hancock Tower just has to be done but pick a nice day, the views are worth it. Navy Pier is a Chicago landmark and although the shops are mainly souvenir outlets the indoor gardens and the outdoor ferris wheel and views mean you need to see it. The park at the front of Navy Pier has some nice sculptures as well. If you are a music fan (and I am a huge blues music fan) Chicago can accomodate you. Jazz or blues clubs and several piano bars are all over the place. House of Blues is a big venue but smaller clubs such as Blue Chicago, a particular favourite of ours, provide an intimate and close up view of the action. To see the blues played in this atmosphere is a great night out. OK that's the good stuff now the drawback. Apparently Illinois has some of the most severe alcohol taxes in the US so if you like a drink it isn't cheap. Last thing,the weather, Chicago isn't called the windy city for nothing and it was very cold, just about freezing every day. So if you are going for Christmas shopping, and it's well worth it, make sure you take gloves a hat and a scarf and duck into Starbucks regularly for coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Good Staff”
Reviews.Author: fruityc
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 2419 recently. Paid extra for the lake view. Yes, you can see the lake but it is partially blocked by some buildings. This was a nice hotel and cleaner/nicer than most I've stayed in. The staff was great too. I have no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Does not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Eyala
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and clean and the location is great. However: 1. Internet in the room costs $10/day. For a $220 room charge one would expect free wireless. 2. No breakfast room - just an adjacent bagel store with bad coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: hopeless56
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend in November. Just a short walk to Michigan Ave. which is beautiful this time of year, with all the trees and stores decorated for Christmas. We had no problems with the room, bed was wonderful (bedding a 10). Had a corner room with a view, quiet and clean. And the warm chocolate chip cookies are to die for. Would put this on our list of "places to stay in Chicago, reasonable price and good location".

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: redsgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed the night on an annual shopping trip. The hotel is two blocks from Michigan Avenue shopping. Upon arrival the front desk was very friendly and helpful. Bellman very personable and helpful with luggage. Rooms were decorated nicely, clean and beds very comfortable. Coffee shop and restaurant on premises. My only complaint, Internet in rooms a little pricey and not sure whether I like the bar in the lobby area. I would recommend this to my family and friends for a pleasant stay and hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in an above average city.”
Reviews.Author: LeisureLadyJ
Reviews.Content: I went to Chicago last minute when a friends' travel companion cancelled 2 days beforehand. She had booked at the Chicago Doubletree Magnificent Mile because her daughter was taking part in a dance conference so I followed suit. The location of the DoubleTree Magnificent Mile hotel is excellent...it took us 5 minutes by taxi to get to Michigan Avenue, where all the shops are (10-15 minute walk) and mostly everywhere we wanted to go was a less than 10 minute taxi from the hotel. The cookies we received upon arrival were excellent! The lobby is very awkward and strange to hang around in. The parking rates of $43 a day are simply ridiculous but you do have in and out privileges which many places do not. Ben the parking manager is outstanding. Watch your phone rates! My companion was NOT told that each call made has a MINIMUM $20-$25 "connection fee" ON TOP of the crazy expensive phone rates so a couple of calls cost her over $150 dollars. I booked a "lake view" room which was nice but had many issues. First of all I paid $189 for a "lake view" room instead of $159 for a room with no lake view only to discover that the "lake view" is a peek of the lake through the surrounding buildings. I was surprised that there was no fan in the bathroom which is particularly annoying when you try to see yourself in the mirror after a steamy shower. The selection of toiletries was limited. There was also no safe, which always makes me nervous when leaving items in my room. There was an old sushi tray left in the mini bar that smelled awful and an old carafe and drinking glass that were filthy and left in the room. Room service was very good and timely -I had a chicken cobb salad which was delicious and the bread was very fresh and tasty. The trays that I left in the hallway (which I was asked to do) after I was done were not picked up for almost 24 hours. Watch the items on top of and inside the mini bar; once you pick them up, you are charged so make sure you check your bill upon checkout. I asked for a "quiet" room on a high floor (it was on the 23rd floor) but was put on a floor with several families with small (and noisy) children. There is no free in-room wifi but in the hotel public areas and lobby there is. When we asked the front desk for recommendations for breakfast, many things in the area were recommended except for "West Egg" which is right in front of the hotel and turned out to be the best we had. All in all, an average hotel that is sufficient for a night or two if you are not picky. Next time I am in Chicago I will definitely look at all my other options first.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Tal K
Reviews.Content: I stayed at that hotel last year around the same time. My feeling is that there is a significant decrease in the level of maintenance. First of all, I got two queen beds instead of a single king. They said the king size bed was not confirmed. Well, they should have stressed that at the time of reservation. My main problem with the room was the bathroom. There was mold on the bathroom ceiling, and the paint was peeling. There was also an ugly green sticky thing on my shower curtain. The sink was clogged. I called reception and complained about this stuff. the only thing they did was to fix the sink. Other than that, my bed had a worn out mattress. This is not a singular incident. One of my colleagues got a moldy room. The mold was so bad the the room really stank. As they were fully booked, he had to stay a night in that awful room until they transfered him to a different room. To their credit, I would like to mention they gave him a 100$ voucher to the hotel restaurant, which is very good. Overall, for the price paid, we could have done better. Next year, we will book another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pay for this, pay for that, pay to breathe...”
Reviews.Author: cy1229
Reviews.Content: ...ok it's not really quite that bad, but pretty close! First the good things: My room was very clean. I had a king room on the 14th floor overlooking the outdoor pool and parking garage. Had a pretty good view of the Hancock building (when it wasn't raining!). Nice work space, quiet room, comfortable bedding. Accessing the business center was great. The location is very convenient, and the bagel and coffee place in the lobby was perfect for breakfast. There's an inexpensive bakery / sandwich shop one block north which was very good. Now for the not-so-good. Every time I turned around I felt like this restaurant had their hands in my wallet. There's a snack bar alongside the coffee maker, with extremely overpriced snacks and a sensor, so if you even pick up the item, your room is charged. Really? So if I drop something while making coffee and it knocks the sensor I'll be charged $7 for a package of candy? Ridiculous. Internet is $9.95 per day for SLOW, or $19.95 for what I imagine is decent speed. Parking is $43 per night. Food from room service (in-house restaurant) was a mixed bag. Entree was just ok, but bread pudding dessert was fabulous. Noise from the street was pretty loud but I wouldn't put that all on the hotel. In short, what started as a $550 for 2 nights bill wound up being well over $700 when I factored in parking, internet, and room service for ONE dinner. SO glad I was staying on business or I would have really been annoyed. It may be right downtown, but for me it just wasn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “good quality”
Reviews.Author: James J
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel during a horrific moving experience, the staff were friendly and professional and were able to accomodate my high floor request with a smile. If I have friends coming in from out of town I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel, nice decor and fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared to dig deep into your pokets”
Reviews.Author: I C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a ripoff! We paid $265 for a double queen and $43/day for parking!!!! And the list goes on. You pay for in room wi-fi, for the computer room downstairs, for local phone calls. Rooms are small and cleanliness is below expectations. I had to scrape old dried up soap drippings in the tub, plug was broken and hot/cold taps were reversed. Hotel has a pool but it is outside (they forgot to mention the outdoor part on the website - go figure!!) and therefore it is useless for most part of the year. They do not provide cribs as advertised on their website. No fridge or microwave in the room or anywhere in the hotel. I had a very hard time with preserving/heating the baby food for the three days we spent there. NOT FAMILY FRIENDLY AT ALL! Staff was overwhelmed and slow in attending to your needs. I called a bunch of times the front desk and nobody picked up. One of the elevators broke in the second day of our stay (I almost got stuck in there) and it was not fixed by the time we left. And believe me, the hotel was busy! View was great at the 25th floor but it was not worth the money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Sara34678
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was perfect - blocks away from Michigan Avenue and Millenium Park. Parking was expensive so look into this if you are renting a car.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Good Location/pay for parking and Internet”
Reviews.Author: CRMotorbikes
Reviews.Content: The front desk was very courteous and helpful. The room was very clean and spacious, with nice touches. The rates seemed reasonable until you pay for parking and the Internet. That is my only complaint. I would still go back, but know the extra charges.

Reviews.Title: “Location and a Cookie!”
Reviews.Author: KRob_SD
Reviews.Content: My first time in Chicago on a spur of the moment trip with my college girlfriends lead us to stay at the Doubletree for its good price, and great location. We couldn't have been happier to be able to walk to all the attractions, bars, retaurants, and subway stations from this hotel. 4 girls shared a room with 2 queen beds up on the 21st floor. We had am amazing city view of the clock tower over on the magnificent mile. The room was extremely clean, and there was plenty of mirror space for all of us to get ready! The staff had a whole cast of characters that were beyond friendly and went out of their way to help us enjoy the most of our chicago expierience! They told us about all the good party spots, and best restaurants and also gave us discount coupons for the restaurants! You name it these guys had an answer. Chicago has a fun party scene that stays open till the wee hours of the morning. Each night/morning when we would return from the club the front desk staff offered us a warm cookie to send us off to bed, it was so nice! Clean, great staff, and excellent location! You can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: orph
Reviews.Content: I noticed a lot of the reviews of this hotel talk about location as its best selling point, and having stayed there, I can see why. From the hotel you can walk to Michigan Ave in just a couple of minutes, and down to Navy Pier in a few more. There are also bus stops nearby to take you to other tourist locations around town, particularly the park and museum areas. The area also felt very safe, even walking around in the early hours of the morning. And there's plenty of great restaurants within walking distance. The hotel itself is comfortable, with spacious rooms and serviceable bathrooms. It has been renovated in parts, but there are stark differences between sections that have been upgraded, and those left as is. The faded chartruese green of the elevator lobby on each floor is a good example. This can be overlooked however, since the rooms and bathrooms are clean and pleasant to stay in. Air conditioning worked well, comfortable bed, and the bathroom, while a little spartan by hotel standards, was large with nice water pressure from the shower. There's a spacious bar and lobby area downstairs with plenty of couch space for sitting back with a drink and taking advantage of the free WiFi. The bagel place just off the lobby was also convenient for grabbing a quick breakfast before heading out for the day. Checkin was a breeze, and the all of the staff from the bellboys to the reception to the concierge were friendly and welcoming. If you don't mind the slightly dated feel of the place, then this hotel is a nice, comfortable and well located option for your stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ryanp1983
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Chicago and was there for the marathon. After a 9 hour flight from the UK it was fantastic to be greeted with a warm cookie upon arrival. The location of the hotel can't be beaten. Close to everything that is going on in Chicago. Restaurants, bars and sightseeing all within walking distance. The room was clean and spacious and cannot be faulted. The cleaner seeing I had used a large amount of tissues due to a having a cold even left an extra box for me. Free Wifi in the lobby is a great service. and the gym seemed to be under used by guests as I was always in there alone. All the equipment was clean and in good condition. I didn't eat in very often but when I did the food was to a high standard and I even managed to find a decent cup of tea from the Bagel shop in the lobby which is rare anywhere in the US. I loved Chicago and will definetly be returning when I do I will be looking to stay again at the Doubletree.

Reviews.Title: “3.5 almost a 4 star..”
Reviews.Author: imreading
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights at this property in October. As I am a frequent business traveler to Chicago I have stayed at 30+ properties downtown. This was my first stay at the Doubletree. Check in was smooth. The room had two queen beds, duvet cover, flat screen TV. I noticed the walls had Spackle and a bad job sanding painting particularly in the bathroom on one wall and the ceiling. There is an Einstein Bagel and coffee shop off the lobby. The bar and restaurant is quite nice. Workout area off the lobby (which is a demerit in my book, don't care to tromp past all other guests after and before working out) I did notice the front desk staff in the morning was much more interested in conversing between themselves vs. assisting folks with check out. Rather a cavalier attitude. With some updating and staff management this could be 4 stars in no time. I will say my room had THE BEST SHOWER PRESSURE I have had the pleasure of experiencing in several years. What a nice surprise. As others have noted there are many choices of restaurants and shopping with a quick cab or walking distance. I wish I could give this property a higher score, however they just are not on par with other 4 star hotels such as the Monaco, Swissotel, Talbott or others downtown. An occasional visitor probably would not notice the difference I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: LDH80
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect location for our day in the city and night at Navy Pier. There are plenty of resturants and bars withing walking distance. If you're not one to walk, it's only a $5-$10 cab ride. The room was clean, comfortable, and modern. The staff was very polite and helpful. I really liked the cookie they gave us at check-in! We paid a little extra for a room with a view. We weren't disappointed! We received a room on the 24th floor with a view of Lake Michigan & the Hancock building. I do think that if your room is above the 8th floor and facing North you'd still get a pretty amazing view without the added price tag. The only thing that disappointed me was that I could near the person next door. However, I don't think that is necessarily because the walls were thin, but more that my neighbor was inconsiderate by literally screaming at 7:00 am.

Reviews.Title: “nice!”
Reviews.Author: babsZuerich
Reviews.Content: As we arrived, I realized very quickly that this hotel is more of a busy business hotel. The bellman took our belongings quickly upstairs and helped us to bring them into the room. We were concerned about the airport transfer the next morning and went to ask the concierge. We received a very strange and unfriendly to the point of rude response from one of the concierge's. We were quite disapointed but the next morning a wonderful bellman informed us that we could go with a hotel car for the same price as a taxi. The hotel itself is beautiful and since we booked on hotwire, the price was also beautiful! The view from our window was fantastic and we really enjoyed seeing that. I did not use any of the facilities so I cannot comment on that, but aside from the concierge experience, I would say it is a very good hotel. The hotel was mainly busy with business people and I did not see any families with small children. The beds are fantastic! I had the stomach flu and slept so well. I also didn't hear any noise at all, so the walls must be well insulated. You could hear the traffic outside though, but not so loud.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad choice but some stiff competition in the neighborhood...”
Reviews.Author: dcpatti
Reviews.Content: Stayed for just one night; check-in was chaotic and painfully slow, to the point that the doormen were handing out (hard/cold) Doubletree cookies to folks waiting in line. Just way too many guests coming and going for the 2 desk agents to handle. I think we waited about 12 minutes to check in. The lobby is very nice, comfortable and elegant at least. Room was spotless but a bit on the small side--- probably due to me being used to Hilton DIamond benefits, but as we were traveling on my fiance's Hilton account, we didn't get to use my benefits. Room decor was tasteful and we had a really nice view of Mag Mile; however, bed was a bit uncomfortable, as it transferred motion easily, and we got a lot of hallway noise, just from people slamming doors or talking in the halls whilst waiting for elevators. The wi-fi was a massive waste of money; my Mister and I both purchased the "upgraded" wi-fi which was supposed to be suitable for corporate VPN usage but we ended up giving up trying to work after about an hour because the bandwidth was so bad. Might have had something to do with them having a big conference going on but I guess if you can't provide faster bandwidth, don't charge more for it. The hotel has an Einstein Brothers adjacent to the lobby which does quite a business, judging from the line backed up into the lobby the next morning. Housekeeping starts working very early here so if you want to sleep in, make sure that Do not Disturb sign is up before you go to sleep. Neighborhood is fantastic, the edge of Mag Mile so all the shopping and dining is just a short walk away yet you don't have the crowds and crazy traffic on the same block. nice to see that Doubletree as a brand is upgrading bathroom amenities. I really liked the new shampoo/conditioner scents. All in all... I'd stay here again if the price was right, but in such a hotel-rich area, and given the usual price range, I'd probably choose somewhere else first; I wasn't so impressed that I'd hurry back, but not so put-off that I'd avoid it entirely.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for College Visits”
Reviews.Author: 75205Traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, quality, and price point for college visits. The hotel is hopping with business and the lobby is large and good for people-watching. Thin walls, but excusable at this price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice doormen!”
Reviews.Author: MISSYMIDWEST
Reviews.Content: The doormen were very nice. Rooms were clean. The bathrooms were large. Beds were comfortable. Lots of pillows and comfy down comforters. Hallways were quiet. The only annoying thing were the snacks. They're just standing on sensors so you have to be very careful you don't accidently knock them over or your room will be automatically charged after 10-15 seconds. That's the only reason I took off a star. Made us paranoid because we didn't want to be charged.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: valjapczyk
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with great view. We got this room through a Priceline bid for $75/night. The going hotel price was $169. The room was spacious and clean. Parking however cost $43 per 12-24 hour period. There is cheaper parking at Navy Pier for $20/24 hour. There is a magnificent cafe across the street from the hotel with excellent breakfast/lunch choices called West Egg Cafe. Much cheaper than the hotel's restaurant. Overall the hotel is within walking distance of all that downtown has to offer including Navy Pier.

Reviews.Title: “Oh Lord, the air conditioning :(”
Reviews.Author: Jstrieffler
Reviews.Content: Rates, location, rooms and service are good. But the a/c units are ridiculously loud. The weather for the first week of October was just gorgeous in Chicago and the air conditioning was needed pretty much all week. The units sound and feel like a diesel truck is idling outside of your window. Couple that with the down filled pillows that offer no head support and I had some pretty poor nights sleep. But overall, I did enjoy my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - awesome breakfest”
Reviews.Author: knauf
Reviews.Content: I've been to the doubletree in Chicago a couple of times in the past 3 years and it's a nice hotel they had an update to the rooms in the past year. Meeting rooms on the second floor are a bit small but other then that a nice hotel at a good price

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: sarahbelle85
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in the perfect spot..right in between Magnificent Mile and Navy Pier. It truly was the best value in the area. The hotel had been updated, but there were a few minor things that still need some work. Very modern decor as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: jennyprovo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a good location for everything we were doing. Navy Pier and Michigan Ave are only a few blocks away in either direction. The L is a bit of a walk but not too bad. The room was clean and comfortable. I found it strange that there we no Chicago guide books in the room like I have seen in other cities. Maybe you needed to go to the concierge for this I just like to browse this in the room. We already had a plan of where we were going so it wasnâ€™t a big deal. Parking was pretty pricey but not much more than the other garages in the area. You are paying for the convenience of having your car at the hotel. We did not eat at the hotel so I cannot comment on that. The cookies at check-in were fabulous. Overall we had a very good experience and would definitely book again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well located”
Reviews.Author: Bronco77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the main attraction locations. Navi Pier is only 10 minutes walk and the Magnificient Mile is only 2 bloks away. They serve delicious cookies during the check-in while mentioning that they are always available when needed. The hotel concierge can arrange all the tours and the shuttle services which saved me time during my 2 days visit. (Though, the lady in the concierge can not be considered as friendly). Wi-fi is not free in the rooms but free in the lobby. The room was clean and comfortable. Be aware that the minibar and the drinks on the table has a sensor, if you don't put back eg the water bottle in 10 seconds, you are automatically charged.

Reviews.Title: “Thin walls, dirty rooms, nice location”
Reviews.Author: Russ E
Reviews.Content: Our first room had peeling paint and mold on the bathroom ceiling, stains on the walls, visible dust and grime on the furniture and fixtures. Even the outlet faceplates and plugs had years of yellow/brown grime on them. When I called the front desk they told me to come down to the desk and they would switch my room. I offered to show them pictures of the problem which they did not want to see. They moved me to a comparable room with comparable filth minus the mold and peeling paint. They offered no apology and no assistance moving our things to the other room on a different floor. This was an issue because they only had one luggage cart available for all the guests and so it took multiple trips to move. The walls are very thin and we were able to hear everything going on in the neighboring rooms. I mean everything: sneezing, talking, water running, etc. We were not able to sleep through the night and neither was our child. If you can get past the filth, sleepless nights, and poor customer service the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dancer9265
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, good location, and very friendly. They also have a late night pizzeria that will deliver to your hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “four delightful nights in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: luv2cruise2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights on a bus trip from Kingston Ontario. The hotel was great, close to many sights, restaurants & a post office. We walked over to see the giant Marilyn Monroe statue but took a cab to see the illuminated Buckingham Fountain. All staff we encountered were friendly & helpful. The room on the 3rd floor was very nice although the hall carpeting needs attention We had one dinner included in the tour price & I was amazed to see what high quality food they gave us, right from the regular menu. The bread pudding with pecan ice cream was to die for so we went back for dinner another night. One night we just went to Paneras up the street. The included breakfast buffet was terrific & the waiters eager to please. I found it strange that grapefruit juice was one of the 3 choices rather than orange as grapefruit is not recommended with certain medications. I had my iphone with me so could only pick up wifi in the lobby which was fine. There's wired internet in the rooms. All in all a great time in a great place. I'd go back to this hotel & Chicago for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MKonijeti
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband and two kids age 5 and 10 over Labor Day weekend. The hotel is a little dated by looking at the carpets. We were on the 23rd floor and did have a nice view. I did not feel that the rooms were as clean as other hiltons in the Chicago area that we have stayed in but it was good enough. Beds are very comfortable and rooms are adequate size. The breakfast buffet was very good. One major complaint was the slowness of the elevators, it became a joke among guests as we stayed through the weekend, not sure if this was because of Labor Day or is a regular problem. Overall, if you can get a decent price I would stay but do not overpay, it is not much better than the Hilton Garden or Hampton Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Service was exceptional. Room had fabulous view.”
Reviews.Author: mkstewartesq
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended. Room was clean and beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Peoriaguy1000
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here on September 10th & 11th. & I would recommend this hotel. Rooms were clean & spacious. Bed was wonderful! Location is good. Hotel has an outdoor pool & it looked nice but I did not use it. Only minor complaints....elevators were slow in coming to the lobby even though they have 4 , ashtray pole outside the hotel was full & running over...my friend smokes & it was never cleaned during our 2 day stay, and the breakfast buffet in the resturant was average at best. House keeping forgot to leave bathtowels but a call to the front desk brought towels to the door quickly with an apology...great service!! Staff was very efficent & friendly...bell captain always found us a taxi quickly, and the front desk people definately gave #10 service. I will definately stay here again & recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...good location”
Reviews.Author: Seashells988
Reviews.Content: We were on the 10th floor of this hotel. It was nice but the decor of the hotel throughout was a bit too modern for my own taste. It was in a good location though and within walking distance to many sights.

Reviews.Title: “I'd give it a solid "B", maybe even a B+”
Reviews.Author: rn4trips124
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean public and private areas, (mostly) friendly staff, decent rate. Good-sized room. Stayed here for a weekend with my adult daughters for a "girls getaway". Enjoyed the proximity to the lake, Mag Mile, Navy Pier area, and eateries. We usually shop a fair amount when in Chi, but because we hit a fabulous stretch of weather we spent a lot of time at the beach, which was a nice change (and cheaper!). It's only a few blocks to Lake Michigan. We also enjoyed having a bite to eat and a drink at the rooftop pool - quite a large pool, clean, heated, nice for sunbathing. Good "perk". This is a "tourist class" hotel but one of the better ones IMO. I've not had good luck with Doubletree in the past, but this one was pretty nice. I was satisfied with the value for the dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Saltman347
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a long weekend. The rooms were quite good, the outdoor pool was great, and the location is just excellent, being in a walking distance to the magnificent mile on the one hand side (5 minutes walk) and Navy Pier on the other side (10 minutes walk). The restaurant at the hotel (Markethouse) was quite good The service and staff were not that friendly, but it was a very busy weekend, so I can forgive them for that..

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for a very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Cyclingsanta
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights -- a combination of business and family gathering. The room had the essential ammenities -- although our coffee maker was not restocked. This is a great location, near Michigan Ave., Navy Pier, restaurants, museums, etc. The Marketplace restaurant in the hotel is outstanding and the bagel shop there is a great morning convenience. The modest lobby with a small bar is very comfortable and we really enjoyed the outdoor swimming pool and its very large terrace with tables and chairs. Staff was very helpful with the inevitable odds and ends of an extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: ammefellow
Reviews.Content: My stay here was pretty much as expected - very comfortable room, good location just north of the river, walking distance to the Loop and close to Lake Michigan in one direction and Michigan Avenue in the other. The lobby has rather a soulless feel to it, but is the one place in the hotel where wifi is free. Lack of free wifi in the room was a pain, and is so unusual in the U.S. I appreciated the iron and ironing board provided in the room. The bathroom could have used a ceiling fan. I didn't eat at the hotel, but there are plenty of other options nearby, including a bagel shop inside the hotel if you want a quick, cheap breakfast, or West Egg across the road if you want to sit down to something a bit more substantial.

Reviews.Title: “Good but by no means great - damp smells and miserable staff”
Reviews.Author: Ascottowers
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this property a few years ago and back then I remembered that it ticked all the boxes well. Not now. I arrived to be met by the surliest of staff who had obviously had a bad day. No smile, no welcome back, just a cookie offered from their undercounter ovens. I popped up to my room and was met with an almighty smell of damp and mould when I opened the door. So I turned around and headed back to the front desk. The same member of staff clocked me and I could tell she wanted to leave the desk, but I managed to grab her attention and explain the problem. She said that there weren't many king-size bedrooms left and that the one she had given me was the only one left. (The problem is that this property caters more for folks who want a twin bed room). I simply asked that she look again and find me another room, one that did not stink of mould. A good five minutes later I was on my way with a fresh keycard for a different king size room on another floor, but again I was faced with the same issue. Damp and mouldy smells. I started to think that I was the problem, but I asked a chambermaid on the floor to come to the room and smell it for herself. She agreed. So I called the front desk and insisted that I be given another room. Ten minutes then passed and a guy armed with yet another set of keycards came up and took me to another room. He had worked out how to avoid any further problems as the new room stank too, but this time of furniture polish and air freshener. Having now seen three rooms, I decided to give in and take the nicer-smelling room. Apart from the smells, the room afforded great views over the corner of Columbus and Ohio towards the Embassy Suites, Dominick's and the Sheraton over near the river and Wacker Drive. This proved to be a boon as I had a lot of natural light. The other two rooms were further along the corridors and looked out onto offices, making the rooms darker. The room itself had what you would expect: big TV, free Puck coffee, neutrogena toiletries in the bathroom and a comfy bed complete with Sweet Dreams cushion. I used the gym a few times, it's on the ground floor past the front desk and then on the left. It's a Precor one and has all the modern aparatus you'd expect. I also had dinner at the Market restaurant on the ground floor. The food and service were both excellent. I also ate there in the morning as that is where breakfast is served. The buffet is not the biggest but the quality of the food on offer was just fine. As for the location of the property, it's just a few blocks from Michigan Avenue if you are into shopping, and also a few blocks from Navy Pier if you want to hang out and have fun with friends and family. So it's pretty central. If you need to go into the Loop area, it's just a good 20 minute walk before you're at the Sears (now Willis) tower. You could cab it but I find Chicago effortless to walk around, plus it's good exercise. All in all, I usually enjoy my stays at Doubletree properties. They're no Ritz Carltons, but normally they do the trick. Alas, the issue with the damp and mouldy smells emanating from two of the rooms I saw will make me think long and hard about whether I return, plus the surliness from the front desk staff member did the hotel no favours. I travel to Chicago a lot for my work, next time I will give a different property my business first.

Reviews.Title: “It was....fine (sigh...)”
Reviews.Author: hanajon
Reviews.Content: Don't want to be unfair. Great bed. Fine room. But the lobby has a vaguely tired air, and not in a Tom Waits hipster kind of way. A stain on a chair. A dated carpet. Ancient feeling elevators, but not classy. For just a bit more, I could have stayed in a 4-star hotel nearby that would have left me invigorated, not worn out. And charging for internet access is so...Stone Age. Jeez, guys, this is Chicago! This is the 21st Century!

Reviews.Title: “At least I was smart enough to stay here on a business trip from Hell!”
Reviews.Author: MlleDeVille
Reviews.Content: If I hadn't been staying in a nice hotel, I would've lost my mind on this trip. The trip was horrible from the start and I really couldn't wait to just stagger into my room on my torn and bloody feet and crawl into bed. Thank God for this place; it was in the middle of everything and was comfortable, clean, safe, and QUIET. My room even overlooked the pool and I was never disturbed by anyone or anything. I was here for a career fair and a series of job interviews and so I desperately needed to press my suits after my flights to look as polished as possible. The iron and ironing board provided in the room worked great for my purposes. Some downsides; one of the other candidates at the interviews also needed to press his shirt and the iron in his room didn't work. So he ran down to the front desk where they got him a replacement iron ASAP. But the thing that killed me was that the free wifi was only available in the lobby and everyone from this job fair had taken all of the available seating. I spent a sizable amount of money per night on this room and it hurt to have to spend additional $ just to get wifi in my room. Also, I needed to use the business center to reprint a cover letter that had been crinkled in my travels. The internet on the hotel computers worked at a glacial pace and they were charging you by the minute. All I needed to do was to open my Gmail and print this one page letter; it took me 15 minutes and $7 to do this. My reservation also included a free breakfast which was pretty decent; it was a buffet breakfast that had eggs, pancakes, sausage, bacon, etc. in addition to all of the continental breakfast usuals. I was definitely satisfied by this (especially since it was free!). This hotel is located near to the Navy Pier and the Magnificent Mile shops, so you will have plenty to do. Was out pretty late given the networking part of my career conference and I had no trouble or safety concerns. I hated my trip, but really did enjoy my stay at this hotel. I would recommend it if you need to stay in this area of Chicago. Just don't rely on the business center if you really need to print things...

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: pondguyOklahoma
Reviews.Content: Was a little nervous after reading previous reviews, but found the hotel very comfortable. The room was spacious by downtown Chicago standards and had the feel of a recent update. Nice flatscreen TV, air worked well, and minimal noise from the streets below. Very comfortable bed. All in all a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: toddmato
Reviews.Content: I wished I had stay my first night in Chicago here, the rooms were large beds were comfortable and it was at a good location for shopping and the navy pier..

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, bad service”
Reviews.Author: Heather_wr
Reviews.Content: This is not the first time I've been disappointed by Doubletree. The hotel itself is nice enough but amenities are ridiculously overpriced and the service is poor. We stayed 2 nights, the second day housekeeping had used our toilet and left a paper towel in it. Additionally, I have gotten charges on my account that shouldn't be there and nobody answers the phone. Last time I stayed in Seattle and there was no hot water for a shower. This time the shower had no barrier on the floor so the entire bathroom gets wet. The only plus is the the location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tennrose
Reviews.Content: My stay was very pleasant, the room was nice, and I slept well on the excellent mattress and pillows. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others. I only have one small complaint. They have these large shower heads that have very little water pressure. It was hard to get the shampoo out of my hair. This may be a measure put in place to conserve water, but that doesn't work when it takes twice as long to take a shower. That's my only complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but fair services”
Reviews.Author: Philasian
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to Navy Pier and Grand-Red station. Very close to the Magnificent Mile, the shopping street. People work in the hotel are friendly and helpful. There is even a bar in the lobby area, which is not large but a good size. However, the room service was not good. We were in Room 1019 from August 12 to 14. The coffee cups were not replenished. One day, the toilet bowel was not cleaned. The in-room air conditioning is very loud. The door is not sound-proof. We were awaken by neighbor very early one morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: 0707audrianna
Reviews.Content: I was worried about our upcoming 5 day stay based on reviews on triadvisor. However, when I arrived I was relieved. I didn't notice any dirty carpet or peeling paint. We were on the 18th floor. Perhaps the floors differ (remodeling?) but I'm not sure what the fuss is about. Check in went smooth and was time efficient. Concierge and doormen were always helpful. Restaurant (marketside) was fabulous with excellent service. We were the second room away from the elevator but never noticed any noise. Actually the place was pretty quiet and we often slept in past 9 am with no interruptions. Great stay... Even better price. Great location. Couldn't have asked for more!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice!”
Reviews.Author: Hammers_House
Reviews.Content: Would definitely return to this hotel....conveniently located in the Navy Pier district: close to Navy Pier, Magnificent Mile, Red Line (subway), and food district. Staff was wonderful, warm cookies to welcome you....clean rooms, very nice pool area on the 5th floor, helpful staff, beautiful lobby entrance and just overall and VERY PLEASANT place to choose. Thank you hotels,com......this was an excellent choice for my family and I!!

Reviews.Title: “Gross”
Reviews.Author: jandktravelers
Reviews.Content: The lobby carpet was filthy, trash was left on the floor, paint was peeling on the ceiling in our bathroom, and the electricity went out when we used the iron and the hair dryer at the same time. Also the hair dryer was so cheap it smelled like melting plastic when I used it. Friendly, helpful staff. Not well run or cared for. Sad. Could have been a good value, and it is in a really good location.

Reviews.Title: “Far better hotels in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: rjgrp
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Diamond VIP and used to amenities and appreciation from the Hilton family. My overall experience is that the Doubletree was a place where they are most comfortable telling you what they CAN'T do for you. It was odd... it seemed that no one really cared. Most odd for a Hilton property. The staff didn't seem happy to be there and any typical Diamond courtesies I usually receive were absent. The front glass doors looked like they hadn't been cleaned in days. The hotel lacked that typical downtown high end hotel polish. I have stayed at The Wit and the Hilton Garden Inn on Mag mile and had substantially better experiences there. The restaurant selection was limited, the food preparation mediocre and overall I felt that I was in an overpriced hotel restaurant. That was proven when I was overcharged for breakfast and not given the room type we requested. I will stay other places in Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Not a Gem”
Reviews.Author: fiddlebrian
Reviews.Content: The air-conditioning unit in my room was very, very loud and as the condensing unit cycled it made even more noise. I was telling someone else about my experience and lack of a good nights rest and he knew the hotel and told me that the corner rooms are the worst. The A/C in the hallways didn't seem to be working and the hotel had a bad odor to top things off. I hope to never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BWL10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2011 for two nights-a family getaway to see some sights in Chicago. The hotel is in a perfect location. It is within walking distance of Navy Pier, Oak St Beach, Millenium Park, Michigan Ave shops, the River area, etc....all within a 10 to 15 minute walk. There are also many restaurants, coffee shops, stores (including a full size Dominicks grocery store) within a block of the hotel. The actual hotel is in good shape-nothing fancy, but no complaints either. The rooms appear to be recently remodeled. The staff was very friendly and helpful with directiions and suggestions for restaurants. They also accomodated us with an early check in even though it was obvious that the hotel was very crowded. There is a nice outdoor pool area. There might be fancier hotels in Chicago, but if you are able to get a reasonable price and want a family friendly and comfortable place to stay, this works well.

Reviews.Title: “Deceving”
Reviews.Author: angie1007
Reviews.Content: Nice view, nice emplacement but we had really hard time to be refilled in towels, coffee, coffee cups, water glasses, wine glasses, etc. No sign for the door :do not disturbed, no coffee machine the first day. We stayed 10 days and everyday we had to ask for something because the maid never refilled properly even after we ask her two times. At the end we were really pissed off. Also theÂ climatisation in the room was not sufficient at maximum and water was dripping off on one meter around the climatisor on the carpet so the room was really humid and was smelling bad. Finally we saw few discusting stains on the sheets of the two beds and others when the maid change it after 5 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: indygirl8451
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree on Magnificent Mile for 4 days in July. Overall, we enjoyed our stay. Pros: Clean rooms/hotel Friendly staff Good location within walking distance to many areas of chicago Nice pool on 5th floor roof Cons: Pool out of towels one day Parking is $43 a day (we parked across the street for $31/day at an apartment building....much cheaper!) Cookies were stale at checkin Don't try to checkin early, they will make you wait until at least 1:30pm No breakfast available besides Einstein Bagels in lobby As for as paying extra for Lakeview room, save your money!! I posted some pics you can see the small view of the lake from that. Even the front desk lady stated that lakeview is just a "sliver" of the lake because of all the buildings in the way.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient, Good Amenities, Yet Friendly”
Reviews.Author: pbs142
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute one night quick visit, and the Doubletree was perfect. Arrived in a downpour but inside all was calm. Location is extremely convenient, offering easy access to major tourist and business sites as well as many eating and shopping options. The bath was modern and clean. The fitness center was well-equipped and not overcrowded. Staff was helpful but not obtrusive. Bed was comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: wildcat1974
Reviews.Content: My husband and our two young children spent two nights on a mini getaway. The Pros: We got a great rate on Hotwire. The location is convenient to the Mag Mile and Navy Pier. The hotel staff were very courteous. The hotel has recently been renovated. The Cons: The shower water pressure was non existent. The pool area was a bit dirty and two of the three times we visited, there were no towels. Despite the recent renovation, some areas, like the window seat in our room and the carpeting in the hall, were already stained. All in all, it met our needs. It was a well priced, centrally located spot in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but problems”
Reviews.Author: DWGropp
Reviews.Content: We were part of a Phillies Road Trip with AAA. They had requested early check in. We arrived around noon and were told rooms wouldnt be ready until 1:00. No problem. They held our luggage and went out to see the sights. Excellent location in the city (only good part of hotel). Came back at 1:30 and was told rooms would be ready around 2:00. No problem. Came back at 2:15 and was told rooms would be ready at 3:00. That turned into 3:30, and then 4:00 and then 4:30. We checked in at 4:45. No apologies. We were to get rooms close together and confirmed that when we first arrived. Now, there is no way to accommodate us. No apologies at all. Are you kidding me? Everyone had problems getting their room keys to work. It would usually work about the 15th attempt. No air conditioning in the halls or elevators. Crazy hot! Then the elevators didn't work the next morning. Business travelers were late to meetings. Front desk workers- even Pablo- just smiled and shrugged his shoulders. No vending. Ice machines didn't all work. You had to pay for paper and wifi. Restaurant was overpriced. Go across the street to West Egg Cafe for breakfast! Only good part of this hotel is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: aaatravelgal25
Reviews.Content: Although the location was convienient I encountered so many challenges staying here. The meeting rooms on the lower level were so cold, meeting attendees needed long sleeves, while the elevators and hotel corridors had no AC at all and the temps were very high. I had a room near the elevator and all night long one of the elevator's would "bing" at each floor stopped at, not just when it arrived at mine. The bar in the lobby wasn't open any of the evenings we were there, and the bar in the restaurant closed early, so many from our group ended up at a pub across the street. The printer in the business center wasn't working on day one of our meeting and the copier was broken on day two-unfortunately you had to call an 800 number for service since it seems to be contracted out to someone else. And, to add insult to injury, the boarding pass printer was down so you had to pay to use the printer in the business center to run boarding passes! On the good side, the rooms were clean and functional and the bed was very comfortable. And, the location right between Michigan Ave and Navy pier was very convienient. However, there are other convenient hotels in the same area-next time I'll choose one of those.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: pb630
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel and we couldn't have asked for a more perfect location for our stay in Chicago. The Magnificent Mile was just to the west, the Navy Pier to the east, Millennium Park to the south, and Northwestern University to the north -- all within walking distance of the hotel. The hotel itself seems to have been recently renovated as we had a room that was all updated and had a flat-screen TV (saw reviews earlier from about 4 or 5 months ago that said there was a tube TV in their room). I just wish we had more than two nights in the hotel and more time to just relax and enjoy the room, but since we only had three days in Chicago, we wanted to grab as much of the downtown core as we could. Service at the front desk was great and the staff was very friendly. We certainly would have no hesitation at all going back to the Doubletree again. However, there was one major incident that I think warrants mention - upon checking out, we were given the wrong bill/folio; we got somebody else's info including the person's home address, charge info, driver's license number, Hilton Honors, etc. I would be majorly ticked off if this had happened to me and my info was given to someone else (I sincerely hope this wasn't the case), and it caused problems when I wanted to present the bill to the border guards upon our re-entry back into Canada as proof of our stay in the U.S. I understand that accidents do happen, but something like this needs to be monitored more carefully to ensure that private information isn't given out to the wrong people. The check-out clerk was very friendly and remembered us from when we checked in, but he relied on his memory to pull up our info -- and he misremembered (thanks Roger Clemens for the use of that word) our room number by being off by one digit. What made it worse for me was that I sent an email to the hotel themselves, got no answer at all from them, then I emailed the Doubletree head office, it took them one week to finally answer me and that was a "stock" answer form saying to expect three business days for resolution of this issue. I am still awaiting resolution from them on this issue as I type this. All in all, I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone else -- just be careful that the right information is being entered or given to you. Tip: There's a major grocery store a block away called Dominick's -- it's great for picking up a dessert or snack to bring back to your room, or even to get a breakfast fruit platter with a dip. They have a wide assortment of beer/wine and there's a Starbucks inside as well. Great to stop in at any time you might need something for your room.

Reviews.Title: “Expected just a tad bit more from Hilton”
Reviews.Author: simonsmidt
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel last minute with Hhonors points for 4 nights. We, family of 4, got 1 room with 2 queen beds in it. The beds were much to my liking, not to my wife though, as she prefers hard beds. Room 1718 has place enough for 4, although I expected an LCD or plasma tv nowadays. This was still a tube television taking a lot of space. We were looking at the pool, which is on the fifth floor. You won't always have sun here because you get shadows from the skyscrapers surrounding the hotel. The room was made up every day, but it was not cleaned thoroughly, which was shown by the stains on the windows that stayed there during our stay. Bathroom looks ok, but a closer look at the ceiling showed that there was some leakage somewhere. See the pictures. You get a free copy of USA Today. In-room internet is paying 9,95/day, or for free in the lobby. At the ground floor there is a bagel shop, which we, as proper tourists, tried the first morning. The location is good, not perfect though. For that it should be a bit closer to Grand metro station. Now it is still a 6 block walk away. On the other hand it is just 2 blocks from Michigan Ave (Magnificent Mile=shopping street), and the Navy Pier.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously cool and modern hotel!”
Reviews.Author: deeladoll3
Reviews.Content: What a fun, energetic hotel! Rooms were modern and clean! The pool was fabulous! And the staff was very friendly and helpful! The central location is great for visiting the pier or all of that magnificent shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: JJesqbpc4
Reviews.Content: I was part of a girls-weekend in Chicago and we stayed at the Doubletree because its one of the only hotels with an outdoor pool. I was totally pleased with my stay, but we were not expecting the Ritz Carlton: PROS: - Good location: 2 blocks from Michigan Ave; 1 block from a full grocery store; close to running trail on Lakeshore; 5 blocks from subway/L stop (Grand/State Redline) - Room on 24th floor was remodeled and modern -- large sink vanity and cubbies underneath for 4 girls' toiletry bags! - Comfy beds - Nice pool area though we didn't get IN the pool - warm cookies at check-in - free continental breakfast for Honor's Gold Members CONS: - Shower didn't drain well.
