BUT we also didn't call for maintenance, so we can't really compain, right?! - Ice machine on our floor was out-of-order, so we had to trek up a floor

Reviews.Title: “Gem in heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: wisgirl01
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many hotels in Chicago, and this ranks among my faves. Excellent service, location and amenities. The rooms are very modern, nice sized, great bedding and impeccably clean, and bath amenities were upscale. The outdoor rooftop pool was an awesome reprieve from the city heat. Hotel is within walking distance to just about any mag mile/river north restaurants. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, fairly typical Doubletree - great location”
Reviews.Author: seawall77
Reviews.Content: The Mag Mile Doubletree is a nice hotel. Fairly cool lobby. Slow elevators. Nice, modern rooms. The big plus for us was the high floor room with the spectacular view that included the Tribune Building, Trump Tower and Sears tower. Wonderful view from our sort of corner room. The common hallway on our floor was in need of a renovation. A bit dated and fairly worn down. The restaurant is modern but the breakfast is standard Doubletree - maybe a step above. The fruit was cut nicely. I especially liked the good service that Pablo offered at the front desk when we wanted a late checkout. When we ended up spending more time shopping on Michigan Ave, I called up to ask for some extra time, and he answered the phone (I had spoken to him earlier). He remembered me and said "no problem!" Bellmen were professional and very helpful as well. Overall, I'd gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good service but rooms were just okay...”
Reviews.Author: JenZoo3612
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference with my boyfriend for a combo business/pleasure vacation. The only reason we chose this hotel was for the conference room rates. We had never been to Chicago before. First, the great: We booked an extra night beyond my conference dates and the hotel gave us the conference rate for the room. Our front desk service was exceptional with Pablo. It was not only easy but he was so pleasant and welcoming, it put me at ease. He got us into our room 15 minutes before check-in time. The support we received with checking our bags in the lobby and getting taxis was very good. The concierge helped us with choosing a great Italian restaurant. Another front desk employee (I think Alfredo?) helped us with restaurant choices, going so far as to call to find out about vegetarian options. We had a sink issue in our room, and it was dealt with immediately while we were out to dinner. The beds are super comfortable and the rooms with queen beds are spacious. We got free wireless through the conference rate. Awesome. (But it would have turned me off if I had to pay $10 per night for wireless in the room. This is an unnecessary fee to charge.) Next, the not so great: Booking the rooms was very difficult - I had to call at least 4-5 times to deal with pre-payment due to my conference reimbursement, and I received different information repeatedly from each person I talked to. This is exactly what turns me off from large hotel chains. The hotel has obviously worked to upgrade the rooms...to a point. We had a nice granite sink and large shower head and new tile. This is nice....except that all of the hooks for towels were either not in place (holes in walls) or falling off the wall (we used it anyway) which made functionality more difficult. I think we used more towels because of this. So, it is nice to have things look pretty but if it isn't functional, it doesn't matter how pretty the tile is....and the wallpaper and doors were peeling and chipping, so it really was a tile job and that is all. I'd rather have no tile but a well-maintained bathroom. Our tub drain was weirdly sticking out and we couldn't put it down. We had a leaky sink...if we let the water run for more than 10 seconds, the bottom of the vanity cabinet would start dripping water. The pool was impossible to use because of crowds of children running with noodles everywhere. I like kids....I really do....but one hour of adult swim at the end of the night would have been nice, especially with 100+ degree temps. Overall: It was a decent stay, but I would not choose it for the regular rates. I'd prefer a smaller hotel with better maintained bathrooms and a pool we can use. But I did feel we had good service. Our thanks to Pablo and Alfredo.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for business”
Reviews.Author: setter1vb
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and the location was near where I needed to be. While I was fortunate to not have a long wait at check-in, it seemed that most were not so lucky as there was seldom more than one person behind the desk. I guess I had been spoiled in staying at other Hilton properties in downtown Chicago in the past and had a higher expectation on arrival. On a positive note, the breakfast was good, and parking was only $43/night (it hurts to say "only" about that!) compared to over $50 at other hotels. Additionally, the housekeeping staff was very helpful. On the downside, the elevator to the garage was cramped and busier than what was likely anticipated (encouraging people to valet I guess), and in spite of having four lobby elevators, they seemed to not keep people moving as fast as they could line up.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TrooperNc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel while I was attending a national convention. The place was packed with people but the accomodations were great. The staff were very nice, polite, hekpful, and friendly. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be in downtown Chicago. It was convenient to everything. We enjoyed the stay and we would stay in this hotel on our return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Felt great even crowded”
Reviews.Author: Markmcg20
Reviews.Content: Even though the hotel was packed, it was still quiet and a great location in the middle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad hotel.”
Reviews.Author: NICESTLGUY
Reviews.Content: Check in=horrid Service=incompetent Location=excellent I stayed here for a conference. Parking was pricey, the first room I got was occupied, and pool was small and not well kept. If you get a great rate stay here. If you are deciding between two hotels, pick the other one. This is not what you should expect from Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Service”
Reviews.Author: Believer54
Reviews.Content: We book this hotel requesting 3 rooms next to other or across the hall as this was a family get away. When we arrived we were told 2 rooms were on one floor and the other on the floor above. We were told we didn't get top priority because we booked through hotels.com and not directly with Doubletree. We weren't willing to budge so we waited for an hour to get 3 rooms on the same floor. We went to the pool that night and saw right away there were no pool towels so we informed the person working the area. He said "some were in the dryer" and they would bring them out. 30 minutes later-still no towels. Another 15 minutes later my son and I went to the front desk dripping wet and made a second request. Another 15 minutes later they brought out 5 towels...there were at least 25 people in the pool! We went and got hand towels from the fitness center - ridiculous. The second day we were there we discovered they conveniently forgot to give us our breakfast vouchers that we had paid for. That was another battle!! The only thing good about this hotel is it's location. Service? That's another story......

Reviews.Title: “Had rooms booked here for my family wedding!!”
Reviews.Author: hl786
Reviews.Content: Really highclass hotel, great rooms and location, great price, well worth the price I give this hotel 5 stars. :)

Reviews.Title: “Spiders And Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: houstonguy2010
Reviews.Content: My son and I got this hotel on Hotwire as an overnight during a cross country train trip on Amtrak. Check in was very easy and the front desk clerk was very nice. We got to our room on the 9th floor and my son age 8 noticed a spider. He is very afraid of spiders by the way. Then I noticed one, then another and then another on the ceiling. I pulled the bed cover back and a dead spider was there. I called to the front desk, 4 times by the way before anyone answered, and reported the spiders. Engineering came up and said that they were coming in through the A/C unit. They moved us to the 10th floor. We got in that room and a spider was on the ledge inside the room. A very big spider web was outside on the window. I reported this after 5 calls to the front desk before it was answered. They then moved us to the 24th floor. No spiders in this room but again a large web outside of the window. We checked out and two days into our trip I noticed an overcharge on my card for $41.00. I called the hotel's accounting department and asked what the charges were for. Valet parking and internet I was told. We used internet but did not have a car at any point during our trip. After about two hours the accountant called back and advised the valet parking charge was going to be refunded. I asked what happened and he said it was "human error". I spent almost an hour on the phone to get this resolved and not even a I am sorry or anything. We used the breakfast buffet on the morning of our departure and it was very good. All of the employees with the exception of the accounting employee was very nice. But the spiders and the overcharge give this property a failing grade.

Reviews.Title: “Our second visit - not as good as the first.”
Reviews.Author: LyndaMN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree in December 2009 and loved the experience. Our second visit was not quite as impressive. CONS: Broken desk chair couldn't be adjusted and stayed in the lowest position. $20 per day internet fee! We thought this was really high and when using wireless it was very slow. We switched to wired and it was faster. But $20 is the absolute highest charge we have ever had - anywhere. No vending machines! If you want pop after 11 pm when the gift shop is closed, you have to venture outside and find a store. So, be prepared! There was no price list for the tray of snacks anywhere in the room. Be aware - if you so much as pick up a snack to LOOK at it, you will be charged. On our second day, housekeeping did not replenish the coffee or cups. The room has newer style bedding (no comforter) but everything is looking a bit worn, especially the carpet and the window seat fabric. PROS: The location! A fabulous location! Ample outlets! We had no problem charging our iPods and phones. The shower head, water temp and volume of water was FABULOUS! This was the best shower we have had in a hotel in a long time! The window seat was convenient, especially since there is only one chair (the broken desk chair) in the room. Free internet in the lobby. The hotel was VERY busy when we were there and I think that can have a negative effect.

Reviews.Title: “out dates and crabby”
Reviews.Author: shadowfox83
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience with Double Tree in Colorado so that's why we went with this one in chicago. It was nothing like the one in CO. First of all, the bell boy or whatever you call the guys waiting in front; said we couldn't pull up to the front and get our luggage out and check in. He said we had to park. Parking is $40 a DAY!!!! We already knew that, so we had planned to park our car at a friends house. So we had to pay $40 just to check in. We later got that refunded, but still! THEN, when we booked the room, we requested a roll away bed for our son. They said they didn't have any available, try back later?! Ok, fine. We got into our room and it looked a bit small to fit a roll away, but we were tied from driving all day and didn't think much of it. We unpacked, did the pool and then wanted to go to supper. We checked on the roll away before we left, because I wasn't going to have my son sleep on the floor or in our bed kicking us all night long. They said they had one available, but that we'd have to switch rooms, because our room wasn't big enough!!?? You couldn't have just put us in a bigger room to begin with? So we had to pack all our stuff again and move. After all that, the room and building was out dated and falling apart. Also, the people their were so crabby!m They treated us like morons, when asking questions about places/directions around Chicago. I know we are tourists and don't know our way around, but duh! The only good thing was the pool and the fact we got our parking refunded for the one day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Rx2013
Reviews.Content: Pros: Stayed here while attending a family wedding in July. The location was great- we were able to walk to Michigan Ave, Navy Pier, Millenium Park, and the Shedd aquarium (though the aquarium was a bit of a hike) with little difficulty. Was great to not need a car to get around, and the rates were less than other hotels on Michigan Ave. Now for the cons- we weren't able to check in until well after the specified check-in time of 3PM, and when we asked if we could check in any earlier the staff was incredibly rude. There were some issues with our room, and while we did bring them up, they were not addressed satisfactorily. Summary: If you're looking for a less expensive hotel on Michigan Ave and don't care if the staff is rude, this is a good choice. If you're looking for good service, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Worst customer service”
Reviews.Author: sally1jones
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a nice locale, and has an outdoor pool, unique for Chicago. But the customer service and quality of the rooms is subpar, I suggest the wit for better service and better rooms. As a Hilton honors member I expect to get a room at the time of check in, they had a room full of customers trying to check in waiting in the lobby at 3pm....the only instruction was to come back in 30 minutes. I think they had rooms empty but didn't have enough staff to clean them quickly I imagine the management is terrible to work for, and the bad attitude trickles down to all of the staff. The manager would not speak to me directly and everyone waiting was angry. Maybe I would have hidden from the mod too. You are better off at any Marriott property in this city

Reviews.Title: “Top notch!”
Reviews.Author: elizfromTX
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago for five days for a girls trip. Being two small town southern girls, we needed a little help on a few occasions making our way around the city and using the transit system. The concierge, bell staff, and desk staff were friendly and helpful every time we needed them. This hotel is in an absolutely perfect location, is immaculately maintained, and the rooms and beds are beyond comfortable. The rooftop pool is a real treat if you need a little break. Jason, the attendant at the bar/snack stand out by the pool was helpful in providing tips about thing to do around the city and went above and beyond waiting on us as we enjoyed a couple of hours of poolside R and R. The Doubletree on Ohio is a top notch place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for everything”
Reviews.Author: daytonaman88
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers a great location close to shopping and sight seeing. You have Navy Pier .7 miles away and In the other direction you have shopping, the Hancock building, and House of blues is .65 miles in the other direction. you can walk to everything.

Reviews.Title: “We were very satisfied with our stay”
Reviews.Author: 2SeniorsbyRail
Reviews.Content: We were happy with our stay. Staff was very friendly and help full.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place in Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: cross_checked23
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our 2-night stay at the Doubletree Magnificent Mile. Easy to get to as we came in from I-90 to Ohio Street and stayed on Ohio (one-way) until we came to the hotel on the left. You can choose to enter the parking garage when you first arrive right next to the hotel entrance. There is another ramp about half a block further that may be a little cheaper. Check-in was at a fairly busy time but the wait was only about 10 minutes. Check-out wait was very short. It's a large hotel and appears to have been recently renovated. Our (2) rooms were clean and pretty spacious. The beds and pillows rank up there with some of the best I've slept on at hotels. It was decorated nicely and was pleasant. The only negative for us is that the rooms did not have a fridge or microwave. These days we've almost come to expect that for a hotel of this quality. This kept me from giving the hotel a 5 rating. The location is within walking distance of many downtown hot spots, 2 blocks off Michigan Avenue, not far from Navy Pier and plenty of restaurants to choose from. We booked this off Priceline by choosing a 3.5 star hotel within this area and got it for under $100. Parking is a killer though in downtown Chicago...It was $41 per night at this ramp.

Reviews.Title: “Not A Good Option for Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: tsogl
Reviews.Content: We did not enjoy our stay at the Doubletree Hotel Chicago-Magnificent Mile. First the positives. This hotel is often less expensive than other hotels in Chicago. It is also near Navy Pier, which is useful for people wishing to visit Navy Pier. Now for the negatives. Our bed was uncomfortable and our room was noisy. The windows do not effectively block out street noise. This may be a function of the age of the building, which leads to another problem we experienced. Something is wrong with the elevators at this hotel. At times the elevators come right away. At other times, elevator wait time can exceed 5 minutes (we stayed at this hotel before it was a Doubletree and had similar problems with the elevators). This hotel also has a poor business center, so I would not recommend it for business travelers who might need access to a printer. The hotel does have wireless Internet access. However, we had significant problems with Internet access. The hotel has what looks like a large outdoor pool, but we were not able to use it because it was quite cold in Chicago during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: rebelyell18
Reviews.Content: This Doubletree was a great hotel choice during my recent stay in Chicago! The location was great - right between both Navy Pier and the Magnificent Mile - as well as being nearby many other restaurants and shopping. Down the street, give Yolk a try for breakfast (red velvet French toast!) and Fox & Obel is a neat "foodie" place to shop and houses a very tasty cafe that is open 6am til midnight! Checking in and out was a snap and we got a great deal by booking in advance. However, they do ask for a $50/day hold on a credit card, for an incidentals, which I wasn't aware of until check-in. No biggie...and it was made all the sweeter by that warm chocolate chip cookie. Which, I was surprised to learn, was very tasty! Our room and bathroom were both clean and well stocked. For all you sleep lovers, the beds were comfortable with plenty of pillows and blankets and the room was equipped with good blackout curtains. Also, the whole hotel smelled really good...I don't know what it was, but it was so pleasant. :) I would definitely stay here again and hope that you give it a try on your Chicago trip!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best....”
Reviews.Author: customdunks78
Reviews.Content: Pros: hotel is in a great location for downtown, friendly staff, soft sheets Cons: Old tube Televisions are clunky and outdated, water faucet in bathroom was about to fall off. place is very dusty

Reviews.Title: “Basic No Frills Chicago Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug073Toronto
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel through Hotwire and got a good deal for the room so I wasn't expecting much more than what I got. The hotel is located in a fairly good location. A few blocks away from Michigan Avenue and about a 10 minute walk to the red line subway station. There are several coffee shops around the hotel and a grocery store across the corner (which I found helpful for picking up snacks and drinks). The room itself was a little worn and aged but clean and spacious. I didn't require any help from the staff but my interaction with the front desk was friendly. The hotel has free wifi in the lobby but unfortunately not in the room. I wish there had been a small bar fridge for room guests to use (the fridge in the room was full with the mini bar food with no space for additional items). Overall, the hotel is a good budget place to stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “poor service”
Reviews.Author: krawner
Reviews.Content: I waited 1 hour to check in! There was a large restaurant convention in town, and the hotel front desk was clearly understaffed. I counted 22 people waiting in line ahead of me. The free cookie couldn't take the sour taste out of my mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Just ain't the same...”
Reviews.Author: NicholeMI
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at this hotel for at least the last 3 years every December before Christmas. We have never had any complaints until now. I traveled with my mother and sister. We were greeted by Candy at the front desk which was most of the reason for the bad experience. There was nothing hospitable about Candy. She seemed more suited for Popeyes or McDonalds. Summed up she was just plain "ghetto". After my mother and Candy went back and forth about the price she was quoted over the phone which did not include the tax, my mother paid for the first night and I gave Candy my credit card for the second night. Candy swiped my card and immediately told me it was denied. I was speechless and somewhat embarrassed. My mother jumped in and paid the rest on her debit card. The whole time going up to the room I was trying to understand why my card was denied. My cards have NEVER been denied. I had to go back down to the front desk to get this matter straightened out. I wanted to get my mother's money back on her debit card and put the charge on my card where it was supposed to be. I called my credit card company and the employee told me that my card was fine and he saw a previous charge from earlier that day which went through fine and I had a sufficient amount of credit available. He told me to have the front desk swipe my card for a $1 charge just to try again. Another front desk person swiped my card for $1and it was accepted. This employee brought it to Candy's attention and Candy pointed to the screen an said something like "of course that went through". I don't know if she was implying that the charge went through because it was only $1 or because it was a different card. Candy also gave me the last 4 digits of the card that was denied, which did not match my credit card( I had only one card in my purse). My mother and I went to the front desk and told Candy that we wanted the charges put on each card correctly and my mother's debit card credited ASAP back the money for the extra night. Of course Candy tried to tell us some BS about waiting 3 business days for the refund to get us to go away . Long story short, I knew that someone could hit a button and fix the mess that candy made. Candy went back to talk to a manager (or whoever was in the closed office) and came out with papers to make the corrections. We could have allowed Candy to sour our trip. We entertained the idea of leaving and staying somewhere else, but we were so excited about being in Chicago that we did not let that happen. Candy's tone was unpleasant. She treated us as if we were wrong when she made the mistakes. We did not feel like special guests. Candy did not treat us like people who were paying $200/night. Aside from Candy, the ice machine was broken on our floor and the female concierge did not seem like a real concierge. We had to ask her for everything. She did not offer assistance or knowledge. Seems like the cookies were fresher last time as well. I think we will consider another hotel next time. This hotel just isn't the same. I get a different vibe from some of the employees as well as if they aren't as happy as they were a few years back . I like what the hotel used to be. Maybe I just like the hotel without Candy there. I'm scared to recommend this hotel. Warning: Stay away from the American Idol contestant "Frenchie" lookin chick at the front desk!

Reviews.Title: “Overall great experience!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Costa_Papas
Reviews.Content: A group of 12 of us came out for a bachelor party, first time to Chicago. What a great experience! It started off when we first checked in... nice bar, good drinks, front desk has great customer service (Thank you Pablo). The Doubletree is in a great location - really good resturants in walking distance, Timothy O'Tooles across the street, subway near by, easy access to hook up with tour groups to see the city, etc. Rooms where spacious, clean, comfortable beds...and when needed room service, extra towels, etc. showed good customer service. Also the bagels and egg standwiches where delicious. Many thanks to the staff especially Pablo, Concierge staff, and the Valet service. Thank you very much! Can't wait to come back! - Costa Papas

Reviews.Title: “Overall pretty good”
Reviews.Author: GarethT_1980
Reviews.Content: First of all, we shouldn't even have been staying at this hotel. This was the start of a Route 66 trip, and our tour operator messed up. When we turned up here they had no reservation for us (the next day we found out that we were actually booked into the Swissotel). The guy at front counter was extremely apologetic (although none of this was the hotel's fault), and booked us in - we will be claiming a refund from our tour operator. Spotlessly clean room, nice bathroom, excellent location (lots of shopping, downtown, places to eat, and ten minute walk to Navy Pier). Decent view of the city from the room also (I think the attentive guy at front desk said he would give us a particularly nice room for the inconvenience). Downside is that the bar wasn't open, which is staggering in a hotel of this size. Also, we were offered a complimentary breakfast on arrival for the mess up over the bookings, but when we tried to use this in the dining room we were told we would have to pay for it. We didn't bother to argue and went elsewhere (as I said wasn't the hotel's fault anyway). You do have to pay to park. Pool wasn't open. Wi-fi in room also comes at a cost, which always annoys me (although is free in the lobby)

Reviews.Title: “Good value-hotel”
Reviews.Author: RR_USA
Reviews.Content: Pros: great location, good value, friendly and helpful staff. Cons: 'lake-view' room is an optimistic assessment of the word 'view': you could see water, I'll give them that. Verdict: In its class, a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: WanderingWolfe
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at this hotel for a family event. They seemed to be overwhelmed with guests, and the wait at the font desk was often minutes. Cookie helped me stay in one room during my visit (I came early to a family event by one night, they had not booked a group rate for those who arrived prior to the event). But the breakfast bagel place attached had few seats and was buzzing with customers in the morning; lobby always crowded with people. Big Ben the Doorman got me a cab when mine did not arrive, after I was notified it had been dispatched half an hour earlier. Housekeeping staff (Irma especially) were nice and offered me extra coffee packets and coffee mate packets). I had an airline SNAFU and could not leave as planned. While at another venue, I could not get through to front desk to try to keep my room another night. I was transferred and then the call was lost. The other hotel the family breakfast was held at booked me a room there and then, and I came back to the Doubletree, got my bags and left. I did not want to wade through the front desk to try to stay longer at that point.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a great location!”
Reviews.Author: B0710
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree over spring break. We got the hotel on a discount website for just around $100 with tax. Because of the discount price, I thought it was a great deal! I would not have stayed there for regular price. The beds and pillows were really comfortable. The bathroom was very average....the tub was pretty small. The hotel overall was clean, but our hotel room had some large stains (it looked like a cup of coffee was thrown at the wall). It seemed like the rooms could just a little refreshing. The hotel lobby/bar area was very nice and trendy. Parking was $41 a night, which I thought was a bit steep, but since we didn't have to park a car, it wasn't a big concern. Our room in particular was a bit noisy from all the street noise, but not terribly bad. The hotel had a great location, convenient for walking to many things. I liked that the hotel had an Einstein Bagel Co. on it's main level. If you stay here, you should definitely walk across the street (by the steakhouse) and eat at Timmy O'Toole's, the food and service was excellent! Overall, I would recommend this hotel, especially if you get a good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Happy with stay, would consider again”
Reviews.Author: huntlawoffice
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a last-minute, four-day last spring break trip. Got a good rate on Hotwire and that is certainly one reason we were happy. (It's worth noted we were treated just fine and were able to get a 2 bed/non-smoking room without any problems). We arrived very late and check-in generally went smooth (there was a little confusion on the part of the desk clerk as to our room "type" on the reservation, but it was quickly resolved and, as noted above, was what we expected). Lobby isn't particularly large and is fairly simple, it did have free wi-fi. There were occasional elevator waits, but nothing too outrageous. It's worth noting there was some kind of H.S. band thing going on with lots of kids, chaperones, etc. that contributed to the delays, but the kids were generally well behaved. Also, we were disappointed to find they charge for use of the indoor pool (but did know about it from the hotel website), don't have the complete details of why and/or how this works as we didn't take "advantage" of it. I'm pretty sure they have a (seasonal) rooftop pool at no charge, but didn't check it out. Did not eat at the hotel restaurant, but did take advantage of the bagel place off the lobby for at least one breakfast and multiple coffees. Room was nice as expected and while my wife & I liked the mattress pillow my daughter didn't (at least she complained about it the first night). We *did* appreciate having an actual thermostat (with exact temps) rather then a "hotter/colder" dial, that leaves you guessing and can take some time to dial in to your comfort zone. As far as location, it's in Streeterville. This means you're fairly close to the heart of the Mag Mile shopping (a few block walk), but there aren't as many restaurants, bars, shops, etc right outside the hotel as you will find on the west side of Michigan Avenue. There are a enough eating options, but perhaps a little weighted towards breakfast rather then dinner. Similarly, public transit isn't quite as good as the west side of Michigan, but it's not bad. That's about it. Generally happy with our stay and would consider staying here again (but probably not at rack rates). hlo

Reviews.Title: “No Valet Parking--A Big Plus”
Reviews.Author: mls7217
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to the Doubletree, although my wife has stayed there several times. I thought it was quite nice. The room was larger than expected and very clean. The lobby bar was great. I was pleased that there was an attached parking garage with no valet. This made getting in and out very easy. While parking was expensive, it was not excessive, especially since we did not have to deal with a valet. We were able to come and go as we pleased. The location was great, easy to find and easy to get in and out. The staff was pleasant and helpful. My only complaint, which is a pet peeve of mine, is that the doorman, who summoned a cab from about ten yards away, opened the cab door and told the cab driver where we were going, flashed the wad of bills in his hand as a subtle reminder that he was working for tips. This annoyed me. While I appreciated the help, we could have walked ten steps and done this ourselves. Regardless, the price was right and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Accomodating and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: traveltrini
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Doubletree Chicago - Magnificent Mile. On this occasion we stayed for five days. I must stay the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The doormen, (Vladimir, thank you for your suggestions) the front desk staff, (Cookie, always a smile, eager to answer any question) and especially the hotel shop staff. Can't remember everyone's name, but many helpful staff. Certain conceirge won't so friendly, but not all. The location is great, walking distance or short cab ride to restaurants, navy pier, museums and shopping. Cookies are a plus too!! The rooms were quite large, decorated tastefully and the beds were comfy. I also liked the window seat. Bathroom was also clean and updated. I would return to Doubletree, but would also like to try other hotels in the area as well.

Reviews.Title: “A Happy Surprise”
Reviews.Author: AThena53
Reviews.Content: I accidentally reserved the Doubletree because I confused it with another hotel I'd stayed at in Chicago. I figured this out only the day before I left, and decided to try the Doubletree anyway. My main concern was that I found nothing on the Fitness Center- not even a picture on the hotel site. This is usually a very bad sign that the Fitness Center is a windowless room in the basement with 2 machines from the last century, one of which doesn't work. I needn't have worried- the Fitness Center is right off the lobby, filled with brand new Precor Equipment, and not overcrowded. The hotel is convenient to major retail stores, many restaurants large and small, a grocery store, and the financial district. I particularly liked the takeout from Dao (Thai). My room was comfortable and quiet, with lovely crisp white bedding. The primary view was the parking garage across the street, but in the distance there was an interesting building and a sliver of Lake Michigan! Wi-Fi was free for me as a HHonors Gold member. So was continental breakfast, although the selection was fairly limited- fruits, a few breads and bagels, yogurt and cottage cheese dry cereals but no oatmeal. The Wi-Fi was user-friendly and ran at a good speed- I was even able to download video podcasts to my iPod quickly using the free public Wi-Fi in the gym. Staff was helpful and friendly- a bellhop saw me looking for a place to discard my empty coffee cup as I was walking through the lobby and told me he'd take care of it. A little thing, but I like it when someone notices I need something and responds. One caveat: I didn't look at the phone charges posted by the phone and was charged $1.50 for a call to the Thai restaurant less than a block away. The charges were posted- I just didn't notice them. Use your cell phone. I enjoyed my stay at the Doubletree and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok”
Reviews.Author: standndlvr
Reviews.Content: Place was fine for a quick stop. Hotel common areas are nice and inviting. Rooms were ok, nothing special. Good location. Staff was very accommodating. I wouldn't seek out the D-tree, but in a pinch it served it's purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: CE_Illinois
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Double Tree (on Ohio Street) with my husband and our 24 year-old niece. We arrived 2 hours prior to check-in and we were pleased that they let us check in early. The front desk people very friendly. The room was clean and had all of the amenities we expected. We had lunch at Timothy O'Tooles right across the street and it was pretty good (Italian Beef/Fish and Chips). When we were discussing where we might eat a hotel employee happened to notice and he offered up several suggestions (was very nice--we opted for close because we were starving). After lunch we walked to Water Tower place and shopped along Michigan Ave, so the hotel location is convenient. We stopped at a nearby Dunkin Donuts for a liitle coffee and took a short Taxi ride to Park West for a concert. When we returned at midnight we realized we needed more pillows, called the front desk and had them within 15 minutes. We also requested help ordering a pizza and they suggested a place that was fantastic. We will definitely stay at this hotel again. Very pleasant, clean and a great price!

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay - Recommend only if you want to save money”
Reviews.Author: CathyOhio
Reviews.Content: Came to Chicago for a gymnastics meet. So first of all I need to preface that I stayed at the Doubletree because our booster club negotiated an $88 per night rate and that included the use of the pool which is normally $15 per room. Overall, my experience was what I would expect for paying $88 per night. Cons: 1. Rooms: I changed rooms three times which is not something I would normally do but the paint on the ceiling of the bathroom was peeling so badly that it was depressing. Also, there was rust on the tub (I don't live in mansion but when my bathroom at home is a LOT nicer than the hotel we have a problem) and the room furniture and walls were pretty beat up and no flat screen which seriously dates the hotel. We stayed on the 9th floor and it smelled like a mixture of cleaning products and smoke and carpeting was stained in hallways which overall doesn't make for a great atmosphere - but I guess what would you expect for $88. The paint on the ceilings in the bathrooms in the second and third rooms were a little bit better but overall rooms were really worn. I expected better from a Doubletree. I normally stay at Marriotts but have stayed in Doubletrees before where the rooms were a lot better. A taxi cab driver told us that the hotel used to be a Holiday Inn which would make sense, because the rooms and hallways reminded me of an old Holiday Inn which they tried to retrofit to a Doubletree. Linens were OK. 2. No free coffee in Lobby (you get it in the rooms but I am used to free coffee that is made in the lobby) and one of the electrical outfits in the main lobby looked like it had been melted and couldn't be used. Really only saw one useable electrical outlet in the lobby. 3. Pool was a hike to get to. 4. No free wifi - although I knew about this beforehand. Also, it looked like I would have been charged to use the business center and I can't tell you the last time I have stayed at a hotel that charged for internet usage or charged for business center services. Pros: 1. If you have a group that is cost conscious and needs a block of rooms for an event it looks like you can get a decent deal. 2. I will say that overwhelmingly the staff was VERY nice. The only bad experience was that the front desk person told me that I had to bring my own towels to the pool when in fact they have pool towels behind the desk. 3. Good location. 4. Eistein Bros. restaurant in building. Not sure that I would stay at this hotel again. I am really interested in having a decent hotel room when I go somewhere and the room was barely average, plus the hallways had that odd smell that you can never get rid of. I guess I can recommend it if you can get a great deal and you don't care about a really nice room.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and affordable- until the parking is added on.”
Reviews.Author: local40oz
Reviews.Content: We found a great rate for a quick weekend trip to Chicago. We decided to drive to make it even more economical. Driving helped the bottom line until we were hit with the $41/ night parking fee. I realize that parking downtown is at a premium, but $82 for the weekend is steep. Plus, the in-out system the Doubletree has in place at the lot is clumsy. You have to show a carbon-copy of your parking payment to the attendant every time you leave so they don't charge you again. But we were happy with everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, okay stay”
Reviews.Author: WiscDoll
Reviews.Content: We travel to downtown Chicago once yearly and have stayed at a number of hotels near the Magnificent Mile over the years. Got a great rate through Travelzoo and decided to stay at the Doubletree. It wasn't my most favorite hotel in Chicago, but the location is excellent if you're spending the day on the Mag Mile or at Navy Pier. The hotel itself was nice, rooms were spacious, and even though our room was just off the elevators, we didn't hear any noise from them at night. Staff was very friendly at checkin and checkout as well. Our room overlooked a neighboring office building -- and looking out our windows, we could see reflections of others staying in the hotel if their curtain wasn't closed! A little odd... Also, the heat/AC unit in the room drove me a little nuts, because it shut itself on and off all night. It was January and we needed heat, so we couldn't just shut it off. Despite that, if we got a great rate again, I'd consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room at a Great Weekend Rate”
Reviews.Author: BrownStreet
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend getaway at Doubletree Magnificent Mile. Hotel was chosen because of the low weekend rate and location. When checking in was not impressed by the lobby and wondered if we had make the correct choice. However, once we made it to our room, we were very happy with our choice. We were given a corner room with a king bed. We had been told this was as larger room and it included a sofa, chair and large desk. The room has large windows which let in a lot of light with a northern view of Chicago. The room was very clean and the decor was pleasing. We did not have any noise issues which may be due that there was not a room directly adjacent to ours. The bathroom was large and can easily accommodate two people. Negatives are the room's small closet space especially when you have winter coats and the older television which must not have been updated when the room was remodeled. Due to Hilton Honors status we had free internet in the room which worked very well and complimentary â€œcoldâ€� breakfast which was not much of a benefit. The location is great and the attached parking garage offered convenient access to the hotel. Service was professional and courteous. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful from the moment we checked in”
Reviews.Author: jengaworld
Reviews.Content: After a bad experience at a Doubletree property in Pittsburgh, I was very wary about choosing this location. Yet a good rate on the Doubletree web site, combined with the location, convinced me to give the brand another try. I am so delighted that I did, as it provided a perfect location for a shopping trip with a friend. We were greeted so warmly at check-in by Jose. You would think we had booked a penthouse suite -- he treated us like 5-star guests and was very helpful. I can't remember another check-in where I was made to feel like such a truly valued guest, and it started our visit on a wonderful note. We went upstairs to a partial lakeview room that did not disappoint and was a good size for two, with very comfortable beds. In the rest of the hotel, the lobby was cozy with a cute little bar (and, conveniently, free internet access). And the Einstein's bagel shop in the lobby was super convenient to pop down for delicious bagels and coffee to bring back to the room for breakfast. Our positive experience extended to check-out and beyond, when we needed to leave bags due to a few hours lag time before our flight out. The bellman, whose name unfortunately I have forgotten, was very helpful and accommodating; we felt totally comfortable leaving our bags with him -- and, like our check-in, as though it was a pleasure to for him assist us. The only downside in the stay was having to pay for internet in the room -- and being presented with fees not by room but separately for each device -- a drag with two laptops and two iPods, which would have cost a fortune if we bought 4 separate internet plans. This really needs to be revisited to take into account the way people travel in 20111 (this is also the only reason I didn't give 5 stars). Despite this single caveat, this was really a pretty hotel with exceptionally well-trained and accommodating staff, and an unexpectedly great find. Travel surprises are rarely pleasant -- this was that rare surprise that really made our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jariho
Reviews.Content: I had booked 2 rooms, one for my me and my spouse, the other for friends coming in from a different location a few hours later. We got there quite a bit earlier than the listed check in time but thought we would ask the front desk if they had any rooms available. The front desk person (Cookie?) said we couldn't get our rooms until noon and would not be able to get even one smoking room. We had no problem with that other than she was unfriendly - no smile, no pleasantries, no offering to leave our bags with the concierge until we could check in. We left and happened to be back by the hotel at about 10:30 and thought we would check again to see if we could get in early. This time we dealt with Pablo, who not only was extremely pleasant, but said if it was okay with us, we could get a non smoking room immediately, and a smoking room when our guest arrive at the hotel a few hours later. Perfect! The rooms were nice, the location was great, the maid staff was helpful. (When we were checking out, the first 3 elevators were full. She showed us where the freight elevator was and had us take it.) Everyone with the exception of the first front desk person was wonderful, particularly Pablo! I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific experience at DoubleTree Mag Mile”
Reviews.Author: GoRockies
Reviews.Content: In town for a family reunion and wedding, we rented four rooms for three nights arriving Dec 29 dp Jan 1 2011. Clean, large rooms with two Queens each room, all in our party agreed that the rooms and importantly bathrooms fully met expectations...location excellent, walked to Navy Pier, Art Institute, Michigan Avenue, Rush Street. Marketplace Restaurant in the Hotel offered very good food and for those whom would rather, there was a bagel shop in the hotel too. Another useful amenity: airline check-in kiosk. Only bummer was that one of our four rooms took an unusually long time to access at check-in, but those folks just used one of our other rooms no problem. We'll stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Improved”
Reviews.Author: spackler43
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay and review of the Double Tree Chicago. The last visit was just average, but this visit was much better. The room was very nice, the shower was the best hotel shower I have ever had. The staff was very friendly and again the best we have found in Chicago. The hotel is 3 blocks from just about everything. My wife really enjoyed the spa across the street. My only complaint is the internet charge, it is $9.95 per day if you are a hotel guest, but if you are just some Joe Shmo walking in off the street the internet is free in the lobby, other than that we had a much more pleasant stay at the Double Tree this time and will recommend it to our friend.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing big - but poor service and inconveniences were a constant”
Reviews.Author: LAluxurytraveler
Reviews.Content: First, let me say the hotel has an excellent location close to museums, shopping and the lake, and the price of my room (a group rate in this case) was very good. But, were I to return to Chicago for either business or pleasure - or if I was panning a business conference - I would definitley look to stay elsewhere. There was no one big problem, but every little thing was a problem - and after a few days it just starts wearing on you. For example: 1. For our meeting we kept requesting a key to the meeting room and the hotel kept saying they would get us one - but never did. As a result after any break or lunch or when the day began, we had to wait (and wait...) for someone from the hotel to come with a key and open up the room. 2. On the first day of the meetings it took them an hour to find the training materials which had been shipped to the hotel the week before, and during that time they came back several times to say the materials must never had arrived. 3. The maid service failed to replace the room-service breakfast menu which you hang on your door knob at night to order the next day's breakfast. (No biggie) So i stopped at the front desk in the evening to ask for one and they did not have one and said someone would bring one right up to my room. (No biggie) After 30 minutes one had not arrived, and I was wanting to get ready for bed - so I returned to the front desk to ask again and even volunteered to go to some other section of the hotel get one if it would help. The desk clerk took on a very defensive attitude. I waited another 20 minutes at the desk for them to track one down. 4. The above referenced breakfast was delievred 10 minutes past the half-hour delivery window. 5. They day I checked out the maid knocked on my door at 8:00 to see if I had already left. I'll admit I did not have the do not disturb sign on the door - but on the day you check out housekeeping should be asking the front desk if you checked out, not the guests. 6. Leaving for th airport I asked the doorman for help with a cap. He tried to talk me in to waiting for "the hotel's driver" to come back and that he would only charge $45 to O'hare. Well, a) I had no interest in waiting around for a driver when a taxi wasright there, and b) the taxi with tip cost $49 - so there was no deal to be had with their driver. Again, no biggie - but another little hassel. 3.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in Chi-town!”
Reviews.Author: cherryblaster1
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for one night while we were in Chicago on our way back to Toronto from Cincinnati (a round-about road trip!). This was the first hotel we came across as we were walking around after we parked the car. I had done some research beforehand (not having an actual reservation, I wanted to be somewhat prepared) so I knew that the Doubletree had gotten great reviews. The nightly rate was very good considering all the other hotels in the area were super pricey, and we both got a warm chocolate chip cookie when we checked in. Check in and check out were super quick and easy, and the staff at the front desk were very helpful and friendly. The hotel itself was gorgeous, the lobby was very nice and had a nice looking bar which unfortunately we didnt get a chance to visit. The room was gorgeous as well, very nicely decorated with contemporary colour schemes and art. The bathroom had a large, wall-to-wall vanity with gorgeous granite top. The shower was very nice too and clean. The bed was comfy but the pillows kinda sucked because they were too heavy and dense. Our room had a window seat but it went to waste because we had a cruddy view of a parking garage across the street. My only real complaint about this hotel was that there was no fridge except for the bar fridge which was full of (very expensive, $4 USD for a can of coke) drinks. We had gone to Giordanno's for some Chicago deep dish pizza and took the leftovers back to the room, only to find out i didnt have a fridge to keep it in. Also the snack tray was horrendously expensive ($7 USD for a little bag of candy) and God forbid you touched anything because the sensors in the tray would automatically charge it to your credit card. Overall though, a great stay and a great experience, I just wish we had had more time and money to stay and enjoy Chi-town! We would be likely to stay here again on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Great location, Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Gretelz
Reviews.Content: We travel to Chicago every Christmas season and this is by far the best value for your money. We have 4 teenagers so we always book two rooms. The price for the rooms was unbelievable. The rooms were clean and the staff was wonderful. Our movie option on the tv didn't work. We called the front desk and they promptly sent a repairman and fixed the situation. The hotel is centrally located to shopping and the lake. Easy to get anywhere. We would stay here again in a heartbeat and if you need more than one room, this is the place to stay. It's quality at a very affordable price. Parking is a little steep at $41.00 but even added to the price of the rooms it still was more economical to stay here than other hotels. Free cookies when you arrive...can't beat that!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL IN THE AWESOME LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: cocoajean
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three days on business trip. Hotel is super clean. (I left housekeeping a thank you note--it was that clean!) Location is terrific, walking distance to everything you need including a great supermarket called Dominicks (food, pharmacy, EVERYTHING) and the BEST breakfast place (right across street from hotel) called WEST EGG. I will go back in the summer with my family because I loved the place and location so much. Navy Pier short walk away, Magnificent Mile even closer. All staff members I encountered were beyond helpful and friendly. GREAT JOB DOUBLETREE! (Oh, and don't forget yummy cookies!)

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel with the essentials”
Reviews.Author: traveler60305
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at this hotel during a short business trip. The rooms were clean with great amenities. The staff was excellent and were able to anticipate the expectations and needs of my colleagues and I.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: djdrake12
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree is a wonderful hotel. It is located right downtown within minutes walk of the Navy pier. The rooms are large and spacious. And the best are very comfortable. The porters are great but the front desk staff always seem to have better things to do.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but expensive and everything costs extra.”
Reviews.Author: fern48
Reviews.Content: Room was nice, bedding was exceptional even though the bed was very firm, and I didn't really sleep well, although I suppose it's a personal preference thing. I got into the tub to take a hot bath and there were a few hairs in the tub. Not very appealing. As other reviewers have mentioned, be extra careful not to touch anything on the snack bar in your room, it is pressure sensitive, and if you move something you will be charged for it. That would be difficult if I had been traveling with children. Location is excellent. Gym is free however everything else has a cost. Drinks very expensive, but I think you expect that in Chicago. The lunch that was served at my conference was absolutely one of the best lunches I have ever recieved, lovely and deliciious. Navy Pier and the lakeshore is just a short walk away. The staff was excellent, and if you're interested in going to Geno's East (highly recommended and only a few blocks away), ask for a coupon at the concierge desk for preferred seating. You get to wait in the short line instead of the long one. :) One of the staff who was just riding in the elevator with us advised us of this. I really enjoyed my stay here, and love love love Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Above Avg. service, rooms good but not great”
Reviews.Author: munk79
Reviews.Content: We stayed here using Priceline and got a deal. I called ahead of time to notify them that my wife was on some medication that needed to be refrigerated, they said it wouldn't be a problem to put one in our room. When we arrived late (9:15pm), Marcus checked us in. GREAT guy and very helpful. I was a lil worried about the fridge cuz I called again and they said something like "umm...you'll have to tell them when you arrive cuz we don' thave your room reserved yet" But as soon as I started speaking to Marcus, all worries were gone. I appreciated him. I was a little disappointed that they didn't give us a King room, but two queens...but we got the free fridge ($70value)and the room i got was only $60...so I didn't wanna push the issue. The room itself was nice. It had a long window bench/seat that was comfy and nice. We had a good view of the NW skyline (Trump/Tribune/etc). The bed was comfy, but the down pillows weren't that great. Wish they ahd a normal foam pillow available in the room. Our shower was kinda in shambles though....handle and plug were loose and not that great. But the showerhead was great and the tub was clean...which are what counts. We used the bellman to hold our luggage while we were in the city after we checked out. Quick service and friendly guys. They didn't charge us for it, but we gave a nice tip. The Markethouse restaurant was pretty good for dinner. One thing that was rather stupid...they charge like $15 to use the indoor pool! Come on, really? I've been to better hotels, but this wasn't too bad and the customer service was good. I'd probably go to hte Hyatt on Wacker instead or some other ones. But for the cheap price via Priceline, it was a decent deal.

Reviews.Title: “Busy Hotel Yet Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: maybe08007
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my 16 yr old daughter for a long weekend. The Doubletree was nicely appointed, clean, and in a good location. The concierge was most helpful along with the very polite and pleasant doormen, especially Vladimir. There was good coffee in the room and the temperature control was quite efficient. There is a bar and restaurant/bar in the lobby along with an Einstein Bagels. We walked to many nearby places including Navy Pier and the Museum of Contemporary Art, the Hancock Observatory and, of course, Michigan Avenue for awesome shopping. Buses were useful for getting to the Museums and South Side. We recommend getting a city bus pass at Dominics across from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Smileypigs
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel at a great location. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Only complain is the elevator gets a little slow during "rush hour". Dont bother to book a lake view since our room only has a glimps of lake at the right upper corner. Its more like a parking lot view. Overall we enjoyed our stay and will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, good amenities but don't pay extra for a lake view room”
Reviews.Author: WindyHillWanderer
Reviews.Content: 3 of us booked 2 rooms thru expedia (flight and accomodation) . 1 couple plus a friend... We have 2 minor compalints.... we booked thru expedia and they were offering an extra $20 per night per room with a lake view..we knew the lake was about five blocks away but (4 nights at $20 x 2 rooms adds up to $160 extra)..anyway it was like an expisode from Fawlty Towers..we didn't expect to see the Hanging Gardens of Babylon or the Victoria Falls but we did expect to see a reasonable view of the lake. Well the lake was there but you could only see a small portion of it to your right. Our mistake and I would recommend to others not to bother forking out extra money for a lake view room. the other complaint was that on check in we were given rooms on separate floors (24th and 26th) which seemed strange as we had requested adjoining rooms, after realising this we turned backed to reception and they gave us 2 rooms on the 24th floor seaprated by one room (that was acceptable)...so kudos to the staff for fixing that problem up but how they could stuff it up in the first place beggars belief. the business center..i did not bother using it after I found out that it cost $5 per 15 minutes... in this day and age when hotels like super 8 and comfort inn provide free internet , double tree seemed to have dropped the ball on this part of modern life. (i did not have a lap top so I have to rely on business centres in hotelsi) overall the experience was very satisfying. The hotel is in a great location and is close to the magnificent mile, good restaurants and the river. Public transport (train) is about a mile away but is easty to use.There are plenty of cabs to use. the chicago river is within walking distance. We would recommend the hotel to anyone visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: LADWhitePlains
Reviews.Content: First, we chose the DOUBLETREE for and extended Chicago weekend because we wanted to be close to public transportation, and to the downtown area. In addition we were confident that the DOUBLETREE brand would not have any unwanted surprises. We were not surprised! The hotel is located a few blocks from the Chicago River and the boat rides and a few blocks from NAVY PIER. The concierge was extremely helpful when we needed information on using public transport to OAK PARK (home of the FLWright museum) and the University of Chicago (home of the Robie House). He pointed us to the grocery store two blocks away where we bought all day subway/bus passes which proved invaluable. The room itself was comfortable and fairly spacious. No complaints here. The only downside, as is often the case with higher-priced hotels, is that in-room WIFI is $10 a day although its free in the hotel lobby. On the first day, the service kept cutting out, and, on check out, I mentioned this to the front desk and was immediately credited! The view from our room was great and the lake is visible from most floors. There is an EINSTEIN BAGEL store in the lobby which proved immensely popular in the morning. Be prepared for a bit of wait. One morning we ventured in the hotel restaurant for a typical, over-priced, breakfast. While seated, we could not help but notice the frequent arrival of natives Chicagoans, across the street in a place called the WEST EGG CAFE. The line soon went out the door. We tried it the next day, and are delighted to report it was TWICE as good and HALF as expensive as the hotel! Don't miss this place for breakfast. All in all, a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: cmotsinger
Reviews.Content: My mom and I took my 9 yr old daughter to Chicago for our "first annual girls weekend" and trip to the American Girl store (of course). We couldn't have picked a better hotel to stay in. As soon we arrived and our luggage was on the cart "Big Ben" (one of the bellman) took my daughter on a luggage cart ride to the elevator. I can't explain the impression made except that she couldn't leave or come in the rest of the weekend without saying hi to Ben. She even got a pic with him that I know she will treasure. The entire staff was friendly and helpful. Our room had a great view and was so comfortable. Loved how modern everything was. The beds were super comfy and the bathroom was very clean. Everything was easy to walk to from that location and I know this is where we will stay when the second annual trip comes around!!!

Reviews.Title: “Average... Not bad but not as great as I expected”
Reviews.Author: ericoa1
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the DoubleTree but it was mainly because of the location. And I assume thats what I was really paying for. I have nothing bad to say about my stay there but it was not a "grand" as I expected of; 1. a Hilton Hotel, and 2. for the price being paid. By all means stay there because its clean, in a great location and the price is comparable to most places in that area, but don't expect too much. I would recommend asking for a view facing the Navy Pier or you will end up seeing the top of a garage. But the location is great; tons of shopping a block away, many restaurants, Navy Pier, Millenninm Park, River tours, etc are all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Weekend Trip!!”
Reviews.Author: ShelliTatro
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree with another couple over Memorial Day weekend and had a wonderful trip! This was our first trip to Chicago and is definitely a great memory. The Doubletree's service was outstanding (the fresh baked warm chocolate chip cookes were fantastic!) and the location was perfect. Close to everything.......attractions, shopping, transportation, etc. Can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyable hotel; great location; large rooms; wonderful pool and deck; and wonderful chocolate chip cookies.”
Reviews.Author: swyatt5
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and had a wonderful time. The hotel was conveniently located to most sights, restaurants and shopping. There was even a great grocery store in the next block. The service was great as was the room and the chocolate chip cookies. The room was large and comfortable. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in downtown”
Reviews.Author: parthshukla
Reviews.Content: Go for a quick run on lakeshore or walk a few steps to the magnificent mile. Perfect place for business travelers, I have stayed at this hotel numerous times. The staff is always polite, accommodating and service is top notch.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION to Navy Pier”
Reviews.Author: MIRockHunter
Reviews.Content: The Tallships arrived in Chicago the end of August, and a week long celebration took place out in Lake Michigan and at Navy Pier. A friend and I stayed at the Doubletree Hotel, just a short walk of a few blocks to the Pier. We also hopped on and off the Free Navy Pier Trolly which dropped us within one block of the hotel. We were part of a volunteer crew for one of the Tallships and had long hours working out at the ship giving tours to the visitors. I hadn't been in the hotel since it changed over to a Hilton Property, but had always loved it when it was a Holiday Inn. I was pleasantly surprised at all of the modern updates. The rooms are still spaceous, bright, clean and comfortable. I always ask for a higher floor room just to get rid of the heavy traffic noise and ambulance noise. The Market Place restaurant just blew us away with great service and a most wonderful meal. I highly recomment eating in the hotel. Prices are reasonable too and it is a great atmosphere. Service was A+. You won't be disappointed with your stay here. It's also just a short walk up to Michigan Avenue and just across the street from West Egg. Parking is a bit expensive, but you can park at Navy Pier or some of the other spots for less. Free Internet is only in the Lobby, but a comfortable spot for you and other computer users. There's even a large serving bar with couches and little tables for your lap top.

Reviews.Title: “The worst customer service I've ever seen - EVER”
Reviews.Author: Vmesa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree in Downtown Chicago. Nice place/rooms etc. After leaving the hotel my daughter realized that she had left a blouse in the closet. We called immediately and they said that someone from housekeeping would go and check on it. Well we checkout at 9 a.m. the call was placed before 10 a.m. the shirt WAS in the closet. No one called back for two days we were told that someone would call us back. FINALLY we got a hold of housekeeping who basically said T.S. when asked to speak the general manager he told us HE WAS THE GM. Really the head of Housekeeping was the GM on a Saturday. No one offered to reimburse us for our room or even apologize and offer any type of customer service that you would expect from a hotel of this supposed quality. If you took one of their handtowels you'd have to get a second mortgage to pay them back. CUSTOMER SERVICE IS THE MAINSTAY OF THIS TYPE OF BUSINESS. I am so disappointed really disappointed I have recieved better customer service at Taco Bell.

Reviews.Title: “Highrise hotel”
Reviews.Author: jgadkins
Reviews.Content: This is your standard upper/middle tier business hotel. However, it would not preclude some pleasure in seeing the sights of the area. Good places to eat in the area with variety. Had a great meal at a Japanese place about a block away. Had a business lunch buffet at the hotel and it was tasty. The meeting room we had was too small and too cold. Urban parking is not cheep, so be ready for 40 dollars a night.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: professorshorthair
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel on Hotwire and got a good value. There is a tunnel at the end of Erie St to get to Lake Michigan. Try the West Egg for breakfast which is next to the hotel. The swimming pool is great.

Reviews.Title: “Good find in second city”
Reviews.Author: lizardMarquette_MI
Reviews.Content: Hotel is small, so I liked it's easy in and out.decor is more retro. And rooms are fine. Like the fact they have lots of electrical outlets. Room is also conducive to getting work done. I like the location, easy to get around. The hotel has a decent restaurant called Marketplace that serves unique dishes & uses local produce. Staff at both places are helpful and extremely nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELADIX
Reviews.Content: Clean place with friendly staff. I would only stay there again if it was the cheapest in chicago. My wife would prefer a little more luxurious. No hot tub. Sheets were very soft & comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended-Stay Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: PAHITTHEROAD
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, the bad outways the good for this hotel. Here is the good: The Doubletree was recently renovated, the beds are comfortable and the location is good. The bad. Poor housekeeping and paper thin walls. Although the hotel was renovated, the bathroom doesn't have a fan and the ceiling was full of mildew and paint was peeling. Altough we had 2 in our party-bath only had, 2 towels, 2 hand towels and washclothes-no bathmat.. I used small handtowel and almost hurt myself when I got out of shower and lost my footing on tile floor. Missing soap and hairdryer had broken prongs. We experienced same problem as other entries with paper thin walls-- loud talking around 5:00 a.m. I thought the talking was in the hall so I opened the door only to find out that noise was coming from next door. When I complained about housekeeping issues at checkout (we left 2 days early) I was told that they had a long list of complaints about the room. Since I didn't make any complaints, these must have been from previous stay. Do yourself a favor, if you want to spend $200 plus per night, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mmig222
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location and within (close) walking distance to nearly everything youâ€™d want to experience in Chicago. Nightlife, shopping, dining, architectural tours, fabulous parks, Navy Pier the Art Institute are just a short walk from this hotel. The hotel itself is nice. Itâ€™s clean and comfortable and reasonably priced but the location is the main draw here. Itâ€™s a great place for a weekend getaway for friends or couples trying to budget a bit and it is a casual enough spot to bring a family with young children. There is a bagel and coffee shop in the hotel which makes for a quick and easy breakfast before heading out to explore or catching your shuttle to the airport. This is not the place to stay if you are looking for luxury or exclusivity.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay here again! The rooms...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I will never stay here again! The rooms are updated with new finishings, but that's all that was upgraded. The WALLS ARE PAPER THIN. The people next door came in from the bar at 4 am and were not being exceptionally loud, yet I could hear every word they said. I realize this is downtown Chicago, but I would think that one could get a decent hotel for $250 a night. Spend your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value, good stay”
Reviews.Author: michiganmarlon
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree Mag Mile (which isn't actually on the Mag Mile) is a fine place to stay for those seeking dependable chain hotel comfort in great location in downtown Chicago's Streeterville area. It will be very familiar to anyone who knows Doubletree hotels - a freshly baked cookie at check-in. The lobby is a little dated looking, but fairly large and usually busy. The lower level of the lobby has lounging areas, conference rooms and an overpriced business center. The rooms are large and very comfortable. They're modern and well-equipped, and the beds are uber-comfy. The bathrooms are also very large with plenty of counterspace, if a little plain. The shower pressure is fine, and there are Neutrogena bath products at your disposal. The snack tray in the room is touch-sensitive, so don't bump the dresser to hard or you might find an unexpected charge for pretzels on your bill. Thankfully, the coffeemakers are fronted by (very good) Wolfgang Puck coffees and actual liquid Coffee Mate, rather than that powdered crap. The TV set was an older model, although I'm told the hotel is in the process of updating to the flat-screen standard. The air conditioning was more than adequate - the room was frigid even though the temp outside was approaching 95 degrees. I didn't use the room service or visit in the in-house restaurant. There's an Einstein Bagels outlet just off the lobby. The location is a great one for visiting Chicago. It's a couple of (long) blocks from N. Michigan Avenue, and there are plenty of restaurants and stores in the blocks around the hotel, including a Dominick's grocery store and a multiplex movie theater. The proximity to Navy Pier also meant that there were a few too many screaming children in the hotel for my taste. Two CTA bus lines (66 Chicago and 157 Streeterville) stop right at the hotel's Fairbanks St. entrance. Several other bus lines run up and down Michigan, and the CTA red line Grand subway stop is about a four-block walk away. The Doubletree is a fine place to stay. My only real gripe was that the four elevators could get very slow at times.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jwlsTrentham
Reviews.Content: We had a top floor room, plenty of space for the four of us. Wonderful stop- see the bean, the art gallery is truly world class, the Ledge is scary, the shopping excellent,the zoo terrific and free and having a cocktail in the John Hancock bar after the sun goes down is unforgettable- be patient, it is well worth the wait. The rooms are good, the pool wonderful in the summer and the staff friendly and efficient. Three minutes walk to the magnificent mile- my shopaholic daughter was in seventh heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, better in a room with a view.”
Reviews.Author: Montoya99
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in early August as part of Great Rail Journey party. Unfortunately we ended up in a room with no view at all except for a roof. Location was good for Hancock Tower and Navy Pier though.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: dbokie
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel was very good. Fast check in, always love warm cookies. Room was a decent size with a great view of the lake. It was clean and looked up to date. Bathroom lighting was a bit dim, but that was my only complaint. It could be easily corrected by adding sconces to both sides of the mirror. Location is great with easy access to the Mag. Mile and the Navy Pier.

Reviews.Title: “I was a little Disappointed with the...”
Reviews.Author: trippinmama
Reviews.Content: I was a little Disappointed with the doubletree after staying there on August 10th. The room lacked a coffee maker, but had the coffee accessories, there were large black hairs in the tub and the TV was very dated. However we did order room service since we got to the hotel late and the food was suprisingly good. We order a Mac and cheese for my son and when they viewed the order they sent up a beverage free of charge for my son since we hadn't ordered one. The next morning we went to the bfast buffet which was included in our room rate and was surprised by the selection. There was hot food as well as fresh fruit, cereals, yogurt with various toppings and decent coffee. Parking was outrageous of course, but it is at all downtown hotels. Overall the room was a bit dissapointing, but the staff/ service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, definately recommend!”
Reviews.Author: lorose
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Doubletree. The location was perfect... close to Magnificent Mile, close to Navy Pier, not too far from Millenium Park either. We were on the 6th floor, and had no problems with waiting long for elevators at all. Rooms are spacious, plenty of room for our family. Pool was fun... a little cold... but felt great given the hot weather! It was a good size pool. We enjoyed watching the Navy Pier fireworks from the pool deck Wednesday eveningn. We felt we got a great price for our 4 nights there. Although everyone was friendly the bellhops were by far the friendliest people there... all of them were so friendly and helpful. We saw them throughout our stay and they alway greeted us and asked the kids how their days were - such great service. One noticed my son's socce shirt and had a nice conversation with him about soccer and the World Cup. My son thought that was so cool that a "grown up" would want to talk to him about that!!! We'd definately stay there again when we come back to Chicago. Thank you!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect except for slow elevators”
Reviews.Author: JetsettingFoodie
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, clean & spacious rooms, friendly staff...my only complaint was that the elevators often took an unreasonably long time to arrive, but I'm hoping that was a temporary issue. Otherwise, I absolutely recommend this hotel. We stayed there while attending a wedding and got a great rate as part of the wedding party. Oh, and the fresh baked cookies we were treated to upon arrival were delicious and a welcome treat! Conveniently located near Michigan Ave/restaurants and just 1-2 blocks away from a grocery store and drug store.

Reviews.Title: “We'll stay here again next visit to Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: ohio_planner
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5-day family vacation to Chicago, and we were impressed with the Doubletree Hotel. All the staff were friendly and helpful throughout our stay. Concierge helped us navigate our way on bus routes, and helped my husband figure out a problem with his Stubhub tickets for the Cubs game. Getting around town from the Doubletree was easy, and we were Chicago newbies. The bus stop we used most often was 2 blocks away. We were close enough to walk the whole way to Navy Pier. We parked our van at InterPark, which is just across the street from Doubletree and significantly cheaper than the hotel lot. We could see our car from our hotel window. Very easy walk to Dominick's grocery store (bought our visitor bus passes there), 7-11, West Egg Cafe, Baskin Robins ice cream. Everything you need is nearby. The room was clean, had 2 queen size beds, and bathroom was fine. Room had ironing board and hair dryer. We were advised at check-in to move the snack tray (with computer sensors on it) up high so our kids wouldn't fool with it, causing charges to the room.
