When my husband tried to move the tray up high, all the snacks fell off and we were worried we would be charged for everything! The front desk clerk was understanding, and said it was no problem. This must happen often... The rooftop pool was nice, had plenty of chairs and towels, and was the perfect relaxation spot after our long days of sightseeing. Kids thought it was cool to swim on the rooftop surrounded by all the buildings of Chicago. An unexpected bonus: We could see the Wednesday night Navy Pier fireworks from the rooftop pool area. We did not want to pay $25 extra to have a refrigerator in the room, so we brought our own cooler with drinks, some kid snacks, and a gallon of milk. This way, we could eat a quick breakfast in the room (single-serve cereal bowls and some fruit) before heading out for our activities. Saved money and more convenient, and we just refilled the cooler with the hotel ice machine when needed. This hotel was perfect for our needs, the location was great, staff were friendly, and the price was right. We did not have trouble with elevators. There are 5 elevators running at all times, and though we were on the 22nd floor, we never felt like the elevators were slowing us down at all. We loved our trip to Chicago, and the Doubletree Hotel was the perfect home base for all our activities.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, will come back again”
Reviews.Author: Kaia1000
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, clean rooms. Close to everything, within walking distance. Will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel, but a few quirks...”
Reviews.Author: CentralCoastTravelr
Reviews.Content: We recently had a nice stay at this hotel. The location can't be beat if you're looking to be near the magnificent mile or Navy Pier. We were traveling in a group with family and young kids, and got a great price on our two rooms, although parking fees are very pricey (as is typical in a big city) which kind of cancels out that good feeling. :) The hotel lobby is very trendy and nice looking, and everyone at the front desk and concierge desks were very friendly. Our kids had a blast swimming in the fifth floor rooftop pool... and sitting on the window seat overlooking the city and all the action happening twenty floors below! Overall, we had a good experience. There were some quirks that are worth mentioning/knowing, which prevented me from giving this hotel a higher rating. First, the hotel does not pre-block rooms, so when we checked in, even though both rooms were reserved under the same name and credit card, we were not able to get rooms next to one another or even on the same floor without giving up our "view" of the lake and settling for one handicapped room next to the elevator and ice machine. Kind of a bummer considering it was a special birthday trip. Second, the elevators are very busy and it takes a while to catch one... so we felt the higher up you are staying in the hotel, the better. I felt really bad for the people on the lower floors who were trying to make it to the Lobby. People on floors five, six, and seven almost always had to wait for another car because the elevator was already full. Third, housekeeping knocked on our door at 8:45 AM to see if we "needed anything." It just so happened that we were traveling with children and were awake... and housekeeping had not left any coffee packets in the room (the other room we rented had no coffee maker at all) so we took them up on it, but if we had been on a trip where I'd wanted to sleep in, I'd have been pretty upset. I double checked with the housekeeper to make sure she hadn't mistaken our room for some other room that had actually called them, and she said "no." I've worked in a hotel before, and honestly, my impression was that she was just fishing for extra tips. We also never got the extra towels we requested with our reservation, but I'm betting that was due to the last minute room change assignment made at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, SLOW elevators”
Reviews.Author: GingelaOK
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference here and was pleased with the location. The rooms were tidy and the housekeeping staff pleasant and helpful. The snacks during the conference were wonderful. Who doesn't love their cookies! It was really easy to walk to Michigan Ave. and I felt safe being here. The fitness facility was also very nice. The down-side is that the elevators are SO SLOW. And stairs between the main lobby and the second floor are not easily found. The elevator also doesn't go all the way down to the basement for the conference either. Weird layout. The bar is mostly closed from what I can tell. It didn't encourage me to sit and have a drink with my colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Good with a few exceptions”
Reviews.Author: George16
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms for a shopping trip. They honored my adjoining room request but did not have a refridgerator in one room that I requested. No rooms ready early, thats fine but one room was not ready for an hour after 3:00 pm check in. No cookies offered at check in for the first room or on my few stops at front desk waiting on the second room. My daughter finally just asked for some. Requested and got a one hour late checkout but when returning to the room to get bags keys would not work. Had to have security let us in , not worth the extra hour for the hassle. Rooms were fine, clean, nice beds, flat screens etc. No AC on so took a couple hours to get really cool and Chicago was so hot last weekend. Parking is in an attached garage and seems a little pricey, $40.00ish a day. Location was good, easy to Michigan Ave. and Navy Pier. West Egg across the street...great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, clean and quiet,”
Reviews.Author: azogal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night during the busy summer tourist season in Chicago. As many others have mentioned the location is great. I was in a room on the 25th floor that was clean, quiet, and had a great view of the John Hancock building and Lake Michigan. The people at the front desk and the maid were friendly. Though I wasnâ€™t happy that the maid knocked on my door at 8 am in the morning (but this is becoming a more common problem at hotels in general). There is a coffee maker in the room with Wolfgang Puck coffee. There is also an Einsteinâ€™s Bagels connected to the lobby. I did not experience the slow elevators. Perhaps they have fixed them or I used them at un-busy times of the day. There is a self-park garage behind the Doubletree that might charge less than the $41 that Doubletree charges. I did not use the pool, but it did look nice. The snack bags (pretzels, peanuts, party mix) are on a sensor pad and as soon as you pick one up you are chargedâ€¦even if you donâ€™t eat it. This is a very, very bad system and would be a nightmare if you had children with you. I even think you would be charged if you accidentally knocked a bag off the sensors. And, yes, the sign warning you about being charged immediately is tucked behind the bags at the back of the sensor tray.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel. Not perfect but convienient.”
Reviews.Author: TrelaTwo
Reviews.Content: Whatever you do - DO NOT EVEN THINK OF OPENING THEIR REFRIGERATOR TO PUT IN YOUR FOOD OR DRINKS! They charge (by computer) if ANYTHING is moved in fridge! Do not move the snacks on top of THEIR fridge! There is no micro or fridge for your personal use in the room. Beds are comfy, don't know about pillows as I brought my own. Walls were thick enough so that I could not hear neighbors who were partying when I passed by next door in hall. 4 elevators. No waiting

Reviews.Title: “This hotel does not give you nothing for free”
Reviews.Author: thekidwonagain
Reviews.Content: My family and i were on our second vaction to Chicago with the kids.(11 /14). We stay in this hotel for the second time to for a $160 a night. We were hoping that it would change to the better from the first time that we stay in it a year ago. Will it didn't, Still the same. I will start with my review of the good. This hotel is in a good location for downtown Chicago. You can walk to many areas of the city. The Navy Pier is 4 blocks the Mag mile is in four blocks. There are many resturants in this area too. Now for the bad of this hotel. This hotel is owned by Hilton Inc. ,whch is known for there service the and atmosphere . Will at this hotel it doesn't do that both time we were there. First with you stay there in your own car you have to pay $40 a day we were there for 4 days that is $160. I think that if you are stay in the hotel it should be free or maybe $10. If you are not stay have those people pay the $40. Next is if you are a honors member and you have to check in early they will put you in a non member part of the hotel which is the lower half of the hotel where noise street noise is and the rooms are not as nice or as clean. Next thing is if you want a sit down fill breakfast. There is a resturant that is in the hotel it is nice but if you eat there for breakfast you are looking at $20 a person. So that is $80 for four, for staying in your hotel. That should be free or maybe $5 to $10. If you need a sit down breakfast go across the street to Two Eggs,t is alright for $30 for four. Or go to Domonick grocery store down a block. A full grocery store that as everyting. Next complaint is the hotel as no free internet in room just in the lobby so if you are on the 25 floor and need its several times a day happy traveling on the elevator. They have a business center in the hotel but to use the internet or the printer it is $9 for 15 mins. I think that is highway robbery for someone staying in there hotel. It should be free and to print 25 cents a page. So bring you own printer so you can print game tickets and documents I did. Complaint #4 is the Hotel bar, The bar is only open from 11:30am to 7:30pm. How many business and vacationer drink beer, wine or scotch at 11:30 in the morning, and who closes a bar at 7:30pm and in Chicago This is the stupidiest think i have every seen in a bar. I want down to the bar to have some drink with my wife. while the kids were in the room watching TV. We got there at 7:15pm and the bartender said that he as closed the bar for the evening because business is slow and told us to go across the street to Timmy O'toole. Also while I was using the internet in the lobby I watch him turn people away about 25 people in one hour because he was closing the bar and would not open it again. That is some really good 4Star service for you isn't it and lose of money for the hotel. Here is my tip go to Domonicks grocery a block down get your beer & wine. Bring it back to the hotel and drink it in your room or in the lobby while using the internet. But stay in the hotel because of drinking laws. This is a cheaper way of having fun in the lobby and on the internet in the evening. I did it all four nights. Complaint #5 is for this hotel to read. You are Doubletree Hotel in the 80's and 90's you were known for you 4 star service and atmosphere. Get off your money hungry attitude and give your members the service and style that they should get. This hotel did not give anything for free nor did they care. Before I left my Hilton Garden Hotel in the Suburb that was a $110 a night and got free in room internet/ breakfast/coffee and the bar was open until 11. So Doubletree get off your high horse and clean up your act I will never stay in a Doubletree again and I have stay in many. So for the people that have read the whole review you make the judgement of staying in this hotel or not. HAPPY TRAVELING AND HAVE A GREAT DAY!

Reviews.Title: “priceline hotel”
Reviews.Author: lscott933
Reviews.Content: i want to first say that we picked hotwire to choose a hotel in downtown chicago. we got this hotel for 77 a night in july. The hotel was really clean. you are about three block to either the navy pier or michigan ave. ohio ave has alot of place to eat on the street over by michigan ave. the rainforest cafe is about six blocks along with the mcdonlds. the only bad thing about this hotel is the price you have to pay to park. it is 41 dollars a night. it right there at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it!”
Reviews.Author: chiefy9
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, stayed one night at the start of my trip before I met up with friends. Short walk from small beach, great if it's hot (which it was). Very close to Navy Pier. Was lucky enough to be in town for the Blackhawks parade which finished a couple of blocks away. Bed big and comfortable. Free wifi in hotel lounge - actually it would have been good to have wifi in the room, but that's a tiny gripe. Staff very friendly and helpful, nothing seemed too much (as is usual in this city). Nice cookie! Get on the red line to wrigleyville for an interesting evening out.

Reviews.Title: “Great location plus rooftop pool is a plus”
Reviews.Author: Liz0595
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay here again. This hotel has an outdoor pool on the fifth floor which makes it really nice to stay here during the summer. They have a server walking around offering drinks (about $7 for a mixed drink). Although I brought a thermos with my own iced tea and that was fine. Only problem I had with the hotel was the parking is $41 for only 24 hours. I parked for 26 hours and was charged $67. Make sure you read the fine print. Also, twice my bedroom key did not work, so I had to go down to the front desk and have it reactivated. Otherwise it was a pleasant stay. We arrived really early and they allowed us to swim for a few hours while they got our room ready, (we left our bags at the desk). Although check in is 3 pm they had our room ready at 1:30 pm. The hotel is in a great location, very close to Michigan Ave and many other sites. We went to a spa called Renew spa located on Michigan Ave, they had a great deal $99 for 1 hour massage, manicure, pedicure if you visit during the week.

Reviews.Title: “ELEVATORS WERE A NIGHTMARE”
Reviews.Author: SaraGood
Reviews.Content: I read some other reviews that said the elevators were bad. They were worse than bad. It was July 4th weekend and I am know at least one of the elevators broke. But, it was a nightmare. Large families with huge bags, baby strollers, car seats, etc. were filling the elevators. Because the elevator system is prroly designed, people were waiting 20 minutes, and then taking the stairs. Doubletree rally needs to do something. Luckily, we found the service elevator. Also, breakfast was overrated. Go across the street to the west egg cafe. delicious :) The doorman was great and the flight check console was great.

Reviews.Title: “great location...incredible bed...sloooooooow elevators”
Reviews.Author: boalex207
Reviews.Content: Recently enjoyed a fine night's stay at the Doubletree Magnificent Mile. We were able to check in about an hour and a half early which was a great start. Ron, at the front desk, wasn't exactly rude, but he won't be winning any Chamber of Commerce awards either. The hotel is pretty much full-service, and is close to pretty much everything in Chicago. We stayed on the 23rd floor and had a great view from our room. The bed and bedding was extremely comfortable and it was difficult to get out of bed. The bathroom was spacious and clean, and the shower's water pressure was good although it never got quite hot enough for my taste. We had appetizers and drinks in the Market House restaurant, which seems to be a nice place, if a little pricey. The mini-burgers were pretty good. There is also a gift shop in the hotel with souvenirs, toiletries, snacks, etc. It was very, very expensive but may come in handy occasionally. Previous reviews about ultra-slow elevators are accurate. Also, the gripes about paying for internet service are legitimate, also. We, too, avoided the $ 6 Pringles and the $ 8 bottled water, but it's available if that's your thing. Ben, the bellman, was very helpful during our checkout. Our flight did not leave until 7:00 p.m. so after we checked out, the hotel held our luggage for a few more hours so we could continue exploring Chicago. My wife fell in love with the bed, so we'll be staying here again next time we visit The Windy City.

Reviews.Title: “Crossroads Weekend”
Reviews.Author: nationalparks
Reviews.Content: We booked the Doubletree as part of a Southwest Vacation package. The hotel has been remodeled and is fairly nice,not great, but adequate. Some areas were overlooked during the rehab. Sound on the television was either loud or could not hear it, the AC in the room would not keep the room cool and all vents were rusty and dirty. The price was good on the vacation deal and the location is fantastic, close to Michigan Ave. and Navy Pier. The outdoor pool is a great setting. The staff was extremely friendly. We were in Chicago for Crossroads Festival and used Chicago's mass transit to the concert and to a Cubs game. West Egg is a must for breakfast and is right across the street from the hotel. All in all, a great weekend in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay in Doubletree Mag Mile!!!”
Reviews.Author: sclark521
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Doubletree Chicago Mag Mile. I booked my trip thru Expedia -- this is my second time using them and I didn't have any problems! My stay there was wonderful. I was a little worried because I was traveling alone -- but not worry, I felt safe my whole vacation. I stayed 6-24 thru 6-27. Check in went smoothy. I was in my room within 10 to 15 minutes (if that) !!! I stayed on the 13th floor -- what a view!!! This was my first trip to Chicago and I made a great choice in the Doubletree Mag Mile, and Michigan Ave. and other sites were within walking distance or by bus (cheaper than cabs and stops right outside the hotel door). The bus to Navy Pier came right by the hotel. My room was very nice, clean and comfortable. Did I mention the view!!! It was awesome. The bed was comfortable. As mentioned before, there was the mini-bar with sensors -- but I didn't touch anything. I went over to Dominiks (right across the street) and picked up my refreshments and snacks! I had breakfast in the Markethouse Restaurant in the hotel the first day -- they had a breakfast buffet - it was good but expensive! For the next couple of days, I went across the street to West Street Cafe -- the breakfast was delicious and much less expensive. I also got a burger from there for lunch -- it was delicious! Overall, I had a great vacation. This will definitely not be my last time in Chicago! I will definitely be back and I will definitely stay at the Doubletree Mag Mile!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: brooklyn24
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here over a weekend in late June, 2010. We arrived early and were able to check in around 11:00am, which was nice. Our rooms were fairly large. The air conditioning worked very well. The bed was very comfortable. Couple of negatives- the TV remote did not work and our shower did not drain. After about 5 minutes you were standing in water up past your ankles. The hotel has a great outdoor pool on the 5th floor, which was a nice place to relax and cool off. They have servers who will bring you food and drinks. The elevators were a major problem. We had to wait a very long time (all times of the day) and we had a hard time finding an elevator going down that wasn't already completely full. They need to fix this- all of the elevators service all 26 floors, so by the time they get to the 10th floor or below there is just no room on them. So we would have to ride the elevator up in order to get a spot on the way down. The location of this hotel is great- you are two blocks off of Michigan Avenue. Overall this hotel was just okay. I would stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Functional and central”
Reviews.Author: drfruenk
Reviews.Content: The best about this hotel is that it has a reasonable price for a very good location. The hotel is surely above average, but also not one of the best hotels I can remember. It is modern, clean and functional. The staff is correct, the breakfast ok, the rooms are large enough and clean. The best thing about the hotel is that it is located at walking distance to the Magnificent mile, Lake Michigan and the harbor, Grant Park and the loop... It is a hotel surely worth considering when staying in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: vacationer16
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights in may at this Doubletree property and i really liked it very much. I got a great deal on Priceline and had called the hotel previously to confirm my bedding requests. On arrival i was informed that they were out of king beds for that night, so they assigned me another room with 2 double beds. When i entered the room i smelled this sweat odor being so repulsive. The odor came from the pillows in the beds. It seems that housekeeping hadn't changed or washed the pillows from the previous guest stay. I called the Front Desk and told them about the situation and they offered to assign me another type of room in a lower floor. Well, i acepted. They other room was clean but still had some odors but i decided no to bother anymore. Einstein Bros bagels downstairs is a plus foor breakfast and a good alternative for the pricey breakfast buffet the hotel offers at $18 plus tax. Also try West Egg Cafe right in front of the hotel. There is wi-fi in the lobby and a kiosk to print your flight boarding passes. The hotel has a swimming pool. I wiill post pictures so you can see it for yourself. Location is very centric to the river, Navy Pier, Michigan Avenue for shopping, John Hancock, etc.... There is also a Imax theather 2 blocks away with a bowling center along. Subway is 4-5 blocks away (Red Line at Grand). This line takes you to the loop and to oher places in the city. Cookies were given at the beggining of my stay and at check out i asked for one and they gave me 2 without problem. The front desk staff is very helpful but i cannot say the same from the concierge guy, who gives directions or recommendations like if he was making you a favor. I would stay again at this hotel expecting the room were clean and spotless upon arrival. I would rate it a solid 3.5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service and awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: TNTraveler37122
Reviews.Content: My wife, son, and I just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. The location was so convenient! Walking distance to many attractions and just a few blocks from the Red Line for others further away. The staff from the cleaning staff to the bellmen to the concierge were all super-friendly and very helpful. The room was a very nice size, was clean, and quiet. Special kudos to the wonderful customer service provided by Assistant Manager Selma! We had an issue with our room assigment and she immediately went to work to remedy the situation to our complete situation and did so with a smile and caring attitude! We will definitely stay here again the next time we visit the wonderful city of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A Place to Sleep, Nothing Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: meg51577
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree is a very average, run-of-the-mill hotel. My room was lacking in cleanliness, as there was hair all over the bathroom floor. In hotels like this where they don't clean the places you can see, I get freaked out walking on the carpet barefoot. The most redeeming quality is the bed, which was very comfy. I also really like that they wash the sheets on the duvet after every guest. My company had a conference here and it too was average. The food was like airport food - edible but certainly nothing you would recommend to someone.

Reviews.Title: “Had the most wonderful stay last week...”
Reviews.Author: Pnunez
Reviews.Content: Had the most wonderful stay last week. The hotel was close to everything:Michigan Ave Shopping, Navy Pier, John Hancock building, and so much more. I commend the staff on the wonderful service they provided. From a friendly smile at check in to great tips at the concierge desk!! The room was amazing! The view...was just the best! Thanks for the great experience and wonderful hospitality!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. But just that”
Reviews.Author: Ayisha27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a long weekend. The accomodations were great. We were given a double room at check in so the first night, we slept in one of the beds just like at home. On the second night, we decided to sleep in the second bed. The frame seemed to be broken so we phoned the front desk and were brought keys to a room across the hall from us. Got in the room and checked the bed and it was the same issue. They use those cheap snap together metal frames so when you sit on the foot of the bed, you can feel the box spring touch the floor. The bed was super comfy though. I even purchased their linens that you can buy online. They are quite expensive but I love the way they feel. They give you cookies whenever you ask and the Einstein Bros bagels downstairs is a plus. This place is a really nice place to crash but activitied beyond that you will have to leave and find elsewhere. Will stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location central to everything for girls weekend”
Reviews.Author: bebe058
Reviews.Content: Just got back from girl's weekend in Chicago. Very nice room. Ask for a room not facing street if you are a light sleeper. There was traffic noise all night long. Hotel staff very helpful and friendly. We were central to Navy Pier, shopping and art institute. The fitness facility in the hotel was probably was impressive. The only complaint would be the $5.95 charge to use the internet.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has a perfect location, helpful staff and daily warm chocolate chip cookies”
Reviews.Author: mmp27
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff handled every request with ease. They were able to direct us to excellent Cubs ticket, a fantastic architecture tour and answer many other questions with ease. Rooms were well priced, comfortable and quiet. Hotel was walking distance to the Magnificent Mile and many other sights. Tip -Skip the observation deck of the John Hancock and spend less at the lounge on a drink or dessert to get the same wonderful view especially at night.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here only if you want to be abused by front desk”
Reviews.Author: upgraded
Reviews.Content: The service at this Doubletree is horrid. The woman at the front desk was arrogant and snotty at check in telling me that there were 250 guests checking in the next day and that I should be satisfied with the room she was giving me even tho I had specifically reserved a room with a king bed and she wasn't going to give it to me. There was only 1 towel in the room. It took 3 calls to get another towel. The hotel is tired and dated. The location is perfect and with better service it would be a good hotel to stay at. But right now its not.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable luxury in great location”
Reviews.Author: UKChicken
Reviews.Content: I don't know if all Doubletree hotels are such high standard, but the 2 we stayed in were excellent. The location of the Doubletree Magnificent Mile was excellent - close enough to get to everything, far enough to be relatively quiet. The rooms were a good size and very comfortable, with lovely bathrooms. It felt like luxury without feeling snobbish. Room service wasn't cheap but was on time, excellent quality, more than sufficient quantity and delivered with a friendly smile. The only downside was the lack of soundproofing. We had a baby move in next door and could hear it cooing (not crying or being particularly loud) and could join in the parents' conversation (we didn't!). Still managed a good night's sleep though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but first impressions were not good”
Reviews.Author: geebop
Reviews.Content: Pros: The hotel was at a great location between Navy Pier and Michigan Avenue. We had a top floor room with a partial view of the lake which also overlooked sections of the city. The beds were comfortable and the room was spacious. The Bagel shop in the lobby was convenient but crowded on some mornings. Cons: Upon arrival, the doorman was busy and asked us to wait while he assisted another guest. To save time, we obtained a luggage cart and began unloading. He immediately left the other guest to inform us that we were not allowed to use the cart--only staff due to 'liability issues.' However, he said we could unload but he would have to roll it inside. We've never heard of such a policy in our travels, however we complied. Then, he informed us that there were no parking spaces in the hotel garage and we were told to 'circle the block' to find a spot on the street until after 5 when spots would be available in the garage--very inconvenient, especially when you are paying $41/day. Perhaps spots should be reserved for guests? We had a room for 4, and this was specified on our reservation, however we had to request a 4th towel both days of our stay. We didn't care for the 'booby trapped' snack tray (sensor) however the previous posts had alerted us to the danger!

Reviews.Title: “Location was great, but the hotel was just "okay"!”
Reviews.Author: Lislcat
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel, because I had enough HHonors points for a free night. We usually stay at one of the Embassy Suites in downtown Chicago, but didn't have enough points for a free night there. Getting off the elevator from the parking garage, you are greeted by a pink lobby. My husband gave me the look that said he was doubting my decision. At check-in, they asked us if we wanted to stay in one room one night and then a different room the next night, since one of them was free for using my HHonors points. We said that we'd rather not have to change rooms and he said, "okay"! He gave us our cookies and our keys and sent us on our way. We were given a room on the 3rd floor, that look out at a wall. No view! My guess, is this is what is given to people who stay at enough Hilton Hotels to earn a free room. We weren't going to be in the room very much and it was a free night's stay, worth approx. $206, so we just went with it. The room was mostly clean, except for hair on the bathroom floor and on the first night, a panel fell off the cabinet on bathroom vanity. We tried to put it back on, but it wouldn't go, so we left it for the cleaning person to deal with. They didn't deal with it, so we had a cabinet door on the floor in the bathroom for our stay. The location of this hotel is great. There is a Dominick's grocery store just a block away and Emilio's Tapas restaurant is just down Ohio about a half a block. It's a wonderful place to eat! Only 2 blocks from Michigan Ave, where all the shopping is. We got a bill after the first night, that said we had been charged $206 for our night's stay. Fine. The following morning, I received a bill stating that they were going to charge us $20 for the guest room. We also had a charge for a video game, but my daughter did play a game, so that was fine. I talked to the person at the desk and I got no explanation for it, but she took it off my bill. So check you bill very closely!!!! This wasn't a bad place to stay, but there were just many things about it, that just made it not a great place to stay either. We had just come from staying at a very nice Embassy Suites in another city and this seemed like a very big step down. In large cities, I usually pick 4 star hotels, because we think they would be considered 3 star anywhere else. This hotel was definitely a 2 1/2 - 3 star. The cost of parking for the weekend, was around $80, I believe. I guess I learned, getting a free room, is never free. My husband said he'd rather pay more and stay at an Embassy Suites with breakfast included and the manager's special in the evening. Also, pink with lime green made it look like a cheesy hotel from the 60's or 70's. If they just renovated, they should of changed that. Free internet connection in the lobby only, so the lobby was always crowded.

Reviews.Title: “magnificent location”
Reviews.Author: brpadali
Reviews.Content: wonderful hotel in a wonderful location: so close to michigan ave for the shopping, close to the attractions, navy pier and millenium park ( just walk or take the bus 3). The rooms are very clean and the staff is very kind and helpful ( at the concierge they booked for me the tickets for a show in a minute) . there was just a misunderstanding with the door man when it was time to go to the airport: I asked for a cab, he called a car: I said that I didn't want to spend more than 40 dollars ( I spent 37 dollars to get to the hotel from o' hare inter airport) and he said it was ok after he had talked to the taxi driver, who on the contrary wanted 45. I'm sorry for the driver, but I didn't want the car, I had been very clear to the door man. So don't let be misunderstood!

Reviews.Title: “Our expectations where exceeded!”
Reviews.Author: Louisianasweet
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Doubletree for one week visiting the city of Chicago. We were pleased with the hotel and the staff was helpful in meeting our needs. The location alone is great, but as the mother of our family, cleanliness rules! We would stay here again..most certain!

Reviews.Title: “good location but downside is...”
Reviews.Author: samatayo
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there March 31 - April 1, 2010, parking fee is too much we paid $41 per stay no discount for hotel guest but you could have unlimited in and out of the property. First day first impression nice hotel lobby and there's a bagel stand inside too, also they give you doubletree chocochip cookies upon check-in. The room they assigned to us is in the eight floor which is fine but BATHROOM was not acceptable cause the ceiling has molds paint was peeling and shower curtain has molds too pls. refer to the photos I included. Next day I requested room change and they gave us an upgraded room in the 25th floor, thanks to Armado (the front desk clerk). They don't have fitness cntr but they have outdoor pool which was close when we visited.

Reviews.Title: “Great decision to stay with Doubletree!”
Reviews.Author: jmhmom
Reviews.Content: We got an incredible deal on a double queen room for Spring Break. I was a bit leary because of the great price, but we were VERY pleased with our decision. It is a little walk to Michigan Ave. However, it was worth it to us to walk a couple of blocks in order to save a bunch of money. Parking was convenient and easy to get in and out of. Yes, it was $40 a day. But, its Chicago, and it seems to be the norm. If we had been staying longer, we would have taken the commuter train in for less money. Our only complaints with this hotel were very minor. No fan in the bathroom, and a couple of handyman jobs like the doorstop on the bathroom door that had been broken off, and the bathroom drain plug that looked like it needed to be fixed or replaced. However, I am being very picky when I mention these things. My absolute favorite part of this hotel was how quiet it was...even with it being spring break. The beds were fantastic and we slept soundly. Overall, this was a great hotel for our Chicago experience. We needed a nice, clean, quiet hotel, and Doubletree met those needs.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent, Quiet Rooms and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MONYLINE
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here for a couple of nights for the past few weeks. THEY GET IT. They instantly welcome you back. Im a HHonors Diamond level member and they make you instantly feel like a Star at check in. Rooms are great, quiet, consistent etc. Location is great and the price specials at this property make it a real sleeper for Chicago. Highly Reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Puddle_Jumper_2010
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of proximity to the Lego store and ESPN Zone, the positive reviews on Trip Advisor, and because I got a great AAA rate. This is not the trendiest hotel in Chicago but it was nicely decorated and a great value for the money. Rooms were very large for Chicago standards and looked new. Arranged for a late checkout and had them hold our bags after checkout while we were sightseeing. Had no issues and service was very fast. Only drawback was that the lines at the front desk were often very long. We ate three times in the hotel restaurant - once for lunch (a $7 soup/sandwich special that was fantastic), once for dinner, and once at the breakfast buffet. I expect to pay more for hotel food but thought it was priced similar to other local places. If you stay here, try the Thai place down the block or Emelio's Tapas. Both were great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JaneHill
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend for 2 nights for St Patricks weekend. The hotel is great location and on arrival after a 9 1/2 hr flight were extremely friendly & welcoming. We recieved a lovely warm cookie on arrival, which I thought was a nice touch. We booked a twin room, they were very spacious & clean. The beds were very comfortable & had a great sleep. On the Saturday morning, we were walking distance from catching the River being dyed green. The hotel is a great location & walking distance from all amenites.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a good price, but don't pay for the lake view”
Reviews.Author: RealNameMarv
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel a number of times over the past 10 years. I have found it to be convenient, quiet and reasonably priced. They have done a good job remodeling and updating this Doubletree ... the lobby area is modern and the rooms are fine, remembering that this is less expensive than the nearby Hyatt, Embassy Suites or Sheraton. If you have not stayed at a DoubleeTree in the last few years, Hilton appears to be injecting a little style into many of them, and a few (e.g. The Wit in the Loop area of Chicago, the Hotel Minneapolis) are stylish in a W sense but with better quality. However, last night I paid an extra $15 for a "lake view" room. Technically "lake view" is true - I can see a sliver of blue between the buildings and parking structures. See my photo for free. Just don't pay for it. :-)

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShilpaS
Reviews.Content: i stayed there for 2 nights and 3 days and it is a very accessible location. The only downside was the car parking fees we had to pay. it totaled to almost 80 bucks for 2 days. nut it was otherwise an absolutely nice hotel. The rooms were spacious and absolutely immaculately maintained. A very modern feel to the room.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing but still have time to turn it around..”
Reviews.Author: SGreene
Reviews.Content: I booked my trip through Priceline and yes I got a great rate. I called about three days prior to arrival and requested a room with a king bed, of course it is just a request. It is clear that the hotel is not full. At check in, we were not greeted very warmly. It was almost as if I was disturbing the front desk person. No"welcome to the Doubletree" just "are you checking in?" I asked about a king room and she answered swiftly no! She proceeded to check us and in and hand us our warm cookies, give us our room keys. I asked what room we were in and she stated "We do not blurt out room numbers here" My husband and I were the only ones at the desk at the time and she did not even point out the room number. She was just rude and not welcoming. The hotel is nice enough, a bit run down. Room is very small, no refrig just mini bar. The elevators were a bit dirty - need a good vacuuming. There is wireless access in the rooms for $20 per 24 hours so I am currently in the lobby posting this review. I have stayed at several hotels in Chicago, I travel here often and this is probably at the bottom of my list and I will not stay here again. So far the best part of the stay is the bellman and the concierge were both helpful and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and attention to customer service”
Reviews.Author: toodles7
Reviews.Content: I was able to get tickets to an Oprah taping so the 3 of us booked a package with JetBlue and chose this property. It was GREAT for a 5-day stay!!!! Location was perfect. Egg place across street is terrific for breakfast. We tried a different place the last morning and were sorry. Eienstein's Bagel is on-site and we went there one day. Dominic's grocery is a block away - perfect for wine purchase, etc. Concierage so helpful as well as bellmen and front desk staff. Navy Pier with Shakespere Theatre nearby and we caught a Noel Coward play and cabbed it to ARt Institute. You can purchase 1/2 price tickets at Randolph & Michigan across from Cultural Center or across from Water Tower Place at Visitor's Center. Lunch at cafe in new wing of Art Institute was very good as was Spiaggia Cafe and especially Bistro 110. Don't miss John Hancock Bldg. - 96th floor which is a magnificent city view and free if you buy a drink.

Reviews.Title: “The staff were so friendly we felt like we were at home.”
Reviews.Author: sandandsunNovaScotia
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Doubletree in late December 2009. We enjoyed everything about it, from the warm chocolate chip cookies on check in, the cleanliness, the style of the rooms, the close proximity to everything, to the biggest highlight, which was the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. Everyone there went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable and to attend to our evey need. I usually like to try new places when I go away, but when we left the Doubletree I knew I would certainly stay there again and would tell anyone I knew that was travelling from Nova Scotia to Chicago how great it was. In fact, last night I booked another stay there for July 2010 and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Just Average”
Reviews.Author: spackler43
Reviews.Content: The Double Tree Hotel Chicago - Magnificent Mile is not even on the Magnificent mile its 3 very dirty block to the east. The rooms are very small and cramped, I hit my leg on the ac unit getting out of the bed. The non smoking room smelled like smoke. There was dirt in the corner of the shower. The towels were like sandpaper. There are not any vending machines but you can get a $4.00 can of coke out of the mini bar in your room. The bed was one of the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever stayed in. The rest of the room was clean (other than the smoky smell) and the view was nice. The hotel staff are great, all very friendly and helpful, maybe the best in Chicago. If your able to get a good deal on this hotel then I would recommend it otherwise there are better options out there.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: ashmc
Reviews.Content: My ratings for this hotel reflect my opinion based on the things we were looking for....great location, clean and comfortable rooms and great service. This hotel far exceeded what we were looking for in a city "home base" hotel. The service was well above average. The rooms were not what I would consider luxurious, but that is not what we were looking for in this trip. They were, however, very modern and stylish, clean and very comfortable. The location was perfect. Two blocks from Michigan Ave...very close, but far enough away to escape the massive hustle and bustle. We loved this hotel and will stay again if given the opportunity on our next visit to Chicago!!

Reviews.Title: “Ruined our Vacation, Thanks DoubleTree/Hilton”
Reviews.Author: CEOBroker
Reviews.Content: We are Hilton Diamond members, and decided to go on vacation to chicago as there where some shows and basketball games me and me wife wanted to go see. We planned on staying 2 weeks in Chicago at the Doubletree Mag Mile. So we arrive and are informed there is a $50 per day hold, PLUS incidentals. So just to check-in for our 2 weeks was a $700 deposit, yes let me repeat again $700 plus incidentals. Needless to say this was Half of our allotted vacation funds. We ended up not being able to see shows or go to games and also had to change where we choose to eat, all because they needed a $700 deposit for our 2 week stay. THANKS DOUBLETREE for ruining our vacation, I would not recommend this place to anyone for any reason. If we had wanted to just sit in a room and stare at the walls, we could have just stayed home. Did I mention we are Diamond Members with the Hilton? Do not expect anything from the hilton of you are a Diamond member. In fact we have been told on numerous occasions that most Hiltons are private owned and WE CAN'T DO ANYTHING. If these hotels are not affiliated with the Hilton, then why are they on their website, Again, unless you want to pay a crazy deposit, STAY AWAY. Staff is rude like most hotels, but whats new? Got to love us americans and our super great customer service, What a JOKE........... Good Luck, Angry Hilton Diamond Member

Reviews.Title: “Awful Stay ~ Dirty rooms and bad service”
Reviews.Author: JenniferChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: I was beyond disapointed with this stay. I have only had pleasant experiences with Hilton before so I was unprepared for the drasticly different experience I had at this one. Things did not start off well when the original room I checked into had used tissue and food crumbs on the floor and a spider on the headboard of one of the beds. I requested another room and when I moved into that one there were no bugs or tissues but there was pubic hair and other dirt on top of the toilet, something sticky on the bathroom wall and not all of the toiletries were present. When we requested housekeeping the next day we had to ask 3 times between 12pm and 6pm before anyone came to the room. We had the exact same experience the second day of calling 3 times in 2 hour increments before anyone would service the room and at this point we were out of both toilet paper and tissues because they had not been replenished the day before. I tried to use the business center and the printer was malfunctioning. When I called the front desk for help instead of sending someone down they transferred me to the company that manufactures the printers where I listened to hold music for ten minutes and finally gave up. Finally, on the third morning of our stay the bill was slipped under our door and we were charged for 3 nights of parking when we didn't have a vehicle with us so my departure was delayed as I had to wait in the checkin/checkout line to resolve this before I could leave. There were other smaller issues we encountered here that are not worth mentioning at this point but they all added up to an awful stay. Not at all the way I wanted to spend my last few vacation days of the year.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: LyndaMN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree on Christmas Day and the 26th. The hotel had a multi-page newsletter listing which restaurants, attractions, theaters, etc., would be open over the holidays. This saved us a lot of time and effort! PROS: Nice bedding spacious and clean room counter space in bathroom hair dryer single cup coffee maker (much more sanitary than the carafe style!) Three blocks from Michigan Ave walkable to Navy Pier One block from Dominick's (a nice grocery store with a deli and bakery) Ample drawer space Friendly staff (Pablo comes to mind!) When we entered the room the lamps were already on! They must activate the lamps from the front desk after the room is assigned. A very nice touch. THE BEST CHOCOLATE CHIP COOKIES EVER (one free per preson at check-in) Free internet in the lobby, about $10 a day in the room ONE CON: When we walked in I noticed a bunch of jars sitting next to the TV. That part of the room was sort of dark, even with the lights on. I didn't notice the card placed near the jars and I picked up a jar to see what it was. My husband told me to put the jar down because if it is picked up - it is purchased. You really can't see what is in each jar while they are sitting on the tray. (photo included.) The jars held grossly expensive gummy bears, nuts, candy, etc. I think that this tray of jars needs better and bigger signage, needs to be placed in a better lit part of the room and needs to be placed higher than a child can reach. You walk into that room with two youngsters and you might be buying $50 worth of gummies and pretzels! ONE SUGGESTION: Since it appears that management reads these reviews (which is another 'PRO'), why not stock the mini-bar and those dang snack jars with affordable food/drink from which you make a modest profit? Many more people would buy a $1.50 Snickers from the mini-bar than a $4 one - and you still make money. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would come back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient To Shopping and Dining”
Reviews.Author: RideAMotorcycle
Reviews.Content: What downtown hotel provides a comfortable room within a short walking distance to the Magnificent Mile? Well, in word "many". This hotel has nice rooms at a reasonable cost for a night. The room was clean, although not quiet. I believe our proximity to the elevator shafts made me feel that there was a truck moving nearby. I'll make sure we get a room a bit further from them. The hotel lobby is small and the only spot where the Wi-Fi was available at no cost. The breakfast buffet is waaaay over-priced, limited in selection, and the quality of the items where middle of the road. We would probably spend another night here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good value,”
Reviews.Author: ace2301
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Thanksgiving weekend with my wife. Good location, clean, good service. A little dated. Wish there was an indoor pool and hot tub available. Breakfast would be nice too, but for the price we paid through hotwire is was a good deal. Parking is also expensive at $40+ a night, but this seems to be the norm for the area. There is a parking garage across the street that is $31 per 24 hours if you want to save some money.

Reviews.Title: “solid average, but nice location”
Reviews.Author: JSkiba
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located just off the Magnificent Mile which has excellent shopping, and is walking distance to many attractions (though not particularly close to the subway). The hotel is nice and rooms are well decorated (though no LCD tvs), but when we arrived, there was no shampoo in the room, no wash cloths (we had to call the front desk to have them and the shampoo brought up), and worst of all, the toilet seat was dirty and there was a used wash cloth from the previous guest drapped over the shower curtain. My wife and I would probably choose to stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: mcadrenaline
Reviews.Content: I stayed here this past weekend with some friends to go to an event in the city. I was satisfied, but the hotel has some things to work on for sure...read on: -I used Hilton's "Requests Upon Arrival" system online where you can order things like extra towels, pillows or beverages to have delivered to your room before you even check in. I knew that there were going to be 4 guys in 1 hotel room, so some extra towels and pillows would be great. These items were NOT in the room, even though I specifically requested them months prior when making the reservation. What gives? -3 bath towels in a room that is meant to hold up to 4 guests. That's the hotel being cheap right there, clearly. -We did not find out the hotel has an indoor pool available to guests until we checked in so we did not bring our swim suits. Why is this information not on the website? -Housekeeper tried to enter our room on Sunday morning without announcing herself when we had a Do Not Disturb sign up. Thankfully the room was locked, but still...come on now. -After returning late from a bar one night, we got in the elevator and had a security guard come in after us. He did not say a word to us, but just followed us to our room and then left. SO CREEPY. I am really not okay with this...made me feel like I was a criminal or something. -Location is very good...just maybe 2 blocks from Mag Mile and a few more to other good areas like State Street and the Red Line CTA. We could also walk to Vision/Excalibur where our event was at. -The hotel has been renovated and brought up to date with contemporary furniture, but you can still tell it was once a Holiday Inn back in the 80s just by the architecture and layout. The remodel really did do a good job though and it's on par with other Doubletree hotels, although they did not replace the TVs. Rooms really could benefit from some flat-panel TVs. Really like the window-seats in the room, great for storing luggage or extra clothes. -Friendly bellmen, always saying hello and seeing if we needed a cab. -Easy access to 7/11, McDonalds, bagel shop and Dunkin Donuts for quick bites. -Free WiFi in the lobby SO, all in all, I would stay here again if I got a really good rate; however, I think there are better hotels in this city with more personal service and a better attention to detail...two things that are very important to me as a guest. I would welcome a management response to my comments.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay”
Reviews.Author: Topkoppite
Reviews.Content: We travelled across the USA on a tour organised by Great Rail Journeys of York between the 7th and 27th October 2009. We stayed at the Doubletree Hotel Chicago Magnificent Mile between the Magnificent Mile and Navy Pier for one night. We were impressed that rooms had been prepared for occupation at 1145 on our arrival and we were presented with cookies on arrival and from our 20th Floor room we had a magnificent view although we could hear traffic noise from below. The room was large and comfortable and we slept well. The hospitality tray was limited. The hotel was very clean with modern decor and a large and busy foyer area. The staff in the gift shop were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms missing a few luxuries”
Reviews.Author: Jen322
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a nice clean room newly updated. It was a few blocks from mag mile. The service was good. It did not have a workout room or pool. Also some hotels in this class have complimetary breakfast and this did not.

Reviews.Title: “Worked out just great!”
Reviews.Author: Suzelle
Reviews.Content: I landed this hotel via Hotwire ($69), having a good idea that where Hotwire would place me in Streeterville would quite possibly be here. It totally suited my purposes and comfort as I was in the area for a few days for a friend's wedding in this area. It was lovely to be able to walk to the various locations (Ivy Room, Conrad Hillton, etc) we were to be at - and pay the rate I was able to secure for the quality of accommodations. The bellman who greeted me at the door and was on duty several times in the 3 days/2 nights I was there was cheery and helpful. Loved having Einstein's Bagels on the ground floor area for on the go lunch or breakfast option. Totally pleased with the 2 double bed room. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: gwkelley
Reviews.Content: Two room suite with the usual Doubletree cleanliness. This hotel is a short walk from MM and all the shopping. The pool, which is located near the top of this hotel is such a change from the ground floor experience. I know you are not suppose to look in others homes, but I could not help but to see in the homes that were in the buildings from one of the windows. The room was very quiet. I would recommend this hotel, especially if you need to save money for shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travrun
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend in August. I got a good deal through travelzoo.com. Check-in was pretty quick for a Friday (had to wait about 10 mintues) and they give you complimentray warm choholate chip cookies upon check-in. Our room and bathroom were clean. Staff we encountered were friendly. Parking is around $40 per day which sounds like a lot, but isn't bad for downtown Chicago. The location can't be beat. The hotel is only a few blocks from Michigan Ave in one direction and Lake Michigan/Navy Pier in the other. Would recommend to those looking for a nice hotel in a great location in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Bluefan75
Reviews.Content: My wife and I selected this hotel due to its relative proximity to the start line for the marathon which she ran. A quick cab ride from Union Station brought us to the front door of this hotel, where we were greeted immediately by Vlad who took our bags. Steve then grabbed the cart for us and brought them up to the room with us after checking in. The lobby is a very nicely decorated area, with rounded edges everywhere(someone else pointed this out to me--it was neat to see). The lobby is farily spacious, although given it was a busy weekend, it was sometimes tough to tell. I didn't take advantage, but free WiFi is available in the lobby. We got to the floor we were on, and again, nicely appointed, with a couch for waiting. Our room was a King lakeview. The room, including the bathoom was a very nice size, and clean. The bed was very comfortable. The location was terrific as well, a few blocks from Michigan Ave and all that entails. I should note here that Lakeview is a bit of a misnomer. They aren't lying that you are facing the lake, the only issue that there are some pretty tall buildings between their location and the lake, and so your views of the lake consist of sides or between buildings. Not a big deal for us, but if you're the type who wants to see every sailboat and swimmer, you may be disappointed. The service was very good. Excellent, even. The one front desk agent was a little abrupt in informing us the gift shop was closed when we were checking out early, but otherwise the staff were excellent. Ben out front had a cab within seconds, and the concierge(want to say Dan, but I can't remember exactly) was able to arrange our large group(only a few who were staying at the hotel) some tables at a busy restaurant. We called for some sugar for coffee, and within 4 minutes someone was there with the sugar, and 20 minutes later there was a phone call making sure we got the sugar. The towels were a little inconsistent, but they were brought right away when we asked. Excellent service. The one big negative had to do with the TVs. Not so much that they weren't flat screens, although you might expect them in a hotel that was so recently renovated, but the volume that the hotel channel is at when you first turn it on. It didn't seem to matter what the level was when you last turned it off, the volume was such that most of an army barracks would be awakened in an instant. You have no control over that volume when you turn it on. It's a race to get it down ot a manageable level. The other thing was that ther was no information booklet, it was a laminated card that was folded 3-4 ways. This is minor, no question, just was difficult to figure out that was where you got the info. I kept meaning to check it out, but never got the chance, but apparently hotel guests have access to the Lakeshore Athletic club next door. This would definitely be a big plus if this is still the case. A very good hotel though. Would have no problem recommending to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Who needs lunch when there's warm cookies calling your name...”
Reviews.Author: Barrettgsu
Reviews.Content: This was out first trip to Chicago and our first stay in a Doubletree hotel. We were very pleased with of course the city and also the hotel. The people at the desk were very helpfull and did not judge you at all when you asked for their delicious fresh baked cookies everyday, sometimes even for breakfast! The rooms are a good size and the hotel is very close to shopping and restaurants. We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Stay in Chi-Town”
Reviews.Author: Sonny2009
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree Magnificient Mile was the Hotel we stayed in for our 5 Day 4 Night Stay in Chicago. We found the hotel to be quite convenient to most of the things we needed or wanted to do. The room was really nice, as we had booked a double queen room with a Lake View. The beds were really soft and comfortable, and the air conditioning was terrific. Bathroom was clean, and the housekeeping gladly gave us extra towels as we were travelling with our two children. Only complaint with the room was the lack of a fridge. A minor compIaint, but just wanted to mention it here. I would think that with the cost of staying here that a fridge would be included. There is a mini-bar fridge in the room, however that is full of the mini bar itself....with no room for your items. Keep in mind if you are travelling with children that the table top mini-bar has sensors that if an item is moved you will be charged for it. i.e. jar of peanuts, etc. This was not an issue for us as our kids stayed away from it, just wanted to leave that advice to anyone else. Other hotel ammenities included a rooftop pool (obviusly closed in October, but it was there just the same), and free Wolfgang Puck Coffee and Teas in the room which was nice. As well as Neutrogena shower products. Attractions: The hotel is within walking distance to Navy Pier, the Hancock Building (as a matter of fact, our room had a view of the Hancock Building which at night was spectacular!) and of course the 'Mile itself. Restaraunts: The hotel has its own restaraunt, Marketplace, along with an Einsteins Bagle shop, however we did not dine at either of these places, instead dining away from the hotel at easy to walk to locations like the West Egg for breakfast...across the street... (Awesome!), Gino's East Pizza (two short blocks away), or the Corner Bakery (located also real close to the hotel in the Northwest Medical building.) Convenience items: There is a Dominicks store across the street from the hotel that has everything you may need during your stay. The hotel is across the street from Northwest Medical, so you may hear ambulances coming and going at night, but hey, this is Chicago, if you wanted deep silence you wouldnt be booking a trip to the city. Taxis also are lingering around the front entrance to the hotel, so you will always have convenient transportation. The concierge was also wonderful, and always had good advice to local shops, restaraunts, etc. He also was able to get us transport to Ohare the morning we left, in a nice SUV (Infiniti) that cost us no more than a regular city taxi to the Airport would have cost, which was terrific. All in all, I would definately stay here again, this is a well run hotel, convenient to everything worth seeing, and family friendly....oh yeah, free warm chocolate chip cookies for you at check in...which as you can imagine was a big hit with the kids!

Reviews.Title: “This was a great location and a nice clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: funtripbf
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and helpful and I really enjoyed the decorum of the rooms. The staff was very informative about transportation, local attractions, and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “I'd Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: davenlis
Reviews.Content: Liked the location - they call it the Doubletree Magnificent Mile, but you're actually a couple of blocks off the Mag Mile. Felt very safe in this area. We recommend the West Egg for breakfast and Indian Garden for dinner; both are within a block. Had dinner at the hotel restaurant - good food and great service. There's an Einstein Bros. Bagels in the hotel, but had very long lines in the morning! Hotel was very clean, beds were comfy and service was very good, especially at the front desk and bar. The rooftop pool area was adequate, but sort of "cold" feeling - didn't have that fun, pool atmosphere that made me want to hang out there all day. Our only complaint was that there's no free wifi in the rooms, but there is in the lobby area, and therefore the lobby areas were very often FULL with people on their laptops! We found, however, that you could sign into wifi in the lobby, then take the elevator up to your room (we were on the 3rd floor) while holding your laptop slightly open so that it doesn't go to sleep, and we were able to maintain the free connection in our room! :) We booked this room at about $100/nt., and for Chicago in summer, it was a good price for a very good room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, needs attention”
Reviews.Author: ReneeMemphisTN
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Doubletree on Magnificent Mile October 1 & 2, 2009, for $100/night including fees/taxes; good location to walk to shops & great food; raining so didn't get out as much as anticipated. Hotel requires mgnt. to listen & respond to housekeeping on repairs needed-- no stopper in sink in room 1704, stopper in the tub didn't work and the tub filled with water. I didn't care to be standing in water while showering. Room 1704 is right outside the elevator-- didn't think to ask for them not to do that; wasn't peak season so I Assumed that a better room would have been provided. Overall a good 2 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TravlinNole
Reviews.Content: Booked this hoel on Priceline.com; got a great rate for it. Excellent downtown hotel with rooftop pool. Located north of downtown on the Magnificant Mile. Very nice area; I felt totally safe walking alone in the area late at night. Close to Michigan Ave. Very professional staff, clean well appointed room, very enjoyable stay, especially for the price. Bus stops in front of hotel; subway about a 10 minute walk. Plenty of good restaurants about a 5 to 10 minute walk west of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Uhhhhh...Not So Great”
Reviews.Author: dwbaisden
Reviews.Content: Just of bit of background...we are a family of five and Hilton's Homewood Suites is our brand of preference. Still, my six-year-old daughter and I decided to take an impromptu trip to Chicago and wanted to stay at a different hotel. We picked Doubletree because of the location and based on some of the reviews. We arrived at O'Hare and decided to take the subway in order to get a true feel of the city. The subway ride was entirely long and the train stop (Grand - Red Line) was quite a distance from the hotel. When we arrived, the lobby looked rather contemporary and new. The front desk staff were reasonably hospitable. My disappointment is with the room itself and the amount of noise you can hear in the hotel. Every morning and evening we would hear the other guests coming and going through our room door. It was so loud that one night my daughter and I jumped thinking someone was trying to get into our room. Then one guest must have been checking out at 5:30 in the morning so we were unfortunately awakened then as well. I so wanted to get some rest on my vacation since the whole purpose was to releax and have fun. We simply weren't able to do so at this hotel. We could also hear through the relatively thin walls. The noise reason alone will be the reason I will never return to this hotel. The beds were indeed comfy and as one reviewer already noted, the pillows weren't so great. There was a lot of settled dust around the nightstand (on the clock, the lamps, etc). The problem with that is it indicates the areas were not cleaned prior to our use. The bathrooms were just okay. We stayed in room 2507 and the cabinets in the bathroom were damaged and the door had visible dirt. The shower curtains were extremely fresh and had just been laundered. The towels were clean and so was the sink, toilet and tub. The shower head had an extremely soft flow and there was definite temperature restrictions on how hot you could make the water. I do feel we would have better enjoyed our trip at the Hilton Homewoood Suites. Not only was it much closer to the Magnificent Mile, it was much closer to the Subway. Also, I'm sure it was quieter since I didn't see guests complaining otherwise. I will also say that the Concierge (with the exception of a lady that was working Saturday, Sept. 19 in the evening) and the staff in the restaurant were extremely friendly. Also, the hotel is reasonably close to Navy Pier. Chicago is definitely a great city to visit! I will definitely be back but just not necessarily at the Doubletree.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: groovepuppetfan
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on expedia.com for $111/night. We stayed from Sept 6-10. I am a Hilton rewards member. I was disappointed to find out that since I booked through Expedia that I could not get Hilton points for the trip. The hotel is located close to Michigan Ave and there are bus stops near by. We had two rooms, one which had an ocean view. The rooms are clean, I like the decor and the beds are very comfortable. My only complaints are the refrigerator that is stocked with drinks and you will be charged if you remove any of them. There is no room in the fridge for anything that you may have brought with you. The showerhead is very large and it is like taking a shower in the rain. The staff is very helpful in giving directions. I was disappointed in the cost of the breakfast buffet $21. That's pretty expensive. We ate at the Markethouse for breakfast once and then ate breakfast every other day at the West Egg Cafe across the street. Overall I was satisfied with the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest staff and comfiest beds!”
Reviews.Author: m04et03e
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in chicago at the end of an american trip as the flight home was from O'Hare... so disappointed i didnt get to stay for longer then we did. staff were great, all recommendations were spot on. hotel room was spotless and the bed was unbeliebeable comfy. hotel is really close to the shops on mag mile (expensive and the more reasonably priced!) all in all chicago was a great town and ill definitly be back

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, great for families”
Reviews.Author: pkbroch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel the end of August, for three nights. The rooms were very clean and housekeeping was very nice they even put my grandsons stuffed anumals on his pillows like they were sleeping. Plenty of towels and constant replacement of toiletries. The weather when we were there was rather chilly, but we used the pool and the towel container was usually kept full. The breakfast in the restaurant area was a little pricey but the quality was top notch. The waitstaff was very attentive. When the lobby bar closes, the one at the Marketplace restaurant is open late. They should have in each room a list of dining options at the hotel. Perrhaps this will be forth coming after they complete rennovations. Within three blocks from the hotel to Michigan Ave. There are a lot of dinning options in all price ranges, from pubs to sandwich shops to Tex Mex grills. Dominiks market is on the corner and has every thing at very good prices for a Big city downtown supermarket.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel off Michigan Ave”
Reviews.Author: rjsmom1117
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights last July to check out the Mag mile and see the Cubbies. The hotel appeared to have a total rennovation and was very nice and clean. The check in staff was very friendly and helpful with suggestions on places to eat. You get a warm cookie upon check in!! Check in was very quick. Our room and bathroom were very clean and newly remodeled. The beds were very comfortable. The only thing I thought was silly was were requested a sofa bed because we were traveling with our teenage son and the room was too small for that. Once you opened up the sofa bed there was no room to walk. You had to crawl over the sofa bed to get to the bathroom. Overall though it was a great We had a good view even though we were not on Michigan Ave. Michigan Ave was about 4 blocks away. When we asked the concierge about dinner, they gave excellent suggestions and made all our reservations for us. We also ate breakfast at the hotel and it was pretty good. They offered us private transportation to the airport which was the same price as a cab. Their private transportation was a Lincoln Navigator which was much more comfortable than the taxi on the way in! Overall I thought for the price it was an excellent deal if you are ok with a little bit of a walk...

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Hilton Standards”
Reviews.Author: kirkhIowa
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler and a Hilton Gold Member, I used points to stay at this hotel with my family. Certainly, when you use points you want a good value and a nice place for your family to stay. Believe me, there's better. This is an old Holiday Inn, at best. The rooftop pool was a big attraction for us and the main reason we wanted to stay there. Unfortunately the pool area never had towels, was horribly dirty and the pool side snack bar was never open. Cmon', middle of the summer in Chicago and a guy can't get a beverage? When is it open? Overall the staff was friendly, but the rooms were not very clean and there was absolutely no water pressure in the showers. The ice maker on the 25th floor did not work either. Another very disappointing issue was the hotel lobby bar was closed early every night. One night it was closed at 8:30pm. How can the hotel bar (a profit center) be closed at 8:30pm when the hotel is at capacity (according to the front desk who wouldn't upgrade me to a larger room). I must say, I would not recommend you using your valuable points on this sub-par Hilton property and if you are staying there, don't pay more than $99. It's just not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “good location, unfriendly staff, pool closes too early”
Reviews.Author: jayhawk6
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights in August. When I pulled into the driveway and unloaded the kids to go check-in, I was told that I needed to park in the parking garage FIRST and then check in. I thought this was interesting because the same guy was helping other people unload their luggage from their cars, and then waiting for them as they checked in. But we had to park in the parking garage, unload our car in the parking gargage and bring our luggage with us to the front desk and then check in. I have a theory on this, but hesitate to say. Anyway, minus the unfriendly staff, including front desk person, the hotel was nicely located close to shopping. There is a free trolley that will drop you off close to your hotel (not at) from Navy Pier. Our room was nice, bed and pillows were comfortable. The kids complaint was that the pool closed too early. Many of the hotels close their pools at 11:00. This pool closes at 10:00 pm so if you go out for dinner and don't get to the restaurant at 5:00, or go shopping later, by the time you get back to the hotel the pool will be closing. We did go one morning and it was neat that it was on the roof, (on the 5th floor) but in a city like Chicago with things being open later, it would be nice for the pool to stay open later as well. The biggest plus is that most things are within walking distance from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - close to everything”
Reviews.Author: justanohmom
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Doubletree after spending 3 nights in Westmont traveling into town each day. Both have their pluses, one being the cheaper prices out of town! We thoroughly enjoyed being within walking distance of everything! We parked our car early in the a.m. at the garage and checked in later. The next a.m., we walked around a bit thinking we'd be charged by the hour since we were past our 24 hour limit and were happy to still be charged the set $41 price that came with our room. My son and I walked to Navy Pier that evening and I felt relatively safe walking back at night with just the two of us. Since it's a tourist area, you can always find someone to hang close behind. The rooftop pool was nice, on the 5th floor, but ran out of towels on a chiily evening. They were replaced shortly after we left. We paid extra for a lakeview room on the 23rd floor but could see very little of it with the other buildings blocking the view. Elevators were prompt and staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: ajrwdwgirl
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I went to Chicago for a couple of days in July to go to a Cubs game and sitesee. The hotel was easy to find and parking was easy. The check-in went smooth and the welcome cookies were tasty. Our room was nice and clean and had plenty of towels. The decor was modern and not something I would want at my house but cool to have in a hotel room. We could see a little sliver of the lake from our room, but we hadn't paid for a great view. The rooftop pool was nice. The water was cold and a hot tub would have been welcome. I guess there was wifi in the lounge area but we didn't use it. We didn't eat in the restaurant there, but the menu did look good and compettiive pricing for other restaurants in the area. The location is within a decent walking distance of shops and many restaurants. The door man did get us a taxi so we could go to the Oak Street Beachstro, the food there was just okay. But it was neat to be on a Chicago beach with palm trees. We also ate at the Weber Grill (hubby's choice) and that had good food. We did go out at night and felt safe in the area around the hotel. Overall the hotel was a good experience and next year when we go down for another Cubs game we will probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: TG1981
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doubletree for 3 nights July 10-13. Just a few blocks walking distance to Magnificient Mile, great eateries surrounding the hotel, and just a few blocks to the Navy Pier. The rooms were very nicely decorated and the staff was very helpful and nice. I think this was perfect location if you are interested in being close to the Maginificient Mile. I would stay here again. Walking distance to eateries, a great wine bar down the street, and a few nice breakfeast restaurants. Short cab rides to other parts of town such as Mortons or Harry Carays. About 20 minutes to Midway airport. Cab ride was $25.00 including tip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmcbride
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose the Doubletree for its great location and very reasonable price over the 4th of July. When we first checked into our room, the bathroom wasnt completely cleaned but once we notified the front desk, housekeeping was sent right up. After the 1st night in the room, the ice machine just outside in the hall leaked water into the hall and into our room. Once again the front desk didnt dissappoint and apologized and quickly moved us to a different room. Also, the concierge was great and offered a few different dinner recomendations. As for the room, it was large with comfortable beds and pretty large bathrooms. We didnt go out to the pool but saw people in it constantly from our window. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting who wants to be near the Magnificent Mile. We would surely go back.

Reviews.Title: “really nice downtown hotel close to points of interest”
Reviews.Author: AlfielangleyUK
Reviews.Content: 3 of us stayed here for 6 days and loved every minute. Location is great for walking to Navy Pier, Millenium park, Magnificent Mile shopping and Riverside. Used the "loop" to get to Sear's Tower.Used the Trolley Bus tour to see city highlights and then Wrigley's Park Stadium- excellent value.
