Found that reasonably priced restaurant choice was a bit limited however breakfast at the West Egg opposite the hotel was very good. Rooms at the hotel are well appointed and well managed. Contrary to other reports we read we found use of the roof pool is free to guests. All staff were very helpful however a special mention must be of Ron at reception who seemed to find that nothing was too much bother- a really nice guy.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and accomodations”
Reviews.Author: A-Lucky-Man
Reviews.Content: Just a couple of blocks off N. Michigan shopping and on the bus line. Stayed here when it was the Holiday Inn 4+ years ago and since into a nice property.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay, not nearly as nice as I had hoped”
Reviews.Author: sjgphoto
Reviews.Content: The Double Tree was a nice okay, nothing special. The best part was the location, 10-15 minute walk to the John Hancock Tower and Navy Pier. It was also close to bus and train transit stops. The hotel was attractive on the inside. There could be more seats in the lobby, where there is free WiFi. In the rooms you can pay $10/24hr for internet. Our room was on floor 10 of 26, nothing spectacular. It was kind of small, but pretty clean. We paid $109 on average for the 3 nights we were there which isn't bad for Chicago. Parking on site is $41/24hr, park across the street if you don't plan on moving your car during the trip, it is $31/24hr. We did not know that the Mini bar worked on sensor so every time we opened it to look at the stuff in there we were charged, fortunately the front desk understand and removed all charges from out bill. Besides a great location the concierges were extremely helpful in getting us on the right direction to get where we wanted to go. Not sure if I would recommend this hotel, probably the location but not the specific hotel. I think there is an Embassy Suites a block to the east and they at least have free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: happymom20
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at the Doubletree. The rooms were clean, the location was perfect for all that Chicago has to offer and most important - every single staff person we dealt with was friendly, helpful and gave me the impression they wanted our visit to be the best that it could be! My only negative comment would be that there was a lot of street noise in the room- but we got used to it. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: ljcraftcrazy
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Chicago for the first time with my parents (in their 70's) and my 3 sisters (40-50 years old). We wanted to be near many attractions and in a fairly safe neighborhood. This hotel fit the bill perfectly. It is about 4 blocks from Michigan Avenue and fabulous shopping, and a short walk to the Chicago River. One of my sisters and I did walk back to the Hotel from Navy Pier, though it would be a bit long for older people. Beds were very comfortable, and the front desk staff responded promptly to all of our requests. The concierge even gave us a VIP ticket to Gino's East Pizzaria, and we walked past a a line of about 20 people and were seated within 3 minutes, we were also given a free basket of garlic bread. I highly recommend this hotel if you travel to Chi town.

Reviews.Title: “avoid to stay if it rains!!”
Reviews.Author: masamomo
Reviews.Content: Staffs are very nice. Location is great too. Our room was roomy although it could use extra cleaning job, but I'm picky. The worst part was the wondows....On the sencond night, it rained hard and the rain leaked into our room. My husband's suitcase was soaked and we were worried how we pack next day. Staff came to put a lot of towels around the windows and floor. She said this happened before. I wonder why the hotel doesn't fix the darn windows!!! The hotel has INCREDIBLE gym, though....

Reviews.Title: “OK, but just only OK”
Reviews.Author: gvldiva
Reviews.Content: We arrived Thursday to the Doubletree. It was exactly where I thought it was. GREAT location. Near the mag mile (about 4 blocks off) but not on the mile. Near good restaurants and shopping. Now for the hotel. It was OK, but just didn't have the extra something that makes one's stay memorable. This hotel was remodeled last year. To be honest, it looks like an old building that they tried to upgrade. The carpet down our hall was dirty. Near the elevators on the 6th floor there was a heating unit or something that had pulled away from the wall and you could see the area that was not wallpapered. The hinges on the doors were painted over instead of being removed during the painting process. Also for a hotel that was just remodeled last year I don't understand why they have old TVs in the rooms. Where are the flatscreens? Our rooms were large and clean. I liked the beds, but my sister thought they were too hard. Be aware, when checking in, this hotel will freeze up $50/day on your credit card for incidentals. That I don't like and I have never had that happen at a Marriott, Crowne Plaza or Grand Hyatt. If I hadn't asked, I would not have known and the only reason I asked is because I had that happen at a Hilton Garden Inn in another city. With so many nice hotels in the city, I think I will opt for the Courtyard Marriott or the Intercontinental next time I am in Chicago. Not because it's a bad hotel, but for a the same amount of money you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel, Best One In Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Hurricane10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my wifes Doctoral graduation. We had several rooms for family and friends and all agreed the hotel was the best. The rooms were fantastic with great views toward Lake Michigan. The entire staff especially Carlos (Ft. Desk Mgr) & Alfredo(concerige) were fantastic. The food, amenities,housekeeping, bellman and porters were all superb. We have stayed at several other hotels in Chicago during her school terms and none compare to this Doubletree for service, amenities, etc. This is the best one we have stayed in yet. In fact, we are going back in Sept. for a meeting and staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here when relocating to Chicago - great big rooms!”
Reviews.Author: GWorldTour
Reviews.Content: We were in a unique situation in that we were staying in a hotel until we were able to find a suitable apartment to live in. With no real expectations, we booked 4 nights on www.hotwire.com and found out the hotel booking was for Doubletree. First impressions were great, the lobby was spacious, and loved the choco chip cookie warmed up for my arrival. Our room was two doubles, which was fine as I believe it probably made for a bigger room than a king room did, the bed was very comfy and loved the decor. The rooms were very spacious and we had a view of the pool as we were on the 11th floor. Great view. Our daily housekeeper was so friendly and I enjoyed saying hi to her each morning. The TV channels were many - compared to the Palmerhouse Hilton in the Loop which has less than 1/2 as many channels as the Doubletree does. Einstein Bros downstairs does great bagels and we loved the breakfast across the street at the cafe there. All in all, great hotel choice for us. The one downside that is memorable for me was that we needed to pay for wifi. I think in this day and age it is something that should be provided at hotels free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but too much noise from hall and street”
Reviews.Author: Travels_with_teens_9
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree is located between many popular Chicago attractions. It's a quick walk to Michigan Avenue and Navy Pier. The Dominick's one block away is convenient for food and supplies. We especially liked the on-site Einstein's bagels. We had a standard room on the 8th floor, quite comfortable and clean, but the noise from the street and people passing in the halls is quite loud. Internet in the room is not free; you'll pay $9.95 for 24-hour access. Since the room rate is a bargain at this location, we accepted it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Craazylulu
Reviews.Content: This DoubleTree did not let us down, it was exactly to the standard that we expected. We did have a bit of a hard time with the room keys which was annoying but the staff was quick to fix any problems or issues we brought up. The beds are very comfy and the bathroom are large with nice showers. My only gripes were that they have a super-ultra-modern theme and big 'ol tube TVs in the rooms from 1990... it might be time to upgrade, oh and the wifi is $10/per day if you want it in your room, it's only free in the lobby, which was pretty blah if you ask me. Good location though, walking distance to lots of fun stuff, Michigan Ave, Navy Pier, restaurants etc.

Reviews.Title: “if you're looking for a downtown location, hard to beat the value of this place!”
Reviews.Author: mksnyd
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Doubletree dowtonw over Memorial Day Weeekend. the place has recently been rennovated and changed to a Doubletree. the rooms or well appointed, have kind of a youthful / funky feel. room size was good for downtown. The location was perfect. There is a nice restaurant attached, but didn't sample the food (the drinks, however, were good). I'd highly recommend this place if you plan to stay downtown and are looking for a reasonably priced hotel that doesn't sacrifice on quality.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Detrees
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect - a few blocks from the Magnificent Mile shopping in one direction and Navy Pier in the other direction. There were coins on the floor next to the bed that made me think no one had vacuumed, but other than that the room seemed relatively clean and attractive. The lobby bar is adjacent to the check-in desk which is convenient, but made checking in a bit of a challenge when the bar area was overflowing. Definitely eat breakfast across the street at West Egg! The food was fantastic (loved the blueberry and cashew pancakes), definitely cheaper than the hotel restaurant, and unbelievably quick without ever feeling rushed. Watch out for the pressure-sensitive mini-bar - don't even think about looking at what is in those jars!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place.”
Reviews.Author: jmetz1016
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. Staff was friendly and courteous. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly..”
Reviews.Author: pretty11
Reviews.Content: Everything was excellent..really. I was slightly surprised how nice it was upon walking in. The lobby was huge and inclues a bar with plenty of seating! The front desk was very pleasant and welcoming. They also offered me a warm cookie..lol. After a quick check-in, I headed up to my room..Overall the room was a nice size and nicely furnished. Only complaint about the room was the dated television..probably like 4-6 yrs old. It was just weird to be in such a nice room with a dated t.v. After waking up I noticed a sheet had been slid under the door. It was informing me there was no need to come to the front desk to check out due to "Express Checkout"! Packed up and headed out!!! Good job DoubleTree!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Warm cookie, Warm Welcome and good stay.”
Reviews.Author: Bearable1
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival was welcomed warmly by hotel and reception staff. Our request for a high floor was honoured. Room is spacious with nice big comfy beds. Good bathroom with Neutrogena toiletries. Good facilities in hotel. Downside was business centre was expensive to use. Internet $6 for 15 minutes. Location good, near the Magnificent Mile and facilities nearby such as a 7-11 shop and pubs and restaurants. A good stay, nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No disappointments found”
Reviews.Author: 200NitesAYear
Reviews.Content: This hotel is consistent with the quality that can be expected from this chain. My room was a nice size; however, the bathroom was a bit smaller than expected. The lobby was very inviting. The staff was more than nice and I caught a shuttle to the airport. They had luggage storage, a restaurant and a bagel/coffee shop attached to the property. The lobby bar was good. They gave away those chocolate chip cookies like candy (I traveled solo but got 3 cookies). Yes, I did ask for extras. I was able to place a cash deposit for incidentals and never used my credit card. Internet was an extra $9.95. Maybe it's free for members of their rewards program. I don't know. The building is new and modern. The beds were comfortable and the water was hot. Free wifi in the lobby worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Great Service in the City”
Reviews.Author: SliceServe
Reviews.Content: Visited with our grade school kids during Spring Break this week for site seeing & to see a Cubs game: We were welcomed by a friendly professional staff. It's not a kids hotel, but they do a great job of welcoming them. The concierge is tops - an advisor to the local board of concierge & featured in this month's guide - he is informed, connected and was a tremendous help. I'm not suprised to read the building formerly housed a Holiday Inn. No worries though, its totally updated, clean & fresh. The rooms are clean. I'd have considered them worth 5 dots, but in checking for bedbugs (of which I saw no traces) I saw some crumbs & dust bunnies along the floorboards behind the beds. The beds are super soft, ensconsed in clean, crips cotton sheets. A bit too soft for my back but most people would probably love them. It was one of those rare times when I felt the beds were actually clean & safe enough for my kids to climb onto without worries. We stayed on a mid-level room, I'd go higher to avoid a view of the parking garage next door. In room temp control was nice too. Michigan Ave is 3 blocks to the South & the train was about 6 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: bmfc1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doubletree-Magnificent Mile for a work conference. The facility is excellent. The hotel rooms were top notch. My colleagues raved about the bedding and room amenities (although flat screens would have been nice). The conference food was the best we've ever had. Each meal was high quality and got excellent reviews. We received access to the adjoining health club, which has a pool, and this was a nice perk. I highly recommend this hotel for your next business conference in Chicago. And don't forget the amazing chocolate chip cookies!

Reviews.Title: “Hard To Believe It Was A Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: grobma
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a big conference at McCormick Place and wanted a Hilton property near Mag Mile. Thy've done an extensive renovation and you would never believe that it once was a Holiday Inn. Lobby decor is simple but nice - the lobby bar always had a crowd and I heard from a colleague that the wifi (free in the lobby) was excellent. Staff was very nice and friendly. Love those Doubletree cookies. Room was average size. Good workspace and nice padded seating ledge along the window. Expected a flat screen after such an extensive renovation. Bed was comfortable. Housekeeping was fine. Excellent toiletries - not something I usually notice or comment on. Excellent hot water with a nice rainforest shower head. Good drawer space (something that seems to be disappearing these days and valued as I was there for 5 nights). Comfy arm chair and ottoman. Standard Hilton clock radio with MP3 cable. Elevators were a bit slow as previously reported, but not intolerable. Based on prior reviews, I did not eat in the hotel. Einstein's Bagels in the lobby is convenient and there are a few Starbucks within walking distance. West Egg Cafe across the street is a Chicago favorite for breakfast and did not disappoint - just get there early on weekends or be prepared to wait. Lot's of other dining options within a couple of blocks. Short walk to Michigan Ave and very close to Navy Pier. There were a lot of families there who seemed to be happy as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Frequentflyermom
Reviews.Content: Good location. Front desk staff was welcoming and polite. We had package for the free breakfast buffet. It was a standard buffet, with omelet station. The service was exceptionally good. Room was two queen beds. Mattress a bit firm for my taste. Linens high quality. $10 a day for internet access in room (I hate that!). Self-park is $41 a day in the hotel ramp--go down the street to a public ramp where it is $30. The room was fine, a bit on the small side. There was some mold in the bathroom on the ceiling--the housekeeping staff needs to be a bit more careful. There was a fair amount of street noise (we were on the 17th floor.) It's a good location--about 2 blocks off Michigan Ave.

Reviews.Title: “wish i would have known you had to pay to use the pool”
Reviews.Author: rushin_3
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice the people very friendly. When I planned my trip I was wanting a pool to relax in after walking all day, but at check in we find that there is a $15 charge per person to use the pool and fitness center, so much for relaxing in a pool! Nowhere did it stipulate that there were extra charges for this. If I would have known I would have stayed elsewhere. They did mention a $41 charge for parking but actually the garage isn't theirs so you can park in another garage around the corner cheaper. Also you here car horns and sirens thru out the day and night, makes sleeping fun! (Not!)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Comfortable Beds”
Reviews.Author: Fijalclarkski
Reviews.Content: The DoubleTree Mag Mile has a beautiful new lobby. I was greeted by a very friendly man at the front desk, where I received my yummy warm cookie. The room was a good size (2 queen beds). The beds were very comfortable. There was no refrigerator in the room, which would have been nice. Access to the Lakeshore Athletic Club, which was FREE, was very nice. It is a bit of a hike to the Red Line at Grand, but very close to the Magnificent Mile. Overall, it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoLondon
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via Priceline for $60/night March 20-22nd weekend. Parked at the parking garage right next door to hotel garage for $11 cheaper ($30/night). Check-in was smooth and received 2 warm cookies. Room was better than I was expecting. Nice view of Sheraton hotel. In room Wolfgang Puck coffee was very good. Room was spacious enough with 2 double beds and nice size bathroom. Neutrogena products. Good shower pressure. Hotel is about 2 block walking distance to Michigan Ave, movie theaters, grocery store, all kinds of shopping. etc etc. Elevators were working well. Free wireless internet in lobby only.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Chicago Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelingASAP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree Chicago over a long weekend visiting family. It is centrally located and if you fly into Midway airport, take the Orange Line to Lake & State and then walk about 15 minutes. The room was spacious and clean with all the amenities-shampoo, conditioner, etc. The beds were the best!!! Very comfy! New linens, comforters and towels. There is an Einstein Bagels in the lobby that is quite convenient for a quick breakfast. We did not try the hotel restaurant, but right across the street is a great cafe called Egg West. They have wonderful food! We also had a few drinks at Timothy O'Tools, a pub also located across the street. The hotel staff were friendly and knowledgeable about the Chicago area. If you need directions or reservations the concierge is the friendliest! The only glitch that I noticed is the lack of insulation in the doors. We could hear every door slam or person walking down the hallway outside the room. The walls in the room were fine and we heard little noise from our neighbors but maybe the doors could be better insulated? Not a big thing but just a minor annoyance. Overall, this is a great hotel and worth the $100 a night we paid. I would definately stay here again. The location is ideal!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bookwrm
Reviews.Content: My family of four (two teenage girls) stayed here during several days of college campus tours in the area. We have only been to Chicago one other time so I can't compare this to other hotels but I will say we were very pleased for the price we paid. The hotel is in a great location. The staff were friendly and check in was a breeze. Our room was very clean and comfortable and big enough to accomodate all of us. Parking was very expensive but from what I have heard, it is what is to be expected ($41 for one night). It was very close to all the great shops and lots of restaurants, all within walking distance. I honestly have nothing bad to say about this hotel and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose, central location, not convenient for families”
Reviews.Author: BlueBird Watcher
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree Hotel Chicago Magnificent Mile in March, Room 2121. We paid for lakeview and did have a partial view of the lake. This is a nice hotel about 2 blocks east of the Magnificent Mile and about 2 blocks north of the Chicago River/Wacker Drive area. Convenient to shopping and walking to other attractions. There is a Dominick's across the street, and Dunkin Donuts, Panera Bread, and other places to eat right nearby. First, the positives. We really liked how friendly everyone was towards us. The check in was effiecient, except I had to remind them about our breakfast vouchers. But it was immediately corrected. We had warm cookies waiting for us. The concierge was helpful and friendly. The bellhop was professional and friendly. The restaurant staff was friendly, as was housekeeping. The food at the restaurant was great. We had a breakfast buffet, with eggs, bacon, sausage, hash browns, eggs made to order, cereals, pastries, bread/toaster, fruit, yogurt, regular and chocolate milk. We got this breakfast free each morning as it was part of the Memory Maker Weekend through the Doubletree website. The hotel was clean and presentable. The bedding was clean and crisp. Beds were comfortable. The bath towels were cozy. The furniture and accessories were high quality. Now for the negatives for me. Please keep in mind that others may not mind this. We traveled as a family of four. The first thing I noticed was there was no counter space in the bathroom. The sink was a pedastal sink. It seemed like we had a handicap accessible room so maybe that is why. There just wasn't any where to put our "stuff". The room seemed small, although for Chicago standards, it was probably fine. Not a lot of room to move about. There was a $15 per person per day charge for the first day for use of the health club where the pool was, and a $5 per person per day charge for every day thereafter. There was a $9.95 per day charge for internet. Self parking is $41 per day. It just seemed like they nickled and dimed. There was a mini bar and a minibar fridge, but don't touch anything! It has sensors on it. If you pick something up and it is off the sensor for more than 30 seconds, your room gets automatically charged for the item, even if you don't open it. They will take the charge off, but that isn't the point to me. There were no channels for children on the TV. When we were winding down at night around 10 p.m., I turned on the TV. The cartoon channel had adult cartoons on it. No big deal there, but when I was flipping through, an explicit adult channel came on. Ooops. So I found the parental controls on the TV. There were no other kids channels on. So we watched Travel Channel, which was okay by me!! Our room was against the elevator shaft, so we heard the noise from that all night. In addition, there were at least 2 rooms that had partiers in them. However, the management came up when someone must have complained and they toned it right down. The staff and management is really on top of most everything in this hotel. I think for a business traveler or a couple on a get away weekend, this hotel would be very nice. I just don't think they cater to families.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place. Nice room with a great view!”
Reviews.Author: arlynncb
Reviews.Content: I was staying with my daughter and granddaughter for one night at the Red Roof Inn. The RRI was horrible! I got up the next morning, after a fitful night of feeling like bedbugs were attacking, and walked down the street a couple of block and found the Doubletree. The staff was wonderful and very courteous. I was offered a room right away and we moved in for 2 nights there. It was great. When I come back again with my husband we will probably stay there. We had a beautiful view with a partial view of the lake. Gorgeous big room and very clean compared with the filth of our previous room at RRI!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - typical downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Diyguy07
Reviews.Content: My two co-workers and I checked in on a Wednesday night and were greeted warmly-- this is a classic DoubleTree hotel, true to form. Rooms were satisfactory-- very clean, modern, and "classy". They are of typical downtown Chicago size, so nothing really jumped out at me. I will say it's an excellent hotel for its value and a perfect place to stay, but there are many hotels in the area that also fit this criteria. Breakfast at Einstein's Bagels in the lobby was great, and while we didn't stop at the bar in the lobby, it looked like a great place to hang out. With a block or two off of Michigan Ave, the location cannot be beat. Don't hesitate to stay here if you are in town!

Reviews.Title: “Great service but not as exciting as expected”
Reviews.Author: adventure19
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Doubletree for a three day stay in Chicago. I had read all of the reviews on this site and ended up opting for the Doubletree instead of a four start hotel because it sounded so great. All of the staff at the hotel and the beds were excellent. The actual hotel was okay but really nothing special. The pool (though not owned by the hotel) and hot-tub area is in need of some upgrading. The location is convenient (about 2 blocks to Michigan Ave) and there are a few restaurants nearby. Overall, the hotel was average and next time I will opt for something different.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Hotel- Stylish, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: neillni
Reviews.Content: Great Location - Great Staff - Stylish, Comfortable, Clean, This hotel is the best Doubletree i have staryed at, It is better than some of the Hilton Main Brand full service hotels. The staff etc where great, room very very nice, clean and crisp bedding in quality linen. and one a short walk from everything. Well done Doubletree Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for New Year's at the Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: fjnovak1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my girlfriend for three nights over New Year's...got a great rate under $100/night...this hotel did a very nice job with the renovations! Check-in was super pleasant, the room was clean and comfortable, the bed was unbelievable, and it was quite convenient having an Einstein's in the lobby. Did not use the access to the next door fitness center but it must have been great as I saw many other guests taking advantage of it. Location could not have been better...all the shops of Michigan Ave are a short walk and there is a Dominick's (grocery store) only a block away. Only con was wireless was $10/day... Would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Waters07
Reviews.Content: The DoubleTree Hotel Chicago at Magnificent Mile is not only a great hotel with an excellent staff but it 's location to everything is the best part. Places like the John Hancock Building, Mike's Ditka's bar, The Chicago Chop House (best steakhouse in Chicago), Lucky Strike Bowling, Shopping Malls, Millenium Park, Navy Pier and so on are about a 15 minute walk. Everything else is a 10-15 minute cab ride.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely done”
Reviews.Author: zippernek
Reviews.Content: Stayed at DoubleTree for company meeting and was very pleased with choice. Meeting room was sufficient, food and food service was excellent, room was clean, spacious and modern. Guest services were friendly and professional. Hotel is walking distance to shopping on Michigan Avenue and countless first-quality restaurants and tourist related attractions. At $200 a night, don't know if I'd stay there when travelling with family but would welcome the opportunity to stay there again when it's on the company dime.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Marce_LCh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the DoubleTree for 5 nights and I think it is a pretty good hotel. The staff is friendly and want to help, but have their mistakes from time to time. The rooms are spacious and clean but have some details that betray the fact is a renovated hotel (old TV, noisy AC, no safe in the rooms) but everything else (carpets, bathrooms, desk, beds) is new and very clean. The bed is super comfortable. The hotelâ€™s location is very good for shopping and eating, if you are more into museums it is better to find something in the Loop. Other reviews said the elevators were very slow, I didnâ€™t have any problems there. What I didnâ€™t like is that they charge the use of computers in the business center.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Branigan
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff were friendly and helpful, and housekeeping did an excellent job every day. There are signs that it's an older property; in our room there was water damage to the bathroom ceiling and some grime in hard-to-reach corners, though in general the hotel was impeccably clean and our room perfectly comfortable. Great location at the intersection of E. Ohio St. and Fairbanks Ct, lots of shops and resturants nearby, Magnificent Mile just two blocks west, and hotel is within easy walking distance of bus and subway (helpful as parking at the hotel is $38/day). Perhaps a bit pricey (we paid $236.55/night for a Thursday-to-Monday stay), but worth it to us -- your milage, of course, may vary. Overall, great service in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Vey handy for shopping.”
Reviews.Author: Quinion
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on a tour. The hotel is very smart and is situated close to the shopping area and Navy Pier. Our room on the 7th floor was big and comfortable. The only small minus point was the very powerful air conditioning unit â€“ it was so powerful that it tended to wake us up overnight each time the fan started. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. There is an Einstein Bros. Bagel Shop off the hotel lobby which we found to be very adequate for a light breakfast.

HotelInfo.Name: Doubletree Hotel Chicago-Magnificent Mile
HotelInfo.Address: 300 East Ohio Street, Chicago, IL 60611
